Text

One may as well begin with [Helen]245-helen 's letters to [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister . [Howards End]339-margaret , Tuesday . [Dearest Meg]246-margaret , It is n't going to be what [we]546-we expected . [It]547-it is old and little , and altogether delightful — red brick . [We]546-we can scarcely pack in as it is , and [the dear]548-the dear knows what will happen when [Paul]247-paul ( [younger son]549-younger son ) arrives tomorrow . From [hall]550-hall [you]551-you go right or left into [dining - room]552-dining - room or [drawing - room]553-drawing - room . [Hall]550-hall [itself]550-hall is practically [a room]555-a room . [You]551-you open another door in [it]550-hall , and there are the stairs going up in a sort of tunnel to the first - floor . [Three bedrooms]556-three bedrooms in a row there , and [three attics in a row above]557-three attics in a row above . That is n't all [the house]558-the house really , but it 's all that [one]559-one notices — nine windows as [you]551-you look up from [the front garden]560-the front garden . Then there 's a very big wych - elm — to the left as [you]551-you look up — leaning a little over [the house]558-the house , and standing on the boundary between [the garden]562-the garden and meadow . [I]0-i quite love that tree already . Also ordinary elms , oaks — no nastier than ordinary oaks — pear - trees , apple - trees , and a vine . No silver birches , though . However , [I]0-i must get on to [[my]0-i host]563-my host and [hostess]564-hostess . [I]0-i only wanted to show that it is n't the least what [we]565-we expected . Why did [we]565-we settle that [[their]566-their house]567-their house would be all gables and wiggles , and [[their]566-their garden]568-their garden all gamboge - coloured paths ? [I]0-i believe simply because [we]565-we associate them with [expensive hotels]569-expensive hotels — [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox trailing in beautiful dresses down [long corridors]570-long corridors , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles bullying [porters]571-porters , etc . [We]565-we females are that unjust . [I]0-i shall be back Saturday ; will let [you]572-you know train later . [They]566-their are as angry as [I]0-i am that [you]572-you did not come too ; really [Tibby]250-tibby is too tiresome , [he]250-tibby starts a new mortal disease every month . How could [he]250-tibby have got hay fever in [London]2-london ? and even if [he]250-tibby could , it seems hard that [you]572-you should give up a visit to hear [a schoolboy]573-a schoolboy sneeze . Tell [him]250-tibby that [Charles Wilcox]249-charles ( [the son who is [here]575-here]574-the son who is here ) has hay fever too , but [he]250-tibby 's brave , and gets quite cross when [we]565-we inquire after it . [Men like [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes]576-men like the wilcoxes would do [Tibby]250-tibby a power of good . But [you]572-you wo n't agree , and [I]0-i 'd better change the subject . This long letter is because [I]0-i 'm writing before breakfast . Oh , the beautiful vine leaves ! [The house]558-the house is covered with a vine . [I]0-i looked out earlier , and [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox was already in [the garden]562-the garden . [She]248-mrs. wilcox evidently loves it . No wonder [she]248-mrs. wilcox sometimes looks tired . [She]248-mrs. wilcox was watching the large red poppies come out . Then [she]248-mrs. wilcox walked off [the lawn]579-the lawn to [the meadow]580-the meadow , whose corner to the right [I]0-i can just see . [Trail]252-trail , trail , went [her]248-mrs. wilcox long dress over the sopping grass , and [she]248-mrs. wilcox came back with [her]248-mrs. wilcox hands full of the hay that was cut yesterday — [I]0-i suppose for rabbits or something , as [she]248-mrs. wilcox kept on smelling it . The air here is delicious . Later on [I]0-i heard the noise of croquet balls , and looked out again , and it was [Charles Wilcox]249-charles practising ; [they]581-they are keen on all games . Presently [he]249-charles started sneezing and had to stop . Then [I]0-i hear more clicketing , and it is [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles practising , and then , ' a - tissue , a - tissue ' : [he]249-charles has to stop too . Then [Evie]253-evie comes out , and does some calisthenic exercises on a machine that is tacked on to a greengage - tree — [they]581-they put everything to use — and then [she]253-evie says ' a - tissue , ' and in [she]253-evie goes . And finally [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox reappears , trail , trail , still smelling hay and looking at the flowers . [I]0-i inflict all this on [you]582-you because once [you]582-you said that life is sometimes life and sometimes only a drama , and [one]559-one must learn to distinguish t'other from which , and up to now [I]0-i have always put that down as ' [Meg]246-margaret 's clever nonsense . ' But this morning , it really does seem not life but a play , and it did amuse [me]0-i enormously to watch the W 's . Now [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox has come in . [I]0-i am going to wear [ omission ] . Last night [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox wore an [ omission ] , and [Evie]253-evie [ omission ] . So it is n't exactly a go - as - [you]582-you - please place , and if [you]582-you shut [your]582-you eyes it still seems the wiggly hotel that [we]584-we expected . Not if [you]582-you open them . The dog - roses are too sweet . There is a great hedge of them over [the lawn]579-the lawn — magnificently tall , so that they fall down in garlands , and nice and thin at the bottom , so that [you]582-you can see ducks through it and a cow . These belong to [the farm]586-the farm , which is [the only house near [us]584-we]587-the only house near us . There goes the breakfast gong . Much love . [Modified]254-modified love to [Tibby]250-tibby . Love to [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley ; how good of [her]255-aunt juley to come and keep [you]582-you company , but what a bore . Burn this . Will write again Thursday . [Helen Howards]245-helen End , Friday . [Dearest Meg]246-margaret , [I]0-i am having a glorious time . [I]0-i like [them]588-them all . [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox , if quieter than in [Germany]3-germany , is sweeter than ever , and [I]0-i never saw anything like [her]248-mrs. wilcox steady unselfishness , and the best of it is that [the others]589-the others do not take advantage of [her]248-mrs. wilcox . [They]588-them are [the very happiest , jolliest family that [you]582-you can imagine]590-the very happiest , jolliest family that you can imagine . [I]0-i do really feel that [we]591-we are making [friends]592-friends . The fun of it is that [they]593-they think [me]0-i [a noodle]594-a noodle , and say so — at least [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles does — and when that happens , and [one]559-one does n't mind , it 's a pretty sure test , is n't it ? [He]249-charles says the most horrid things about [women]596-women 's suffrage so nicely , and when [I]0-i said [I]0-i believed in equality [he]249-charles just folded [his]249-charles arms and gave [me]0-i such a setting down as [I]0-i 've never had . [Meg]246-margaret , shall [we]591-we ever learn to talk less ? [I]0-i never felt so ashamed of [myself]0-i in [my]0-i life . [I]0-i could n't point to a time when [men]597-men had been equal , nor even to a time when the wish to be equal had made [them]597-men happier in other ways . [I]0-i could n't say a word . [I]0-i had just picked up the notion that equality is good from some book — probably from poetry , or [you]598-you . Anyhow , it 's been knocked into pieces , and , like [all people who are really strong]599-all people who are really strong , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles did it without hurting [me]0-i . On the other hand , [I]0-i laugh at [them]597-men for catching hay fever . [We]591-we live like fighting - cocks , and [Charles]249-charles takes [us]591-we out every day in the motor — [a tomb with trees in [it]600-a tomb with trees in it]600-a tomb with trees in it , [[a hermit]601-a hermit 's house]602-a hermit 's house , [a wonderful road]603-a wonderful road that was made by [the Kings of [Mercia]4-mercia]604-the kings of mercia — tennis — a cricket match — bridge — and at night [we]591-we squeeze up in [this lovely house]605-this lovely house . [The whole clan]606-the whole clan 's here now — it 's like [a rabbit warren]607-a rabbit warren . [Evie]253-evie is [a dear]608-a dear . [They]597-men want [me]0-i to stop over Sunday — [I]0-i suppose it wo n't matter if [I]0-i do . Marvellous weather and the view 's marvellous — views westward to [the high ground]609-the high ground . Thank [you]610-you for [your]610-you letter . Burn this . [Your]610-you affectionate [Helen]245-helen Howards End , Sunday . Dearest , dearest [Meg,—I]256-meg,—i do not know what [you]610-you will say : [Paul]247-paul and [I]0-i are in love — [the younger son who only came here Wednesday]611-the younger son who only came here wednesday . [Margaret]246-margaret glanced at [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister 's note and pushed it over the breakfast - table to [[her]246-margaret aunt]613-her aunt . There was a moment 's hush , and then the flood - gates opened . " [I]613-her aunt can tell [you]613-her aunt nothing , [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley . [I]613-her aunt know no more than [you]613-her aunt do . [We]3660-we met — [we]3660-we only met [the father]3661-the father and [mother]3662-mother abroad last spring . [I]613-her aunt know so little that [I]613-her aunt did n't even know [[their]3663-their son]3664-their son 's name . It 's all so — "[613-her aunt] [She]613-her aunt waved [her]613-her aunt hand and laughed a little . " In that case it is far too sudden . "[613-her aunt] " Who knows , [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley , who knows ? "[613-her aunt] " But , [Margaret]246-margaret dear , [I]613-her aunt mean [we]3660-we must n't be unpractical now that [we]3660-we 've come to facts . It is too sudden , surely . "[613-her aunt] " Who knows ! "[613-her aunt] " But [Margaret]246-margaret dear — "[613-her aunt] " [I]246-margaret 'll go for [her]255-aunt juley other letters , "[246-margaret] said [Margaret]246-margaret . " No , [I]246-margaret wo n't , [I]246-margaret 'll finish [my]246-margaret breakfast . In fact , [I]246-margaret have n't them . [We]3660-we met [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes on an awful expedition that [we]3660-we made from [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg to [Speyer]6-speyer . [Helen]245-helen and [I]246-margaret had got it into [our]3660-we heads that there was [a grand old cathedral at [Speyer]6-speyer]3665-a grand old cathedral at speyer — [the Archbishop of [Speyer]6-speyer]3666-the archbishop of speyer was one of the seven electors — [you]3667-you know—'Speyer , [Maintz]7-maintz , and [Köln]257-köln . ' [Those three sees]3668-those three sees once commanded [the Rhine Valley]3669-the rhine valley and got it the name of [Priest Street]8-priest street . "[246-margaret] " [I]613-her aunt still feel quite uneasy about this business , [Margaret]246-margaret . "[613-her aunt] " [The train]3670-the train crossed by [a bridge of boats]3671-a bridge of boats , and at first sight [it]3670-the train looked quite fine . But oh , in five minutes [we]3660-we had seen the whole thing . [The cathedral]3672-the cathedral had been ruined , absolutely ruined , by restoration ; not an inch left of [the original structure]3673-the original structure . [We]3660-we wasted a whole day , and came across [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes as [we]3660-we were eating [our]3660-we sandwiches in [the public gardens]3674-the public gardens . [They]251-the wilcoxes too , poor things , had been taken in — [they]251-the wilcoxes were actually stopping at [Speyer]6-speyer — and [they]251-the wilcoxes rather liked [Helen]245-helen insisting that [they]251-the wilcoxes must fly with [us]3660-we to [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg . As a matter of fact , [they]251-the wilcoxes did come on next day . [We]3660-we all took some drives together . [They]251-the wilcoxes knew [us]3660-we well enough to ask [Helen]245-helen to come and see [them]251-the wilcoxes — at least , [I]246-margaret was asked too , but [Tibby]250-tibby 's illness prevented [me]246-margaret , so last Monday [she]245-helen went alone . That 's all . [You]3675-you know as much as [I]246-margaret do now . It 's [a young man out the unknown]3676-a young man out the unknown . [She]245-helen was to have come back Saturday , but put off till Monday , perhaps on account of — [I]246-margaret do n't know . [She]245-helen broke off , and listened to the sounds of a [London]2-london morning . [[Their]251-the wilcoxes house]567-their house was in [Wickham Place]9-wickham place , and fairly quiet , for [a lofty promontory of [buildings]3679-buildings]3678-a lofty promontory of buildings separated [it]567-their house from [the main thoroughfare]3680-the main thoroughfare . [One]559-one had the sense of [a backwater]3682-a backwater , or rather of [an estuary , whose waters flowed in from the invisible sea]3683-an estuary , whose waters flowed in from the invisible sea , and ebbed into a profound silence while the waves without were still beating . Though [the promontory]3684-the promontory consisted of [flats]3685-flats — expensive , with [cavernous entrance halls , full of [concierges and palms]3687-concierges and palms]3686-cavernous entrance halls , full of concierges and palms — [it]3684-the promontory fulfilled [its]3684-the promontory purpose , and gained for [the older houses]3688-the older houses opposite a certain measure of peace . These , too , would be swept away in time , and [another promontory]3689-another promontory would rise upon [[their]251-the wilcoxes site]3690-their site , as humanity piled itself higher and higher on [the precious soil of [London]2-london]3691-the precious soil of london . [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt had [her]258-mrs. munt own method of interpreting [[her]258-mrs. munt nieces]3692-her nieces . [She]258-mrs. munt decided that [Margaret]246-margaret was a little hysterical , and was trying to gain time by a torrent of talk . Feeling very diplomatic , [she]258-mrs. munt lamented the fate of [Speyer]6-speyer , and declared that never , never should [she]258-mrs. munt be so misguided as to visit [it]6-speyer , and added of [her]258-mrs. munt own accord that the principles of restoration were ill understood in [Germany]3-germany . "[246-margaret] [The Germans]614-the germans , " [she]258-mrs. munt said , "[613-her aunt] are too thorough , and this is all very well sometimes , but at other times it does not do . " "[246-margaret] Exactly , " said [Margaret]246-margaret ; "[260-germans] [Germans]260-germans are too thorough . " And [her]246-margaret eyes began to shine . "[260-germans] Of course [I]0-i regard [you]615-you [Schlegels]261-the schlegels as English , " said [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt hastily—"English[0-i] to the backbone . " [Margaret]246-margaret leaned forward and stroked [her]246-margaret hand . "[0-i] And that reminds [me]0-i — [Helen]245-helen 's letter — " "[245-helen] Oh , yes , [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley , [I]0-i am thinking all right about [Helen]245-helen 's letter . [She]258-mrs. munt passed through [the South Welwyn Tunnel]696-the south welwyn tunnel , saw light for a moment , and entered [the North Welwyn Tunnel]27-the north welwyn tunnel , of tragic fame . [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt soon recovered . [She]258-mrs. munt possessed to a remarkable degree the power of distorting the past , and before many days were over [she]258-mrs. munt had forgotten the part played by [her]258-mrs. munt own imprudence in the catastrophe . "[258-mrs. munt] which during the journey to [London]2-london evolved into , " It had to be gone through by [someone]3777-someone , "[258-mrs. munt] which in its turn ripened into the permanent form of " The one time [I]258-mrs. munt really did help [[Emily]266-emily 's girls]3778-emily 's girls was over the Wilcox business . "[258-mrs. munt] But [Helen]245-helen was [a more serious patient]799-a more serious patient . New ideas had burst upon [her]245-helen like a thunder clap , and by [them]800-them and by [her]245-helen reverberations [she]245-helen had been stunned . The truth was that [she]245-helen had fallen in love , not with [an individual]801-an individual , but with [a family]802-a family . Before [Paul]247-paul arrived [she]245-helen had , as it were , been tuned up into [his]247-paul key . The energy of [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes had fascinated [her]245-helen , had created new images of beauty in [her]245-helen responsive mind . To be all day with [them]251-the wilcoxes in the open air , to sleep at night under [their]251-the wilcoxes roof , had seemed the supreme joy of life , and had led to that abandonment of personality that is a possible prelude to love . [She]245-helen had liked giving in to [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles , or [Evie]253-evie , or [Charles]249-charles ; [she]245-helen had liked being told that [her]245-helen notions of life were sheltered or academic ; that Equality was nonsense , Votes for [Women]596-women nonsense , Socialism nonsense , Art and Literature , except when conducive to strengthening the character , nonsense . One by one [the Schlegel fetiches]245-helen had been overthrown , and , though professing to defend [them]251-the wilcoxes , [she]245-helen had rejoiced . When [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles said that [one sound man of business]804-one sound man of business did more good to [the world]805-the world than [a dozen of [[your]807-your social reformers]808-your social reformers]806-a dozen of your social reformers , [she]245-helen had swallowed the curious assertion without a gasp , and had leant back luxuriously among the cushions of [[his]249-charles motor - car]809-his motor - car . When [Charles]249-charles said , " Why be so polite to [servants]3779-servants ? [they]3779-servants do n't understand it , "[249-charles] [she]245-helen had not given the Schlegel retort of , " If [they]3779-servants do n't understand it , [I]245-helen do . "[245-helen] No ; [she]245-helen had vowed to be less polite to [servants]3779-servants in the future . " [I]245-helen am swathed in ca nt , "[245-helen] [she]245-helen thought , " and it is good for [me]245-helen to be stripped of it . "[245-helen] And all that [she]245-helen thought or did or breathed was a quiet preparation for [Paul]247-paul . [Paul]247-paul was inevitable . [Charles]249-charles was taken up with [another girl]811-another girl , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles was so old , [Evie]253-evie so young , [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox so different . Round [the absent brother]812-the absent brother [she]245-helen began to throw the halo of Romance , to irradiate [him]812-the absent brother with all the splendour of those happy days , to feel that in [him]812-the absent brother [she]245-helen should draw nearest to the robust ideal . [He]812-the absent brother and [she]245-helen were about the same age , [Evie]253-evie said . [Most people]813-most people thought [Paul]247-paul handsomer than [[his]247-paul brother]814-his brother . [He]247-paul was certainly a better shot , though not so good at golf . And when [Paul]247-paul appeared , flushed with the triumph of getting through an examination , and ready to flirt with [any pretty girl]815-any pretty girl , [Helen]245-helen met [him]247-paul halfway , or more than halfway , and turned towards [him]247-paul on the Sunday evening . [He]247-paul had been talking of [his]247-paul approaching exile in [Nigeria]33-nigeria , and [he]247-paul should have continued to talk of it , and allowed [[their]816-their guest]817-their guest to recover . But the heave of [her]245-helen bosom flattered [him]247-paul . Passion was possible , and [he]247-paul became passionate . Deep down in [him]247-paul something whispered , " [This girl]3780-this girl would let [you]247-paul kiss [her]3780-this girl ; [you]247-paul might not have such a chance again . "[247-paul] That was " how it happened , "[247-paul] or , rather , how [Helen]245-helen described it to [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister , using words even more unsympathetic than [my]0-i own . But the poetry of that kiss , the wonder of it , the magic that there was in life for hours after it — who can describe that ? It is so easy for [an Englishman]819-an englishman to sneer at these chance collisions of [human beings]820-human beings . To [the insular cynic]821-the insular cynic and [the insular moralist]822-the insular moralist [they]823-they offer an equal opportunity . It is so easy to talk of " passing emotion , "[822-the insular moralist] and how to forget how vivid the emotion was ere it passed . [Our]824-we impulse to sneer , to forget , is at root a good one . [We]824-we recognize that emotion is not enough , and that [men]597-men and [women]596-women are personalities capable of sustained relations , not mere opportunities for an electrical discharge . Yet [we]824-we rate the impulse too highly . [We]824-we do not admit that by collisions of this trivial sort the doors of [heaven]827-heaven may be shaken open . To [Helen]245-helen , at all events , [her]245-helen life was to bring nothing more intense than the embrace of [this boy who played no part in it]828-this boy who played no part in it . [He]828-this boy who played no part in it had drawn [her]245-helen out of [the house]558-the house , where there was danger of surprise and light ; [he]828-this boy who played no part in it had led [her]245-helen by a path [he]828-this boy who played no part in it knew , until [they]830-they stood under the column of [the vast wych - elm]831-the vast wych - elm . [A man in the darkness]832-a man in the darkness , [he]828-this boy who played no part in it had whispered " [I]828-this boy who played no part in it love [you]245-helen "[828-this boy who played no part in it] when [she]245-helen was desiring love . In time [his]828-this boy who played no part in it slender personality faded , the scene that [he]828-this boy who played no part in it had evoked endured . In all the variable years that followed [she]245-helen never saw the like of it again . " [I]828-this boy who played no part in it understand , "[828-this boy who played no part in it] said [Margaret—"at]273-margaret—"at least , [I]828-this boy who played no part in it understand as much as ever is understood of these things . [Margaret]246-margaret saw horror latent in the scene , and [Helen]245-helen 's next remark did not surprise [her]246-margaret . " Somehow , when [that kind of man]3783-that kind of man looks frightened it is too awful . When [I]245-helen saw [all the others]3788-all the others so placid , and [Paul]247-paul mad with terror in case [I]245-helen said the wrong thing , [I]245-helen felt for a moment that [the whole Wilcox family]3789-the whole wilcox family was a fraud , just a wall of newspapers and [motor - cars]703-motor - cars and [golf - clubs]3791-golf - clubs , and that if it fell [I]245-helen should find nothing behind it but panic and emptiness . "[245-helen] " [I]828-this boy who played no part in it do n't think that . "[828-this boy who played no part in it] " No , [I]245-helen do n't really think that . But [Paul]247-paul was so broad - shouldered ; all kinds of extraordinary things made it worse , and [I]245-helen knew that it would never do — never . [I]245-helen said to [him]247-paul after breakfast , when [the others]589-the others were practising strokes , ' [We]589-the others rather lost [our]589-the others heads , ' and [he]247-paul looked better at once , though frightfully ashamed . [He]247-paul began a speech about having no money to marry on , but it hurt [him]247-paul to make it , and [I]245-helen — stopped [him]247-paul . Then [he]247-paul said , ' [I]245-helen must beg [your]245-helen pardon over this , [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ; [I]245-helen ca n't think what came over [me]245-helen last night . ' And [I]245-helen said , ' Nor what over [me]245-helen ; never mind . ' And then [we]589-the others parted — at least , until [I]245-helen remembered that [I]245-helen had written straight off to tell [you]245-helen the night before , and that frightened [him]247-paul again . [I]245-helen asked [him]247-paul to send a telegram for [me]245-helen , for [he]247-paul knew [you]245-helen would be coming or something ; and [he]247-paul tried to get hold of [the motor]771-the motor , but [Charles]249-charles and [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles wanted it to go to [the station]3708-the station ; and [Charles]249-charles offered to send the telegram for [me]245-helen , and then [I]245-helen had to say that the telegram was of no consequence , for [Paul]247-paul said [Charles]249-charles might read it , and though [I]245-helen wrote it out several times , [he]247-paul always said [people]3797-people would suspect something . [He]247-paul took it [himself]247-paul at last , pretending that [he]247-paul must walk down to get cartridges , and , what with one thing and the other , it was not handed in at [the Post Office]3798-the post office until too late . It was the most terrible morning . [Paul]247-paul disliked [me]245-helen more and more , and [Evie]253-evie talked cricket averages till [I]245-helen nearly screamed . [I]245-helen can not think how [I]245-helen stood [her]253-evie all the other days . Ugh ! but it has been a disgusting business . To think that — "[835-i] [She]835-i sighed . " To think that because [you]245-helen and [a young man]3805-a young man meet for a moment , there must be all these telegrams and anger , "[246-margaret] supplied [Margaret]246-margaret . [Helen]245-helen nodded . " [I]245-helen 've often thought about it , [Helen]245-helen . It 's one of the most interesting things in [the world]805-the world . The truth is that there is a great outer life that [you]245-helen and [I]245-helen have never touched — a life in which telegrams and anger count . Personal relations , that [we]3807-we think supreme , are not supreme there . There love means marriage settlements , death , death duties . So far [I]245-helen 'm clear . But here [my]245-helen difficulty . This outer life , though obviously horrid , often seems [the real one]3808-the real one — there 's grit in it . It does breed character . Do personal relations lead to sloppiness in the end ? "[245-helen] " Oh , [Meg]246-margaret , that 's what [I]245-helen felt , only not so clearly , when [the Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes were so competent , and seemed to have [their]3809-the wilcoxes hands on all the ropes . " [I]245-helen shall never forget [him]247-paul . [He]247-paul had nothing to fall back upon . [I]245-helen know that personal relations are the real life , for ever and ever . "[245-helen] Amen ! " So [the Wilcox episode]3810-the wilcox episode fell into the background , leaving behind it memories of sweetness and horror that mingled , and [the sisters]833-the sisters pursued the life that [Helen]245-helen had commended . [They]833-the sisters talked to [each other]834-each other and to [other people]3813-other people , [they]833-the sisters filled [the tall thin house at [Wickham Place]9-wickham place]3814-the tall thin house at wickham place with [those whom [they]833-the sisters liked or could befriend]3815-those whom they liked or could befriend . [They]833-the sisters even attended public meetings . In [their]833-the sisters own fashion [they]833-the sisters cared deeply about politics , though not as [politicians]700-politicians would have [us]3817-us care ; [they]833-the sisters desired that public life should mirror whatever is good in the life within . Temperance , tolerance , and sexual equality were intelligible cries to [them]833-the sisters ; whereas [they]833-the sisters did not follow [our]3817-us Forward Policy in [Thibet]35-thibet with the keen attention that it merits , and would at times dismiss [the whole British Empire]3818-the whole british empire with a puzzled , if reverent , sigh . Not out of [them]833-the sisters are the shows of history erected : [the world]805-the world would be [a grey , bloodless place]3820-a grey , bloodless place were it entirely composed of [Miss Schlegels]261-the schlegels . But [the world]805-the world being what it is , perhaps [they]833-the sisters shine out in it like stars . A word on [their]833-the sisters origin . [They]833-the sisters were not "[245-helen] English to the backbone , " as [[their]833-the sisters aunt]685-their aunt had piously asserted . But , on the other band , [they]833-the sisters were not "[245-helen] [Germans of the dreadful sort]836-germans of the dreadful sort . " [[Their]833-the sisters father]3823-their father had belonged to a type that was more prominent in [Germany]3-germany fifty years ago than now . [He]3823-their father was not [the aggressive German]3824-the aggressive german , so dear to [the English journalist]3825-the english journalist , nor the domestic German , so dear to [the English wit]3826-the english wit . If one classed [him]3823-their father at all it would be as [the countryman of [Hegel]3828-hegel and [Kant]274-kant]3827-the countryman of hegel and kant , as [the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose Imperialism was the Imperialism of the air]3829-the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose imperialism was the imperialism of the air . Not that [his]3823-their father life had been inactive . [He]3823-their father had fought like blazes against [Denmark]36-denmark , [Austria]37-austria , [France]38-france . But [he]3823-their father had fought without visualizing the results of victory . A hint of the truth broke on [him]3823-their father after [Sedan]275-sedan , when [he]3823-their father saw the dyed moustaches of [Napoleon]276-napoleon going grey ; another when [he]3823-their father entered [Paris]39-paris , and saw the smashed windows of [the Tuileries]40-the tuileries . Peace came — it was all very immense , one had turned into [an Empire]3830-an empire — but [he]3823-their father knew that some quality had vanished for which not all [Alsace - Lorraine]41-alsace - lorraine could compensate [him]3823-their father . [Germany]3-germany [a commercial Power]3831-a commercial power , [Germany]3-germany [a naval Power]3832-a naval power , [[Germany]3-germany with [colonies here]3834-colonies here and a Forward Policy [there]3835-there]3833-germany with colonies here and a forward policy there , and legitimate aspirations in [the other place]3836-the other place , might appeal to [others]3837-others , and be fitly served by [them]3837-others ; for [his]3823-their father own part , [he]3823-their father abstained from the fruits of victory , and naturalized [himself]3823-their father in [England]31-england . [The more earnest members of [[his]3823-their father family]3839-his family]3838-the more earnest members of his family never forgave [him]3823-their father , and knew that [[his]3823-their father children]3840-his children , though [scarcely English of the dreadful sort]3841-scarcely english of the dreadful sort , would never be German to the backbone . [He]3823-their father had obtained work in [one of [[our]3843-our provincial Universities]3844-our provincial universities]3842-one of our provincial universities , and there married [Poor Emily]266-emily ( or Die Engländerin as the case may be ) , and as [she]266-emily had money , [they]3845-they proceeded to [London]2-london , and came to know [a good many people]3846-a good many people . But [his]3823-their father gaze was always fixed beyond [the sea]3847-the sea . It was [his]3823-their father hope that the clouds of materialism obscuring [the Fatherland]277-the fatherland would part in time , and the mild intellectual light re - emerge . "[836-germans of the dreadful sort] Do [you]837-you imply that [we]838-we [Germans]260-germans are stupid , [Uncle Ernst]278-uncle ernst ? " exclaimed [a haughty and magnificent nephew]3848-a haughty and magnificent nephew . [Uncle Ernst]278-uncle ernst replied , "[837-you] To [my]0-i mind . [You]837-you use the intellect , but [you]837-you no longer care about it . That [I]0-i call stupidity . " As [the haughty nephew]3849-the haughty nephew did not follow , [he]0-i continued , "[0-i] [You]837-you only care about the ' things that [you]837-you can use , and therefore arrange them in the following order : Money , supremely useful ; intellect , rather useful ; imagination , of no use at all . No"—for [the other]3850-the other had protested—"your[0-i] Pan - Germanism is no more imaginative than is [[our]838-we Imperialism]839-our imperialism over here . It is the vice of a vulgar mind to be thrilled by bigness , to think that a thousand square miles are a thousand times more wonderful than one square mile , and that a million square miles are almost the same as heaven . That is not imagination . No , it kills it . When [[their]840-their poets]841-their poets over here try to celebrate bigness [they]840-their are dead at once , and naturally . [[Your]837-you poets]842-your poets too are dying , [[your]837-you philosophers]843-your philosophers , [[your]837-you musicians]844-your musicians , to whom [Europe]42-europe has listened for two hundred years . Gone . Gone with [the little courts that nurtured [them]840-their]845-the little courts that nurtured them — gone with [Esterhaz]279-esterhaz and [Weimar]280-weimar . What ? What 's that ? [[Your]837-you Universities]846-your universities ? Oh , yes , [you]837-you have [learned men]847-learned men , who collect more facts than do [the learned men of [England]31-england]848-the learned men of england . [They]847-learned men collect facts , and facts , and empires of facts . But which of [them]847-learned men will rekindle the light within ? " To all this [Margaret]246-margaret listened , sitting on [the haughty nephew]3849-the haughty nephew 's knee . It was a unique education for [the little girls]3852-the little girls . [The haughty nephew]3849-the haughty nephew would be at [Wickham Place]9-wickham place one day , bringing with [him]3849-the haughty nephew [an even haughtier wife]3854-an even haughtier wife , both convinced that [Germany]3-germany was appointed by [God]281-god to govern [the world]805-the world . [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley would come the next day , convinced that [Great Britain]3856-great britain had been appointed to the same post by [the same authority]3857-the same authority . Were both [these loud - voiced parties]3858-these loud - voiced parties right ? On one occasion [they]849-they had met , and [Margaret]246-margaret with clasped hands had implored [them]849-they to argue the subject out in [her]246-margaret presence . Whereat [they]849-they blushed , and began to talk about the weather . "[282-papa] [Papa]282-papa " [she]246-margaret cried — [she]246-margaret was [a most offensive child—"why]3859-a most offensive child—"why[849-they] will [they]849-they not discuss this most clear question ? " [[Her]246-margaret father]3860-her father , surveying the parties grimly , replied that [he]3860-her father did not know . Putting [her]246-margaret head on one side , [Margaret]246-margaret then remarked , "[849-they] To [me]0-i one of two things is very clear ; either [God]281-god does not know [his]281-god own mind about [England]31-england and [Germany]3-germany , or else these do not know the mind of [God]281-god . " [A hateful little girl]3861-a hateful little girl , but at thirteen [she]246-margaret had grasped a dilemma that [most people]813-most people travel through life without perceiving . [Her]246-margaret brain darted up and down ; it grew pliant and strong . [Her]246-margaret conclusion was , that [any human being]3863-any human being lies nearer to the unseen than [any organization]3864-any organization , and from this [she]246-margaret never varied . [Helen]245-helen advanced along the same lines , though with a more irresponsible tread . In character [she]245-helen resembled [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister , but [she]245-helen was pretty , and so apt to have a more amusing time . [People]3797-people gathered round [her]245-helen more readily , especially when [they]3797-people were [new acquaintances]3867-new acquaintances , and [she]245-helen did enjoy a little homage very much . When [[their]3797-people father]3823-their father died and [they]3797-people ruled alone at [Wickham Place]9-wickham place , [she]245-helen often absorbed the whole of [the company]3869-the company , while [Margaret]246-margaret — [both]3870-both were [tremendous talkers]3871-tremendous talkers — fell flat . [Neither sister]3872-neither sister bothered about this . [Helen]245-helen never apologized afterwards , [Margaret]246-margaret did not feel the slightest rancour . But looks have [their]3797-people influence upon character . [The sisters]833-the sisters were alike as [little girls]3874-little girls , but at the time of the Wilcox episode [their]833-the sisters methods were beginning to diverge ; [the younger]3714-the younger was rather apt to entice [people]3797-people , and , in enticing [them]3797-people , to be [herself]3714-the younger enticed ; [the elder]3713-the elder went straight ahead , and accepted an occasional failure as part of the game . Little need be premised about [Tibby]250-tibby . [He]250-tibby was now [an intelligent man of sixteen]3878-an intelligent man of sixteen , but dyspeptic and difficile . It will be generally admitted that [Beethoven]283-beethoven 's Fifth Symphony is the most sublime noise that has ever penetrated into the ear of [man]3767-man . All sorts and conditions are satisfied by it . Whether [you]3880-you are like [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt , and tap surreptitiously when the tunes come — of course , not so as to disturb [the others]589-the others — ; or like [Helen]245-helen , who can see [heroes and shipwrecks in the music]3882-heroes and shipwrecks in the music 's flood ; or like [Margaret]246-margaret , who can only see the music ; or like [Tibby]250-tibby , who is profoundly versed in counterpoint , and holds the full score open on [his]250-tibby knee ; or like [[their]833-the sisters cousin]3883-their cousin , [Fräulein Mosebach]284-fräulein mosebach , who remembers all the time that [Beethoven]283-beethoven is "[281-god] echt Deutsch " ; or like [[Fräulein Mosebach]284-fräulein mosebach 's young man , who can remember nothing but [Fräulein Mosebach]284-fräulein mosebach]3884-fräulein mosebach 's young man , who can remember nothing but fräulein mosebach : in any case , the passion of [your]3880-you life becomes more vivid , and [you]3880-you are bound to admit that such a noise is cheap at two shillings . It is cheap , even if [you]3880-you hear it in [the Queen 's Hall]3885-the queen 's hall , [dreariest music - room in [London]2-london]3886-dreariest music - room in london , though not as dreary as [the Free Trade Hall]3887-the free trade hall , [Manchester]43-manchester ; and even if [you]3880-you sit on the extreme left of [that hall]3888-that hall , so that the brass bumps at [you]3880-you before the rest of [the orchestra]3889-the orchestra arrives , it is still cheap . "[281-god] Who is [Margaret]246-margaret talking to ? " said [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt , at the conclusion of the first movement . [She]258-mrs. munt was again in [London]2-london on a visit to [Wickham Place]9-wickham place . [Helen]245-helen looked down the long line of [[their]3890-their party]3891-their party , and said that [she]245-helen did not know . "[246-margaret] Would it be [some young man]850-some young man or other whom [she]246-margaret takes an interest in ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i expect so , " [Helen]245-helen replied . Music enwrapped [her]245-helen , and [she]245-helen could not enter into the distinction that divides young men whom one takes an interest in from [young men whom one]3892-young men whom one knows . "[0-i] [[You]851-you girls]852-you girls are so wonderful in always having — Oh dear ! [one]559-one must n't talk . " For [the Andante]285-the andante had begun — very beautiful , but bearing a family likeness to all the other beautiful Andantes that [Beethoven]283-beethoven had written , and , to [Helen]245-helen 's mind , rather disconnecting the heroes and shipwrecks of the first movement from [the heroes and goblins of the third]3893-the heroes and goblins of the third . [She]245-helen heard the tune through once , and then [her]245-helen attention wandered , and [she]245-helen gazed at [the audience]3894-the audience , or the organ , or the architecture . Much did [she]245-helen censure the attenuated Cupids who encircle the ceiling of [the Queen 's Hall]3885-the queen 's hall , inclining each to each with vapid gesture , and clad in sallow pantaloons , on which the October sunlight struck . "[559-one] How awful to marry [a man like those Cupids]854-a man like those cupids ! " thought [Helen]245-helen . Here [Beethoven]283-beethoven started decorating [his]283-beethoven tune , so [she]245-helen heard [him]283-beethoven through once more , and then [she]245-helen smiled at [[her]245-helen cousin]3896-her cousin [Frieda]286-frieda . But [Frieda]286-frieda , listening to Classical Music , could not respond . [Herr Liesecke]287-herr liesecke , too , looked as if wild horses could not make [him]287-herr liesecke inattentive ; there were lines across [his]287-herr liesecke forehead , [his]287-herr liesecke lips were parted , [his]287-herr liesecke pince - nez at right angles to [his]287-herr liesecke nose , and [he]287-herr liesecke had laid a thick , white hand on either knee . And next to [her]245-helen was [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley , so [British]288-british , and wanting to tap . How interesting that row of [people]3797-people was ! What diverse influences had gone to the making ! Here [Beethoven]283-beethoven , after humming and hawing with great sweetness , said "[559-one] Heigho , " and the Andante came to an end . Applause , and a round of "[559-one] wunderschöning " and "[559-one] prachtvolleying " from [the German contingent]3898-the german contingent . [Margaret]246-margaret started talking to [[her]246-margaret new young man]3899-her new young man ; [Helen]245-helen said to [[her]245-helen aunt]613-her aunt : "[559-one] Now comes the wonderful movement : first of [all the goblins]855-all the goblins , and then a trio of elephants dancing ; " and [Tibby]250-tibby implored [the company]3869-the company generally to look out for the transitional passage on the drum . "[559-one] On the what , [dear]629-dear ? " "[559-one] On the drum , [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley . " "[255-aunt juley] No ; look out for the part where [you]857-you think [you]857-you have done with [the goblins]858-the goblins and [they]858-the goblins come back , " breathed [Helen]245-helen , as the music started with [a goblin]3902-a goblin walking quietly over [the universe]3903-the universe , from end to end . [Others]3837-others followed [him]3902-a goblin . [They]3837-others were [not aggressive creatures]3905-not aggressive creatures ; it was that that made [them]3837-others so terrible to [Helen]245-helen . [They]3837-others merely observed in passing that there was no such thing as splendour or heroism in [the world]805-the world . After the interlude of elephants dancing , [they]3837-others returned and made the observation for the second time . [Helen]245-helen could not contradict [them]3837-others , for , once at all events , [she]245-helen had felt the same , and had seen the reliable walls of [youth]3907-youth collapse . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! [The goblins]858-the goblins were right . [[Her]245-helen brother]3702-her brother raised [his]3702-her brother finger : it was the transitional passage on the drum . For , as if things were going too far , [Beethoven]283-beethoven took hold of [the goblins]858-the goblins and made [them]858-the goblins do what [he]283-beethoven wanted . [He]283-beethoven appeared in person . [He]283-beethoven gave [them]858-the goblins a little push , and [they]858-the goblins began to walk in major key instead of in a minor , and then — [he]283-beethoven blew with [his]283-beethoven mouth and [they]858-the goblins were scattered ! Gusts of splendour , [gods]3911-gods and demigods contending with vast swords , colour and fragrance broadcast on the field of battle , magnificent victory , magnificent death ! Oh , it all burst before [the girl]3912-the girl , and [she]3912-the girl even stretched out [her]3912-the girl gloved hands as if it was tangible . Any fate was titanic ; any contest desirable ; conqueror and conquered would alike be applauded by the angels of the utmost stars . And [the goblins]858-the goblins — [they]858-the goblins had not really been there at all ? [They]858-the goblins were only [the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief]3914-the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief ? One healthy human impulse would dispel [them]858-the goblins ? [Men like [the Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes]576-men like the wilcoxes , or [President Roosevelt]289-president roosevelt , would say yes . [Beethoven]283-beethoven knew better . [The goblins]858-the goblins really had been there . [They]858-the goblins might return — and [they]858-the goblins did . It was as if the splendour of life might boil over — and waste to steam and froth . In its dissolution one heard the terrible , ominous note , and [a goblin]3902-a goblin , with increased malignity , walked quietly over [the universe]3903-the universe from end to end . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! Even the flaming ramparts of [the world]805-the world might fall . [Beethoven]283-beethoven chose to make all right in the end . [He]283-beethoven built [the ramparts]3921-the ramparts up . [He]283-beethoven blew with [his]283-beethoven mouth for the second time , and again [the goblins]858-the goblins were scattered . [He]283-beethoven brought back the gusts of splendour , the heroism , [the youth]3923-the youth , the magnificence of life and of death , and , amid vast roarings of a superhuman joy , [he]283-beethoven led [his]283-beethoven Fifth Symphony to its conclusion . But [the goblins]858-the goblins were there . [They]858-the goblins could return . [He]283-beethoven had said so bravely , and that is why [one]559-one can trust [Beethoven]283-beethoven when [he]283-beethoven says other things . [Helen]245-helen pushed [her]245-helen way out during the applause . [She]245-helen desired to be alone . The music summed up to [her]245-helen all that had happened or could happen in [her]245-helen career . [She]245-helen read it as a tangible statement , which could never be superseded . The notes meant this and that to [her]245-helen , and they could have no other meaning , and life could have no other meaning . [She]245-helen pushed right out of [the building]3926-the building , and walked slowly down [the outside staircase]3927-the outside staircase , breathing the autumnal air , and then [she]245-helen strolled [home]3928-home . "[857-you] [Margaret]246-margaret , " called [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt , "[246-margaret] is [Helen]245-helen all right ? " "[245-helen] Oh yes . " "[245-helen] [She]245-helen is always going away in the middle of a programme , " said [Tibby]250-tibby . "[245-helen] The music has evidently moved [her]245-helen deeply , " said [Fräulein Mosebach]284-fräulein mosebach . " "[859-that lady] Oh , good gracious [me]0-i ! — [I]0-i am so sorry . [Tibby]250-tibby , run after [Helen]245-helen . " "[250-tibby] [I]0-i shall miss the Four Serious Songs if [I]0-i do . The Four Serious Songs had begun , and [one]559-one could not move during [their]3932-their performance . "[860-my sister] Not at all , " replied [the young man]739-the young man ; but [his]739-the young man voice was dead and cold . Then the Four Serious Songs rang shallow in [Margaret]246-margaret 's ears . [Brahms]290-brahms , for all [his]290-brahms grumbling and grizzling , had never guessed what it felt like to be suspected of stealing an umbrella . For [this fool of [a young man]3805-a young man]3934-this fool of a young man thought that [she]246-margaret and [Helen]245-helen and [Tibby]250-tibby had been playing the confidence trick on [him]290-brahms , and that if [he]290-brahms gave [his]290-brahms address [they]3936-they would break into [[his]290-brahms rooms]3937-his rooms some midnight or other and steal [his]290-brahms walkingstick too . [Most ladies]3938-most ladies would have laughed , but [Margaret]246-margaret really minded , for it gave [her]246-margaret a glimpse into squalor . To trust [people]3797-people is a luxury in which only [the wealthy]3940-the wealthy can indulge ; [the poor]3941-the poor can not afford it . " [His]290-brahms face brightened a little when [he]290-brahms saw that [Wickham Place]9-wickham place was W. "[0-i] [I]0-i do in a way remember the passage , [Tibby]250-tibby , but when every instrument is so beautiful , it is difficult to pick out one thing rather than another . "[255-aunt juley] Of course [I]0-i do not go in for being musical , " [she]258-mrs. munt added , the shot failing . "[0-i] [I]0-i only care for music — a very different thing . But still [I]0-i will say this for [myself]0-i — [I]0-i do know when [I]0-i like a thing and when [I]0-i do n't . [Some people]882-some people are the same about pictures . [They]882-some people can go into [a picture gallery]883-a picture gallery — [Miss Conder]294-miss conder can — and say straight off what [they]882-some people feel , all round the wall . [I]0-i never could do that . But music is so different to pictures , to [my]0-i mind . When it comes to music [I]0-i am as safe as [houses]884-houses , and [I]0-i assure [you]885-you , [Tibby]250-tibby , [I]0-i am by no means pleased by everything . There was a thing — something about a faun in French — which [Helen]245-helen went into ecstasies over , but [I]0-i thought it most tinkling and superficial , and said so , and [I]0-i held to [my]0-i opinion too . " "[0-i] Do [you]250-tibby agree ? " asked [Margaret]246-margaret . "[250-tibby] Do [you]250-tibby think music is so different to pictures ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i should have thought so , kind of , " [he]250-tibby said . "[0-i] So should [I.]0-i Now , [[my]0-i sister]860-my sister declares [they]887-they 're just the same . [We]888-we have great arguments over it . [She]860-my sister says [I]0-i 'm dense ; [I]0-i say [she]860-my sister 's sloppy . " Getting under way , [she]860-my sister cried : "[860-my sister] Now , does n't it seem absurd to [you]250-tibby ? What is the good of the Arts if they are interchangeable ? What is the good of the ear if it tells [you]250-tibby the same as the eye ? [Helen]245-helen 's one aim is to translate tunes into the language of painting , and pictures into the language of music . It 's very ingenious , and [she]245-helen says several pretty things in the process , but what 's gained , [I]0-i 'd like to know ? Oh , it 's all rubbish , radically false . If [Monet]295-monet 's really [Debussy]296-debussy , and [Debussy]296-debussy 's really [Monet]295-monet , [neither gentleman]889-neither gentleman is worth [his]889-neither gentleman salt — that 's [my]0-i opinion . Evidently [these sisters]890-these sisters quarrelled . " Now , this very symphony that [we]888-we 've just been having — [she]245-helen wo n't let it alone . [She]245-helen labels it with meanings from start to finish ; turns it into literature . [I]891-an unhappy family wonder if the day will ever return when music will be treated as music . Yet [I]891-an unhappy family do n't know . There 's [[my]891-an unhappy family brother]3963-my brother — behind [us]888-we . [He]3963-my brother treats music as music , and oh , [my]891-an unhappy family goodness ! [He]3963-my brother makes [me]891-an unhappy family angrier than [anyone]3964-anyone , simply furious . With [him]3963-my brother [I]891-an unhappy family dare n't even argue . "[891-an unhappy family] [An unhappy family]891-an unhappy family , if talented . " But , of course , [the real villain]3965-the real villain is [Wagner]297-wagner . [He]297-wagner has done more than [any man in the nineteenth century]3966-any man in the nineteenth century towards the muddling of arts . [I]892-i do feel that music is in a very serious state just now , though extraordinarily interesting . Every now and then in history there do come these terrible geniuses , like [Wagner]297-wagner , who stir up all the wells of thought at once . For a moment it 's splendid . Such a splash as never was . But afterwards — such a lot of mud ; and the wells — as it were , [they]3967-they communicate with each other too easily now , and not one of them will run quite clear . That 's what [Wagner]297-wagner 's done . "[892-i] [Her]892-i speeches fluttered away from [the young man]739-the young man like birds . If only [he]739-the young man could talk like this , [he]739-the young man would have caught [the world]805-the world . Oh to acquire culture ! Oh , to pronounce foreign names correctly ! Oh , to be well informed , discoursing at ease on every subject that [a lady]3956-a lady started ! But it would take one years . With an hour at lunch and a few shattered hours in the evening , how was it possible to catch up with [leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood]896-leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood ? [His]739-the young man brain might be full of names , [he]739-the young man might have even heard of [Monet]295-monet and [Debussy]296-debussy ; the trouble was that [he]739-the young man could not string them together into a sentence , [he]739-the young man could not make [them]897-them " tell , "[739-the young man] [he]739-the young man could not quite forget about [his]739-the young man stolen umbrella . Yes , the umbrella was the real trouble . Behind [Monet]295-monet and [Debussy]296-debussy the umbrella persisted , with the steady beat of a drum . " [I]739-the young man suppose [my]739-the young man umbrella will be all right , "[739-the young man] [he]739-the young man was thinking . " [I]739-the young man do n't really mind about it . [I]739-the young man will think about music instead . [I]739-the young man suppose [my]739-the young man umbrella will be all right . "[739-the young man] Earlier in the afternoon [he]739-the young man had worried about seats . Ought [he]739-the young man to have paid as much as two shillings ? Earlier still [he]739-the young man had wondered , " Shall [I]739-the young man try to do without a programme ? "[739-the young man] There had always been something to worry [him]739-the young man ever since [he]739-the young man could remember , always something that distracted [him]739-the young man in the pursuit of beauty . For [he]739-the young man did pursue beauty , and therefore , [Margaret]246-margaret 's speeches did flutter away from [him]739-the young man like birds . [Margaret]246-margaret talked ahead , occasionally saying , " Do n't [you]739-the young man think so ? do n't [you]739-the young man feel the same ? "[246-margaret] And once [she]246-margaret stopped , and said " Oh , do interrupt [me]246-margaret ! "[246-margaret] which terrified [him]739-the young man . [She]246-margaret did not attract [him]739-the young man , though [she]246-margaret filled [him]739-the young man with awe . [Her]246-margaret figure was meagre , [her]246-margaret face seemed all teeth and eyes , [her]246-margaret references to [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister and [brother]899-brother were uncharitable . For all [her]246-margaret cleverness and culture , [she]246-margaret was probably one of [those soulless , atheistical women who have been so shown up by [Miss Corelli]298-miss corelli]900-those soulless , atheistical women who have been so shown up by miss corelli . It was surprising ( and alarming ) that [she]246-margaret should suddenly say , " [I]246-margaret do hope that [you]739-the young man 'll come in and have some tea . "[246-margaret] " [I]246-margaret do hope that [you]739-the young man 'll come in and have some tea . [We]901-we should be so glad . To the right of the fantastic skyline of [the flats]903-the flats towered black against the hues of evening ; to the left [the older houses]3688-the older houses raised a square - cut , irregular parapet against the grey . " That reminds [me]924-the three women , [Margaret]246-margaret . [We]926-we might have taken [that young man]3988-that young man into [the dining - room]3782-the dining - room , at all events . Only the majolica plate — and that is so firmly set in the wall . [I]924-the three women am really distressed that [he]3988-that young man had no tea . "[924-the three women] For that little incident had impressed [the three women]924-the three women more than might be supposed . It remained as a goblin football , as a hint that all is not for the best in the best of all possible worlds , and that beneath these superstructures of wealth and art there wanders [an ill - fed boy]925-an ill - fed boy , who has recovered [his]925-an ill - fed boy umbrella indeed , but who has left no address behind [him]925-an ill - fed boy , and no name . [We]926-we are not concerned with [the very poor]927-the very poor . [They]927-the very poor are unthinkable , and only to be approached by [the statistician]928-the statistician or [the poet]929-the poet . This story deals with [gentlefolk]930-gentlefolk , or with those who are obliged to pretend that [they]930-gentlefolk are [gentlefolk]930-gentlefolk . [The boy]722-the boy , [Leonard Bast]308-leonard , stood at the extreme verge of gentility . [He]722-the boy was not in [the abyss]933-the abyss , but [he]722-the boy could see it , and at times [people whom [he]722-the boy knew]934-people whom he knew had dropped in , and counted no more . [He]722-the boy knew that [he]722-the boy was poor , and would admit it : [he]722-the boy would have died sooner than confess any inferiority to [the rich]935-the rich . This may be splendid of [him]722-the boy . But [he]722-the boy was inferior to [most rich people]936-most rich people , there is not the least doubt of it . [He]722-the boy was not as courteous as [the average rich man]937-the average rich man , nor as intelligent , nor as healthy , nor as lovable . [His]722-the boy mind and [his]722-the boy body had been alike underfed , because [he]722-the boy was poor , and because [he]722-the boy was modern [they]938-they were always craving better food . Had [he]722-the boy lived some centuries ago , in the brightly coloured civilizations of the past , [he]722-the boy would have had a definite status , [his]722-the boy rank and [his]722-the boy income would have corresponded . But in [his]722-the boy day [the angel of Democracy]939-the angel of democracy had arisen , enshadowing [the classes with leathern wings]940-the classes with leathern wings , and proclaiming , " [All men]4020-all men are equal — [all men]4020-all men , that is to say , who possess umbrellas , "[722-the boy] and so [he]722-the boy was obliged to assert gentility , lest [he]722-the boy slipped into the abyss where nothing counts , and the statements of Democracy are inaudible . As [he]722-the boy walked away from [Wickham Place]9-wickham place , [his]722-the boy first care was to prove that [he]722-the boy was as good as [the Miss Schlegels]261-the schlegels . Obscurely wounded in [his]722-the boy pride , [he]722-the boy tried to wound [them]938-they in return . [They]938-they were probably not [ladies]941-ladies . Would [real ladies]942-real ladies have asked [him]722-the boy to tea ? [They]942-real ladies were certainly ill - natured and cold . At each step [his]722-the boy feeling of superiority increased . Would [a real lady]943-a real lady have talked about stealing an umbrella ? Perhaps [they]938-they were [thieves]944-thieves after all , and if [he]722-the boy had gone into [the house]558-the house [they]938-they could have clapped a chloroformed handkerchief over [his]722-the boy face . [He]722-the boy walked on complacently as far as [the Houses of Parliament]946-the houses of parliament . There an empty stomach asserted itself , and told [him]722-the boy [he]722-the boy was [a fool]3760-a fool . " Evening , [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast . "[3760-a fool] " Evening , [Mr. Dealtry]310-mr. dealtry . "[310-mr. dealtry] " Nice evening . "[3760-a fool] " Evening . "[310-mr. dealtry] [Mr. Dealtry]310-mr. dealtry , [a fellow clerk]948-a fellow clerk , passed on , and [Leonard]308-leonard stood wondering whether [he]722-the boy would take [the tram]949-the tram as far as a penny would take [him]722-the boy , or whether [he]722-the boy would walk . [He]722-the boy decided to walk — it is no good giving in , and [he]722-the boy had spent money enough at [Queen 's Hall]47-queen 's hall — and [he]722-the boy walked over [Westminster Bridge]50-westminster bridge , in front of [St. Thomas 's Hospital]51-st. thomas 's hospital , and through [the immense tunnel that passes under [the South - Western main line]951-the south - western main line at [Vauxhall]52-vauxhall]950-the immense tunnel that passes under the south - western main line at vauxhall . In [the tunnel]952-the tunnel [he]722-the boy paused and listened to the roar of [the trains]953-the trains . A sharp pain darted through [his]722-the boy head , and [he]722-the boy was conscious of the exact form of [his]722-the boy eye sockets . [He]722-the boy pushed on for another mile , and did not slacken speed until [he]722-the boy stood at the entrance of [a road called [Camelia Road]53-camelia road]954-a road called camelia road , which was at present [[his]722-the boy home]955-his home . Here [he]722-the boy stopped again , and glanced suspiciously to right and left , like a rabbit that is going to bolt into its hole . [A block of flats]956-a block of flats , constructed with extreme cheapness , towered on either hand . Farther down [the road]957-the road [two more blocks]958-two more blocks were being built , and beyond these [an old house]959-an old house was being demolished to accommodate [another pair]960-another pair . It was the kind of scene that may be observed all over [London]2-london , whatever [the locality]961-the locality — bricks and mortar rising and falling with the restlessness of the water in a fountain , as [the city]962-the city receives more and more men upon [[her]962-the city soil]963-her soil . [Camelia Road]53-camelia road would soon stand out like [a fortress]964-a fortress , and command , for a little , an extensive view . Only for a little . Plans were out for the erection of [flats in [Magnolia Road]54-magnolia road]965-flats in magnolia road also . And again a few years , and [all the flats in [either road]967-either road]966-all the flats in either road might be pulled down , and [new buildings]968-new buildings , of a vastness at present unimaginable , might arise where they had fallen . "[308-leonard] Then [Leonard]308-leonard entered [[Block B]55-block b of [the flats]903-the flats]969-block b of the flats , and turned , not [upstairs]3701-upstairs , but down , into what is known to [house]972-house [agents]973-agents as [a semi - basement]974-a semi - basement , and to [other men]975-other men as [a cellar]976-a cellar . [He]308-leonard opened the door , and cried " Hullo ! "[308-leonard] with the pseudo - geniality of [the Cockney]312-the cockney . There was no reply . " Hullo ! "[308-leonard] [he]308-leonard repeated . [The sitting - room]977-the sitting - room was empty , though the electric light had been left burning . A look of relief came over [his]308-leonard face , and [he]308-leonard flung [himself]308-leonard into the armchair . [The sitting - room]977-the sitting - room contained , besides the armchair , two other chairs , a piano , a three - legged table , and a cosy corner . Of the walls , one was occupied by the window , the other by a draped mantelshelf bristling with Cupids . Opposite the window was the door , and beside the door a bookcase , while over the piano there extended one of the masterpieces of [Maud Goodman]313-maud goodman . It was an amorous and not unpleasant little hole when the curtains were drawn , and the lights turned on , and the gas - stove unlit . But it struck that shallow makeshift note that is so often heard in [the modem dwelling - place]979-the modem dwelling - place . It had been too easily gained , and could be relinquished too easily . As [Leonard]308-leonard was kicking off [his]308-leonard boots [he]308-leonard jarred the three - legged table , and a photograph frame , honourably poised upon it , slid sideways , fell off into the fireplace , and smashed . [He]308-leonard swore in a colourless sort of way , and picked the photograph up . It represented [a young lady called [Jacky]314-jacky]980-a young lady called jacky , and had been taken at the time when [young ladies called [Jacky]314-jacky]981-young ladies called jacky were often photographed with [their]981-young ladies called jacky mouths open . Teeth of dazzling whiteness extended along either of [Jacky]314-jacky 's jaws , and positively weighted [her]980-a young lady called jacky head sideways , so large were they and so numerous . Take [my]0-i word for it , that smile was simply stunning , and it is only [you]982-you and [I]0-i who will be fastidious , and complain that true joy begins in the eyes , and that the eyes of [Jacky]314-jacky did not accord with [her]980-a young lady called jacky smile , but were anxious and hungry . [Leonard]308-leonard tried to pull out the fragments of glass , and cut [his]308-leonard fingers and swore again . A drop of blood fell on the frame , another followed , spilling over on to the exposed photograph . [He]308-leonard swore more vigorously , and dashed to [the kitchen]983-the kitchen , where [he]308-leonard bathed [his]308-leonard hands . [The kitchen]983-the kitchen was the same size as [the sitting room]985-the sitting room ; through [it]983-the kitchen was [a bedroom]986-a bedroom . This completed [[his]308-leonard home]955-his home . [He]308-leonard was renting [the flat furnished]988-the flat furnished : of all the objects that encumbered [it]988-the flat furnished none were [his]308-leonard own except the photograph frame , the Cupids , and the books . " Damn , damn , damnation ! "[308-leonard] [he]308-leonard murmured , together with such other words as [he]308-leonard had learnt from [older men]989-older men . Then [he]308-leonard raised [his]308-leonard hand to [his]308-leonard forehead and said , " Oh , damn it all — "[308-leonard] which meant something different . [He]308-leonard pulled [himself]308-leonard together . [He]308-leonard drank a little tea , black and silent , that still survived upon an upper shelf . [He]308-leonard swallowed some dusty crumbs of cake . Then [he]308-leonard went back to [the sitting - room]977-the sitting - room , settled [himself]308-leonard anew , and began to read a volume of [Ruskin]315-ruskin . " Seven miles to [the north of [Venice]56-venice]4023-the north of venice — "[308-leonard] How perfectly the famous chapter opens ! How supreme its command of admonition and of poetry ! [The rich man]991-the rich man is speaking to [us]992-us from [his]991-the rich man gondola . " Seven miles to [the north of [Venice]56-venice]4023-the north of venice the banks of sand which nearer [the city]962-the city rise little above low - water mark attain by degrees a higher level , and knit themselves at last into [fields of salt morass]4026-fields of salt morass , raised here and there into shapeless mounds , and intercepted by [narrow creeks of sea]4027-narrow creeks of sea . "[991-the rich man] [Leonard]308-leonard was trying to form [his]308-leonard style on [Ruskin]315-ruskin : [he]308-leonard understood [him]315-ruskin to be the greatest master of English Prose . [He]308-leonard read forward steadily , occasionally making a few notes . " Let [us]992-us consider a little each of these characters in succession , and first ( for of the shafts enough has been said already ) , what is very peculiar to [this church]4028-this church — its luminousness . "[308-leonard] Was there anything to be learnt from this fine sentence ? Could [he]308-leonard adapt it to the needs of daily life ? Could [he]308-leonard introduce it , with modifications , when [he]308-leonard next wrote a letter to [[his]308-leonard brother]814-his brother , [the lay - reader]994-the lay - reader ? For example — " Let [us]992-us consider a little each of these characters in succession , and first ( for of the absence of ventilation enough has been said already ) , what is very peculiar to [this flat]4029-this flat — its obscurity . "[308-leonard] Something told [him]308-leonard that the modifications would not do ; and that something , had [he]308-leonard known it , was the spirit of English Prose . " [[My]308-leonard flat]4030-my flat is dark as well as stuffy . "[308-leonard] Those were the words for [him]308-leonard . And the voice in the gondola rolled on , piping melodiously of Effort and Self - Sacrifice , full of high purpose , full of beauty , full even of sympathy and the love of [men]597-men , yet somehow eluding all that was actual and insistent in [Leonard]308-leonard 's life . For it was the voice of one who had never been dirty or hungry , and had not guessed successfully what dirt and hunger are . [Leonard]308-leonard listened to it with reverence . [He]308-leonard felt that [he]308-leonard was being done good to , and that if [he]308-leonard kept on with [Ruskin]315-ruskin , and [[the Queen]996-the queen 's Hall Concerts]997-the queen 's hall concerts , and some pictures by [Watts]316-watts , [he]308-leonard would one day push [his]308-leonard head out of [the grey waters]998-the grey waters and see [the universe]3903-the universe . [He]308-leonard believed in sudden conversion , a belief which may be right , but which is peculiarly attractive to a half - baked mind . It is the bias of much popular religion : in the domain of business it dominates the Stock Exchange , and becomes that " bit of luck "[308-leonard] by which all successes and failures are explained . " If only [I]308-leonard had a bit of luck , the whole thing would come straight . . . . [He]308-leonard 's got [a most magnificent place down at [Streatham]57-streatham]4031-a most magnificent place down at streatham and a 20 h.-p . Fiat , but then , mind [you]4032-you , [he]308-leonard 's had luck . . . . [I]308-leonard 'm sorry [the wife]3793-the wife 's so late , but [she]3793-the wife never has any luck over catching [trains]4034-trains . "[308-leonard] [Leonard]308-leonard was superior to [these people]1000-these people ; [he]308-leonard did believe in effort and in a steady preparation for the change that [he]308-leonard desired . But of a heritage that may expand gradually , [he]308-leonard had no conception : [he]308-leonard hoped to come to [Culture]317-culture suddenly , much as the Revivalist hopes to come to [Jesus]58-jesus . [Those Miss Schlegels]261-the schlegels had come to it ; [they]1000-these people had done the trick ; [their]1000-these people hands were upon the ropes , once and for all . And meanwhile , [[his]308-leonard flat]1001-his flat was dark , as well as stuffy . Presently there was a noise on the staircase . [He]308-leonard shut up [Margaret]246-margaret 's card in the pages of [Ruskin]315-ruskin , and opened the door . [A woman]1002-a woman entered , of whom it is simplest to say that [she]1002-a woman was not respectable . [Her]1002-a woman appearance was awesome . [She]1002-a woman seemed all strings and bell - pulls — ribbons , chains , bead necklaces that clinked and caught — and a boa of azure feathers hung round [her]1002-a woman neck , with the ends uneven . [Her]1002-a woman throat was bare , wound with a double row of pearls , [her]1002-a woman arms were bare to the elbows , and might again be detected at the shoulder , through cheap lace . [Her]1002-a woman hat , which was flowery , resembled those punnets , covered with flannel , which [we]1003-we sowed with mustard and cress in [our]1003-we childhood , and which germinated here yes , and there no . [She]1002-a woman wore it on the back of [her]1002-a woman head . As for [her]1002-a woman hair , or rather hairs , they are too complicated to describe , but one system went down [her]1002-a woman back , lying in a thick pad there , while another , created for a lighter destiny , rippled around [her]1002-a woman forehead . The face — the face does not signify . [It]1004-it was the face of the photograph , but older , and the teeth were not so numerous as [the photographer]1005-the photographer had suggested , and certainly not so white . Yes , [Jacky]314-jacky was past [her]1002-a woman prime , whatever that prime may have been . [She]1002-a woman was descending quicker than [most women]1006-most women into the colourless years , and the look in [her]1002-a woman eyes confessed it . " What ho ! "[308-leonard] said [Leonard]308-leonard , greeting [that apparition]1007-that apparition with much spirit , and helping it off with its boa . "[1025-she] [They]1027-they began with a soup square , which [Leonard]308-leonard had just dissolved in some hot water . "[1049-the wilcox family] That [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt should be the first to discover the misfortune was not remarkable , for [she]258-mrs. munt was so interested in [the flats]903-the flats , that [she]258-mrs. munt watched [their]903-the flats every mutation with unwearying care . It 's dead , and [she]245-helen 'll never be troubled with it again . The only things that matter are the things that interest [one]559-one . " [I]246-margaret also have the honour to inform [you]629-dear that [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes are bored with [us]4056-we . "[246-margaret] [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt assumed a cryptic air . [I]0-i vow ' tis [[my]0-i brother]3963-my brother . [0 crimini]1126-0 crimini ! " [A male]4107-a male — even such a male as [Tibby]250-tibby — was enough to stop the foolery . The barrier of sex , though decreasing among [the civilized]4108-the civilized , is still high , and higher on the side of [women]596-women . [Helen]245-helen could tell [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister all , and [[her]245-helen cousin]3896-her cousin much about [Paul]247-paul ; [she]245-helen told [[her]245-helen brother]3702-her brother nothing . It was not prudishness , for [she]245-helen now spoke of "[332-the wilcox] [the Wilcox]332-the wilcox ideal " with laughter , and even with a growing brutality . Nor was it precaution , for [Tibby]250-tibby seldom repeated any news that did not concern [himself]250-tibby . It was rather the feeling that [she]245-helen betrayed a secret into [the camp of [men]597-men]4113-the camp of men , and that , however trivial it was on this side of the barrier , it would become important on that . So [she]245-helen stopped , or rather began to fool on other subjects , until [[her]245-helen long - suffering relatives]4115-her long - suffering relatives drove [her]245-helen [upstairs]3701-upstairs . " "[1127-she] Yes , [I]0-i know ; thanks very much . " "[1127-she] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i did right to tell [you]0-i . " "[0-i] Ever so many thanks . " "[0-i] What 's that ? " asked [Tibby]250-tibby . [No one]693-no one told [him]250-tibby , and [he]250-tibby proceeded into [the dining - room]3782-the dining - room , to eat Elvas plums . That evening [Margaret]246-margaret took decisive action . [The house]558-the house was very quiet , and the fog — [we]4120-we are in [November]62-november now — pressed against the windows like an excluded ghost . [Frieda]326-frieda and [Helen]245-helen and all [their]4121-their luggage had gone . [Tibby]250-tibby , who was not feeling well , lay stretched on a sofa by the fire . [Margaret]246-margaret sat by [him]250-tibby , thinking . [Her]246-margaret mind darted from impulse to impulse , and finally marshalled [them]4122-them all in review . [The practical person]4123-the practical person , who knows what [he]250-tibby wants at once , and generally knows nothing else , will excuse [her]246-margaret of indecision . But this was the way [her]246-margaret mind worked . And when [she]246-margaret did act , [no one]693-no one could accuse [her]246-margaret of indecision then . [She]246-margaret hit out as lustily as if [she]246-margaret had not considered the matter at all . The letter that [she]246-margaret wrote [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox glowed with the native hue of resolution . The pale cast of thought was with [her]246-margaret a breath rather than a tarnish , a breath that leaves the colours all the more vivid when it has been wiped away . [Dear Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox , [I]0-i have to write something discourteous . It would be better if [we]4125-we did not meet . Both [[my]0-i sister]860-my sister and [[my]0-i aunt]4127-my aunt have given displeasure to [[your]510-mrs. wilcox family]4128-your family , and , in [[my]0-i sister]860-my sister 's case , the grounds for displeasure might recur . As far as [I]0-i know , [she]860-my sister no longer occupies [her]860-my sister thoughts with [[your]510-mrs. wilcox son]4130-your son . But it would not be fair , either to [her]860-my sister or to [you]510-mrs. wilcox , if [they]4125-we met , and it is therefore right that [our]4125-we acquaintance which began so pleasantly , should end . [I]0-i fear that [you]510-mrs. wilcox will not agree with this ; indeed , [I]0-i know that [you]510-mrs. wilcox will not , since [you]510-mrs. wilcox have been good enough to call on [us]4125-we . [I]0-i write without [her]860-my sister knowledge , and [I]0-i hope that [you]510-mrs. wilcox will not associate [her]860-my sister with [my]0-i discourtesy . Believe [me]0-i , [Yours]510-mrs. wilcox truly , [M. J. Schlegel Margaret]246-margaret sent this letter round by post . All [her]246-margaret absurd anxieties fell to the ground , and in their place arose the certainty that [she]246-margaret had been rude to [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox . Rudeness affected [Margaret]335-margaret like a bitter taste in the mouth . It poisoned life . At times it is necessary , but woe to [those who employ it without due need]4133-those who employ it without due need . [She]335-margaret flung on a hat and shawl , just like [a poor woman]4134-a poor woman , and plunged into the fog , which still continued . To be humble and kind , to go straight ahead , to love [people]3797-people rather than pity [them]3797-people , to remember the submerged — well , one ca n't do all these things at once , worse luck , because they 're so contradictory .
