"[510-mrs. wilcox] [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox can not be accused of giving [Margaret]339-margaret much information about life . And [Margaret]339-margaret , on the other hand , has made a fair show of modesty , and has pretended to an inexperience that [she]339-margaret certainly did not feel . [She]339-margaret had kept [house]972-house for over ten years ; [she]339-margaret had entertained , almost with distinction ; [she]339-margaret had brought up [a charming sister]1151-a charming sister , and was bringing up [a brother]1152-a brother . Surely , if experience is attainable , [she]339-margaret had attained it . Yet the little luncheon - party that [she]339-margaret gave in [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox 's honour was not a success . [The new friend]1153-the new friend did not blend with the " one or two delightful people "[1153-the new friend] who had been asked to meet [her]339-margaret , and the atmosphere was one of polite bewilderment . [Her]339-margaret tastes were simple , [her]339-margaret knowledge of culture slight , and [she]339-margaret was not interested in [the New English Art Club]1154-the new english art club , nor in the dividing - line between Journalism and Literature , which was started as a conversational hare . " People at [Stettin]44-stettin drop things into [boats]4194-boats out of [overhanging warehouses]4195-overhanging warehouses . [The river]4199-the river , or rather rivers — there seem to be dozens of them — are intense blue , and the plain they run through an intensest green . "[339-margaret] " Indeed ! That sounds like a most beautiful view , [Miss Schlegel]245-helen . "[339-margaret] " So [I]339-margaret say , but [Helen]245-helen , who will muddle things , says no , it 's like music . The course of [the Oder]70-the oder is to be like music . It 's obliged to remind [her]245-helen of a symphonic poem . The part by the landing - stage is in B minor , if [I]339-margaret remember rightly , but lower down things get extremely mixed . There is a slodgy theme in several keys at once , meaning [mud - banks]4200-mud - banks , and another for [the navigable canal]4201-the navigable canal , and the exit into [the Baltic]71-the baltic is in C sharp major , pianissimo . " [They]4202-the overhanging warehouses make a great deal of it , "[339-margaret] replied [Margaret]339-margaret , unexpectedly rushing off on a new track . " [I]339-margaret think it 's affectation to compare the Oder to music , and so do [you]339-margaret , but [the overhanging warehouses of [Stettin]44-stettin]4203-the overhanging warehouses of stettin take beauty seriously , which [we]4204-we do n't , and [the average Englishman]4205-the average englishman does n't , and despises all who do . Several days passed . Was [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox one of [the unsatisfactory people]1208-the unsatisfactory people — there are many of [them]1208-the unsatisfactory people — who dangle intimacy and then withdraw it ? [They]1208-the unsatisfactory people evoke [our]1209-our interests and affections , and keep the life of the spirit dawdling round [them]1208-the unsatisfactory people . Then [they]1208-the unsatisfactory people withdraw . When physical passion is involved , there is a definite name for such behaviour — flirting — and if carried far enough it is punishable by law . But no law — not public opinion even — punishes [those who coquette with friendship]1210-those who coquette with friendship , though the dull ache that [they]1208-the unsatisfactory people inflict , the sense of misdirected effort and exhaustion , may be as intolerable . Was [she]510-mrs. wilcox one of these ? [Margaret]339-margaret feared so at first , for , with [a Londoner]1211-a londoner 's impatience , [she]339-margaret wanted everything to be settled up immediately . [She]339-margaret mistrusted the periods of quiet that are essential to true growth . "[510-mrs. wilcox] [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox was silenced . In growing discomfort [they]1253-they drove homewards . [The city]962-the city seemed Satanic , [the narrower streets]1255-the narrower streets oppressing like the galleries of [a mine]1256-a mine . No harm was done by the fog to trade , for [it]1257-it lay high , and the lighted windows of [the shops]1258-the shops were thronged with [customers]1259-customers . It was rather a darkening of the spirit which fell back upon itself , to find a more grievous darkness within . [Margaret]339-margaret nearly spoke a dozen times , but something throttled [her]339-margaret . [She]339-margaret felt petty and awkward , and [her]339-margaret meditations on Christmas grew more cynical . Peace ? It may bring other gifts , but is there [a single Londoner to whom Christmas is peaceful]1260-a single londoner to whom christmas is peaceful ? The craving for excitement and for elaboration has ruined that blessing . Goodwill ? Had [she]339-margaret seen any example of it in [the hordes of [purchasers]1262-purchasers]1261-the hordes of purchasers ? Or in [herself]339-margaret . [She]339-margaret had failed to respond to this invitation merely because it was a little queer and imaginative — [she]339-margaret , whose birthright it was to nourish imagination ! Better to have accepted , to have tired [themselves]1253-they a little by the journey , than coldly to reply , " Might [I]339-margaret come some other day ? "[339-margaret] [Her]339-margaret cynicism left [her]339-margaret . There would be no other day . [This shadowy woman]1263-this shadowy woman would never ask [her]339-margaret again . [They]1264-they parted at [the Mansions]1265-the mansions . [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox went in after due civilities , and [Margaret]339-margaret watched [the tall , lonely figure]1266-the tall , lonely figure sweep up [the hall]907-the hall to [the lift]1268-the lift . As the glass doors closed on it [she]339-margaret had the sense of an imprisonment . The beautiful head disappeared first , still buried in the muff , the long trailing skirt followed . [A woman of undefinable rarity]1269-a woman of undefinable rarity was going up [heaven - ward]1270-heaven - ward , like a specimen in a bottle . And into what a heaven — a vault as of hell , sooty black , from which soots descended ! At lunch [[her]339-margaret brother]3702-her brother , seeing [her]339-margaret inclined for silence , insisted on talking . [Tibby]250-tibby was not ill - natured , but from babyhood something drove [him]250-tibby to do the unwelcome and the unexpected . Now [he]250-tibby gave [her]339-margaret a long account of the day - school that [he]250-tibby sometimes patronized . The account was interesting , and [she]339-margaret had often pressed [him]250-tibby for it before , but [she]339-margaret could not attend now , for [her]339-margaret mind was focussed on the invisible . [She]339-margaret discerned that [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox , though [a loving wife]1272-a loving wife and [mother]3662-mother , had only one passion in life — [[her]510-mrs. wilcox house]1274-her house — and that the moment was solemn when [she]339-margaret invited [a friend]1212-a friend to share this passion with [her]339-margaret . To answer " another day "[3760-a fool] was to answer as [a fool]3760-a fool . " Another day "[3760-a fool] will do for brick and mortar , but not for the Holy of Holies into which [Howards End]339-margaret had been transfigured . [Her]339-margaret own curiosity was slight . [She]339-margaret had heard more than enough about it in the summer . The nine windows , the vine , and the wych - elm had no pleasant connections for [her]339-margaret , and [she]339-margaret would have preferred to spend the afternoon at a concert . But imagination triumphed . While [[her]339-margaret brother]3702-her brother held forth [she]339-margaret determined to go , at whatever cost , and to compel [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox to go , too . When lunch was over [she]339-margaret stepped over to [the flats]903-the flats . [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had just gone away for the night . [Margaret]339-margaret said that it was of no consequence , hurried [downstairs]3704-downstairs , and took a hansom to [King 's Cross]13-king 's cross . [She]339-margaret was convinced that the escapade was important , though it would have puzzled [her]339-margaret to say why . [The son of one of [them]4280-both of them]4288-the son of one of them , [a wood - cutter]4289-a wood - cutter , was perched high above [their]4280-both of them heads , pollarding one of the churchyard elms . [[His]4288-the son of one of them mother]4297-his mother claimed the prophetic power [herself]4297-his mother — [she]4297-his mother had seen a strange look about [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox for some time . [They]4307-they advanced to the topic again and again , dully , but with exaltation . It was Art ; though remote from life , it enhanced life 's values , and [they]4307-they witnessed it avidly . [The grave - diggers]4310-the grave - diggers , who had kept up an undercurrent of disapproval — [they]4310-the grave - diggers disliked [Charles]249-charles ; it was not a moment to speak of such things , but [they]4310-the grave - diggers did not like [Charles Wilcox]249-charles — [the grave - diggers]4310-the grave - diggers finished [their]4310-the grave - diggers work and piled up the wreaths and crosses above it . [The young wood - cutter]4316-the young wood - cutter stayed a little longer , poised above the silence and swaying rhythmically . At last the bough fell beneath [his]4316-the young wood - cutter saw . With a grunt , [he]4316-the young wood - cutter descended , [his]4316-the young wood - cutter thoughts dwelling no longer on death , but on love , for [he]4316-the young wood - cutter was mating . "[510-mrs. wilcox] [They]1299-they did n't ought to have coloured flowers at buryings , " [he]4316-the young wood - cutter reflected . Trudging on a few steps , [he]4316-the young wood - cutter stopped again , looked furtively at the dusk , turned back , wrenched a chrysanthemum from the sheaf , and hid it in [his]4316-the young wood - cutter pocket . After [him]4316-the young wood - cutter came silence absolute . [The cottage that abutted on [the churchyard]4319-the churchyard]4318-the cottage that abutted on the churchyard was empty , and [no other house]4320-no other house stood near . Hour after hour the scene of the interment remained without an eye to witness it . Clouds drifted over [it]4319-the churchyard from the west ; or [the church]4293-the church may have been [a ship]4322-a ship , high - prowed , steering with all its company towards infinity . Towards morning the air grew colder , the sky clearer , the surface of the earth hard and sparkling above the prostrate dead . [The wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy]4323-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy , reflected : "[1299-they] [They]1299-they lilies , [they]1299-they chrysants ; it 's a pity [I]0-i did n't take [them]1299-they all . " Up at [Howards End]339-margaret [they]4324-they were attempting breakfast . [Charles]249-charles and [Evie]253-evie sat in [the dining - room]3782-the dining - room , with [Mrs. Charles]354-charles . [[Their]4324-they father]3823-their father , who could not bear to see a face , breakfasted [upstairs]3701-upstairs . [He]3823-their father suffered acutely . Pain came over [him]3823-their father in spasms , as if it was physical , and even while [he]3823-their father was about to eat , [his]3823-their father eyes would fill with tears , and [he]3823-their father would lay down the morsel untasted . [He]3823-their father remembered [[his]3823-their father wife]4328-his wife 's even goodness during thirty years . Not anything in detail — not courtship or early raptures — but just the unvarying virtue , that seemed to [him]3823-their father a [woman]4329-woman 's noblest quality . [So many women]4330-so many women are capricious , breaking into odd flaws of passion or frivolity . Not so [[his]3823-their father wife]4328-his wife . Year after year , summer and winter , as [bride]4332-bride and [mother]3662-mother , [she]4328-his wife had been the same , [he]3823-their father had always trusted [her]4328-his wife . [Her]4328-his wife tenderness ! [Her]4328-his wife innocence ! The wonderful innocence that was [hers]4328-his wife by the gift of [God]281-god . [Ruth]335-margaret knew no more of worldly wickedness and wisdom than did the flowers in [[her]335-margaret garden]4334-her garden , or the grass in [[her]335-margaret field]4335-her field . [Her]335-margaret idea of business—"Henry[0-i] , why do people who have enough money try to get more money ? " [Her]335-margaret idea of politics—"I[1303-you] am sure that if [the mothers of [various nations]1301-various nations]1300-the mothers of various nations could meet , there would be no more wars . " [Her]335-margaret idea of religion — ah , this had been a cloud , but a cloud that passed . [She]335-margaret came of [Quaker stock]4336-quaker stock , and [he]3823-their father and [[his]3823-their father family]3839-his family , formerly [Dissenters]4338-dissenters , were now [members of [the Church of England]82-the church of england]4339-members of the church of england . [They]4341-they brought up [[their]4341-they three children]4342-their three children without dispute . [They]4341-they had never disputed . [She]335-margaret lay under [the earth]4343-the earth now . "[1303-you] Why did n't [you]1303-you tell [me]0-i [you]1303-you knew of it ? " [he]349-henry had moaned , and [her]335-margaret faint voice had answered : "[1303-you] [I]0-i did n't want to , [Henry]349-henry — [I]0-i might have been wrong — and [every one]1304-every one hates illnesses . " [He]349-henry had been told of the horror by [a strange doctor , whom [she]335-margaret had consulted during [his]349-henry absence from [town]4259-town]4344-a strange doctor , whom she had consulted during his absence from town . Was this altogether just ? Without fully explaining , [she]335-margaret had died . It was a fault on [her]335-margaret part , and — tears rushed into [his]349-henry eyes — what a little fault ! It was the only time [she]335-margaret had deceived [him]349-henry in those thirty years . [He]349-henry rose to [his]349-henry feet and looked out of the window , for [Evie]253-evie had come in with the letters , and [he]349-henry could meet [no one]693-no one 's eye . Ah yes — [she]335-margaret had been [a good woman]4347-a good woman — [she]335-margaret had been steady . [He]349-henry chose the word deliberately . To [him]349-henry steadiness included all praise . [He]349-henry [himself]349-henry , gazing at [the wintry garden]4348-the wintry garden , is in appearance [a steady man]4349-a steady man . [His]349-henry face was not as square as [[his]349-henry son]4350-his son 's , and , indeed , the chin , though firm enough in outline , retreated a little , and the lips , ambiguous , were curtained by a moustache . But there was no external hint of weakness . The eyes , if capable of kindness and goodfellowship , if ruddy for the moment with tears , were the eyes of [one who could not be driven]4351-one who could not be driven . The forehead , too , was like [Charles]354-charles 's . High and straight , brown and polished , merging abruptly into temples and skull , it has the effect of a bastion that protected [his]349-henry head from [the world]805-the world . At times it had the effect of a blank wall . [He]349-henry had dwelt behind [it]4353-it , intact and happy , for fifty years . "[1303-you] The post 's come , [Father]348-father , " said [Evie]253-evie awkwardly . "[348-father] Thanks . Put it down . " "[1303-you] Has the breakfast been all right ? "[0-i] [Father]348-father 's eaten nothing , " [she]3912-the girl announced , sitting down with wrinkled brows behind the tea - urn — [Charles]354-charles did not answer , but after a moment [he]0-i ran quickly [upstairs]3701-upstairs , opened the door , and said : "[348-father] Look here , [Father]348-father , [you]348-father must eat , [you]348-father know " ; and having paused for a reply that did not come , stole down again . " Then [he]0-i took up the Times , and for some time there was no sound except the clink of cup against saucer and of knife on plate . [Poor Mrs. Charles]354-charles sat between [[her]3912-the girl silent companions]4357-her silent companions , terrified at the course of events , and a little bored . [She]354-charles was [a rubbishy little creature]4358-a rubbishy little creature , and [she]354-charles knew it . A telegram had dragged [her]354-charles from [Naples]65-naples to [the death - bed of [a woman whom [she]354-charles had scarcely known]4360-a woman whom she had scarcely known]4359-the death - bed of a woman whom she had scarcely known . A word from [[her]354-charles husband]4099-her husband had plunged [her]354-charles into mourning . [She]354-charles desired to mourn inwardly as well , but [she]354-charles wished that [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox , since fated to die , could have died before the marriage , for then less would have been expected of [her]354-charles . Crumbling [her]354-charles toast , and too nervous to ask for the butter , [she]354-charles remained almost motionless , thankful only for this , that [[her]354-charles father - in - law]4362-her father - in - law was having [his]4362-her father - in - law breakfast [upstairs]3701-upstairs . At last [Charles]354-charles spoke . "[348-father] [They]1306-they had no business to be pollarding those elms yesterday , " [he]0-i said to [[his]0-i sister]4364-his sister . "[1306-they] No indeed . " "[0-i] [I]0-i must make a note of that , " [he]0-i continued . "[0-i] [I]0-i am surprised that [the rector]1228-the rector allowed it . " "[1228-the rector] Perhaps it may not be [the rector]1228-the rector 's affair . " "[1228-the rector] Whose else could it be ? " "[1309-the lord of the manor] [The lord of the manor]1309-the lord of the manor . " "[1309-the lord of the manor] Impossible . " "[1309-the lord of the manor] Butter , [Dolly]336-dolly ? " "[336-dolly] Thank [you]336-dolly , [Evie]253-evie dear . [Charles]354-charles — " "[354-charles] Yes , [dear]629-dear ? " "[629-dear] [I]0-i did n't know one could pollard elms . [I]0-i thought one only pollarded willows . " "[0-i] Oh no , [one]559-one can pollard elms . " "[0-i] Then why ought n't the elms in [the churchyard]4319-the churchyard to be pollarded ? " [Charles]354-charles frowned a little , and turned again to [[his]0-i sister]4364-his sister . "[0-i] Another point . [I]0-i must speak to [Chalkeley]355-chalkeley . " "[0-i] Yes , rather ; [you]336-dolly must complain to [Chalkeley]355-chalkeley . " It 's no good [him]355-chalkeley saying [he]355-chalkeley is not responsible for [those men]4366-those men . [He]355-chalkeley is responsible . "[336-dolly] " Yes , rather . "[355-chalkeley] [Brother]356-brother and [sister]1313-sister were not callous . [They]1314-they spoke thus , partly because [they]1314-they desired to keep [Chalkeley]355-chalkeley up to the mark — a healthy desire in its way — partly because [they]1314-they avoided the personal note in life . [All Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes did . It did not seem to [them]1314-they of supreme importance . Or it may be as [Helen]245-helen supposed : [they]1314-they realized its importance , but were afraid of it . Panic and emptiness , could one glance behind . [They]1314-they were not callous , and [they]1314-they left the breakfast - table with aching hearts . [[Their]1314-they mother]1315-their mother never had come in to breakfast . It was in [the other rooms]1316-the other rooms , and especially in [the garden]562-the garden , that [they]1314-they felt [her]1315-their mother loss most . As [Charles]354-charles went out to [the garage]1318-the garage , [he]1319-he was reminded at every step of [the woman who had loved [him]1319-he and whom [he]1319-he could never replace]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace . What battles [he]1319-he had fought against [her]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace gentle conservatism ! How [she]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace had disliked improvements , yet how loyally [she]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace had accepted [them]1321-them when made ! [He]1319-he and [[his]1319-he father]3799-his father — what trouble [they]1314-they had had to get [this very garage]1323-this very garage ! With what difficulty had [they]1314-they persuaded [her]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace to yield [them]1314-they to [the paddock]1324-the paddock for it — [the paddock that [she]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace loved more dearly than [the garden itself]1326-the garden itself]1325-the paddock that she loved more dearly than the garden itself ! The vine — [she]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace had got [her]1320-the woman who had loved him and whom he could never replace way about the vine . It still encumbered the south wall with its unproductive branches . And so with [Evie]253-evie , as [she]253-evie stood talking to [the cook]1327-the cook . Though [she]253-evie could take up [[her]253-evie mother]1328-her mother 's work inside [the house]558-the house , just as [the man]778-the man could take it up without , [she]253-evie felt that something unique had fallen out of [her]253-evie life . [Their]1314-they grief , though less poignant than [[their]1314-they father]3823-their father 's , grew from deeper roots , for [a wife]1332-a wife may be replaced ; [a mother]1333-a mother never . [Charles]354-charles would go back to [the office]3719-the office . There was little to do at [Howards End]339-margaret . The contents of [[his]778-the man mother]4297-his mother 's will had been long known to [them]1314-they . There were no legacies , no annuities , none of the posthumous bustle with which some of [the dead]1336-the dead prolong [their]1314-they activities . Trusting [[her]1328-her mother husband]4099-her husband , [she]1328-her mother had left [him]4099-her husband everything without reserve . [She]1328-her mother was quite [a poor woman]4134-a poor woman — [the house]558-the house had been all [her]1328-her mother dowry , and [the house]558-the house would come to [Charles]354-charles in time . [Her]1328-her mother water - colours [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles intended to reserve for [Paul]247-paul , while [Evie]253-evie would take the jewellery and lace . How easily [she]1328-her mother slipped out of life ! [Charles]249-charles thought the habit laudable , though [he]249-charles did not intend to adopt it [himself]249-charles , whereas [Margaret]335-margaret would have seen in it an almost culpable indifference to earthly fame . Cynicism — not the superficial cynicism that snarls and sneers , but the cynicism that can go with courtesy and tenderness — that was the note of [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox 's will . [She]1328-her mother wanted not to vex [people]3797-people . That accomplished , [the earth]4343-the earth might freeze over [her]1328-her mother for ever . No , there was nothing for [Charles]249-charles to wait for . [He]249-charles could not go on with [his]249-charles honeymoon , so [he]249-charles would go up to [London]2-london and work — [he]249-charles felt too miserable hanging about . [He]249-charles and [Dolly]336-dolly would have [the furnished flat]1343-the furnished flat while [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father rested quietly in [the country]1115-the country with [Evie]253-evie . [He]249-charles could also keep an eye on [[his]249-charles own little house]1346-his own little house , which was being painted and decorated for [him]249-charles in one of [the [Surrey]78-surrey suburbs]1347-the surrey suburbs , and in which [he]249-charles hoped to install [himself]249-charles soon after Christmas . [He]249-charles found [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father 's chauffeur in [the garage]1318-the garage , said , " Morning "[249-charles] without looking at [the man]778-the man 's face , and , bending over [the car]1354-the car , continued : " Hullo ! "[3799-his father] [Charles]249-charles took two letters , and read them as [he]249-charles followed the procession . The first was a covering note from [the matron]1372-the matron . [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had desired [her]1372-the matron , when the funeral should be over , to forward the enclosed . [She]4297-his mother had written : " To [[my]4297-his mother husband]4161-my husband : [I]4297-his mother should like [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ( [Margaret]339-margaret ) to have Howards End . "[4297-his mother] " [I]249-charles suppose [we]1374-they 're going to have a talk about this ? "[249-charles] [he]249-charles remarked , ominously calm . " Certainly . "[249-charles] In silence [they]1374-they drew up to the breakfast - table . The events of yesterday — indeed , of this morning — suddenly receded into a past so remote that [they]1374-they seemed scarcely to have lived in it . Heavy breathings were heard . [They]1374-they were calming [themselves]1374-they . [Charles]249-charles , to steady [them]1374-they further , read the enclosure out loud : " A note in [[my]336-dolly mother]4396-my mother 's handwriting , in an envelope addressed to [[my]336-dolly father]3721-my father , sealed . Inside : ' [I]336-dolly should like [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ( [Margaret]339-margaret ) to have Howards End . ' No date , no signature . Forwarded through [the matron of [that nursing home]4399-that nursing home]4398-the matron of that nursing home . Now , the question is — "[336-dolly] [Dolly]336-dolly interrupted [him]249-charles . " But [I]336-dolly say that note is n't legal . [Houses]884-houses ought to be done by [a lawyer]4401-a lawyer , [Charles]249-charles , surely . "[336-dolly] [[Her]336-dolly husband]4099-her husband worked [his]249-charles jaw severely . Little lumps appeared in front of either ear — a symptom that [she]336-dolly had not yet learnt to respect , and [she]336-dolly asked whether [she]336-dolly might see the note . [Charles]249-charles looked at [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father for permission , who said abstractedly , " Give it [her]336-dolly . "[249-charles] [She]336-dolly seized it , and at once exclaimed : " Why , it 's only in pencil ! [I]336-dolly said so . Pencil never counts . "[336-dolly] " [We]4402-we know that it is not legally binding , [Dolly]336-dolly , "[249-charles] said [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles , speaking from out of [[his]249-charles fortress]1377-his fortress . " [We]4402-we are aware of that . Legally , [I]249-charles should be justified in tearing it up and throwing it into the fire . Of course , [[my]249-charles dear]623-my dear , [we]4402-we consider [you]336-dolly as [one of [the family]4082-the family]4404-one of the family , but it will be better if [you]336-dolly do not interfere with what [you]336-dolly do not understand . "[249-charles] [Charles]249-charles , vexed both with [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father and [[his]249-charles wife]4328-his wife , then repeated : " The question is — "[249-charles] [He]249-charles had cleared a space of the breakfast - table from plates and knives , so that [he]249-charles could draw patterns on the tablecloth . " The question is whether [Miss Schlegel]245-helen , during the fortnight [we]4402-we were all away , whether [she]245-helen unduly — "[249-charles] [He]249-charles stopped . " [I]3799-his father do n't think that , "[3799-his father] said [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father , whose nature was nobler than [[his]3799-his father son]4350-his son 's " Do n't think what ? "[3799-his father] " That [she]245-helen would have — that it is a case of undue influence . No , to [my]3799-his father mind the question is the — [the invalid]1148-the invalid 's condition at the time [she]245-helen wrote . "[3799-his father] " [[My]3799-his father dear father]4407-my dear father , consult [an expert]4408-an expert if [you]4407-my dear father like , but [I]3799-his father do n't admit it is [[my]3799-his father mother]4396-my mother 's writing . "[3799-his father] " Why , [you]249-charles just said it was ! "[336-dolly] cried [Dolly]336-dolly . " Never mind if [I]249-charles did , "[249-charles] [he]249-charles blazed out ; " and hold [your]336-dolly tongue . "[249-charles] [The poor little wife]1382-the poor little wife coloured at this , and , drawing [her]1382-the poor little wife handkerchief from [her]1382-the poor little wife pocket , shed a few tears . [No one]693-no one noticed [her]1382-the poor little wife . [Evie]253-evie was scowling like [an angry boy]1384-an angry boy . [The two men]1385-the two men were gradually assuming the manner of [the committee - room]1386-the committee - room . [They]1385-the two men were both at [their]1385-the two men best when serving on committees . [They]1385-the two men did not make the mistake of handling human affairs in the bulk , but disposed of [them]1385-the two men item by item , sharply . Calligraphy was the item before [them]1385-the two men now , and on it [they]1385-the two men turned [their]1385-the two men well - trained brains . [Charles]249-charles , after a little demur , accepted the writing as genuine , and [they]1385-the two men passed on to the next point . It is the best — perhaps the only — way of dodging emotion . [They]1385-the two men were the average human article , and had [they]1385-the two men considered the note as a whole it would have driven [them]1385-the two men miserable or mad . Considered item by item , the emotional content was minimized , and all went forward smoothly . The clock ticked , the coals blazed higher , and contended with the white radiance that poured in through the windows . Unnoticed , the sun occupied [his]249-charles sky , and the shadows of the tree stems , extraordinarily solid , fell like trenches of purple across [the frosted lawn]1387-the frosted lawn . It was a glorious winter morning . [Evie]253-evie 's fox terrier , who had passed for white , was only a dirty grey dog now , so intense was the purity that surrounded [him]249-charles . [He]249-charles was discredited , but the blackbirds that [he]249-charles was chasing glowed with Arabian darkness , for all the conventional colouring of life had been altered . Inside , the clock struck ten with a rich and confident note . Other clocks confirmed it , and the discussion moved towards its close . To follow it is unnecessary . It is rather a moment when [the commentator]1388-the commentator should step forward . Ought [the Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes to have offered [[their]3809-the wilcoxes home]1390-their home to [Margaret]339-margaret ? [I]0-i think not . The appeal was too flimsy . It was not legal ; it had been written in illness , and under the spell of a sudden friendship ; it was contrary to [the dead woman]4286-the dead woman 's intentions in the past , contrary to [her]4286-the dead woman very nature , so far as that nature was understood by [them]1385-the two men . To [them]1385-the two men [Howards End]339-margaret was [a house]3712-a house : [they]1385-the two men could not know that to [her]4286-the dead woman it had been a spirit , for which [she]4286-the dead woman sought [a spiritual heir]1393-a spiritual heir . And — pushing one step farther in these mists — may [they]1385-the two men not have decided even better than [they]1385-the two men supposed ? Is it credible that the possessions of the spirit can be bequeathed at all ? Has the soul offspring ? A wych - elm tree , a vine , a wisp of hay with dew on it — can passion for such things be transmitted where there is no bond of blood ? No ; [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes are not to be blamed . The problem is too terrific , and [they]251-the wilcoxes could not even perceive a problem . No ; it is natural and fitting that after due debate [they]251-the wilcoxes should tear the note up and throw it on to [their]251-the wilcoxes dining - room fire . [The practical moralist]1394-the practical moralist may acquit [them]251-the wilcoxes absolutely . [He]1395-he who strives to look deeper may acquit [them]251-the wilcoxes — almost . For one hard fact remains . [They]1385-the two men did neglect a personal appeal . [The woman who had died]1396-the woman who had died did say to [them]1385-the two men , " Do this , "[1396-the woman who had died] and [they]1385-the two men answered , " [We]1385-the two men will not . "[1385-the two men] The incident made a most painful impression on [them]1385-the two men . [Grief]361-grief mounted into the brain and worked there disquietingly . Yesterday [they]1385-the two men had lamented : " [She]1396-the woman who had died was [a dear mother]4410-a dear mother , [a true wife]4411-a true wife : in [our]1385-the two men absence [she]1396-the woman who had died neglected [her]1396-the woman who had died health and died . "[1385-the two men] Today [they]1385-the two men thought : " [She]1396-the woman who had died was not as true , as dear , as [we]1385-the two men supposed . "[1385-the two men] The desire for a more inward light had found expression at last , the unseen had impacted on the seen , and all that [they]1385-the two men could say was " Treachery . "[1385-the two men] [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had been treacherous to [the family]4082-the family , to the laws of property , to [her]510-mrs. wilcox own written word . How did [she]510-mrs. wilcox expect [Howards End]339-margaret to be conveyed to [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ? Was [[her]510-mrs. wilcox husband]4099-her husband , to whom it legally belonged , to make it over to [her]510-mrs. wilcox as a free gift ? Was the said [Miss Schlegel]245-helen to have a life interest in it , or to own it absolutely ? Was there to be no compensation for [the garage]1318-the garage and other improvements that [they]1385-the two men had made under the assumption that all would be theirs some day ? Treacherous ! treacherous and absurd ! [She]245-helen was parting from [these Wilcoxes]632-these wilcoxes for the second time . [Paul]247-paul and [[his]247-paul mother]4297-his mother , ripple and great wave , had flowed into [her]245-helen life and ebbed out of it for ever . The ripple had left no traces behind : the wave had strewn at [her]245-helen feet fragments torn from the unknown . [A curious seeker]1419-a curious seeker , [she]245-helen stood for a while at the verge of [the sea]3847-the sea that tells so little , but tells a little , and watched the outgoing of this last tremendous tide . [[Her]245-helen friend]1421-her friend had vanished in agony , but not , [she]245-helen believed , in degradation . [Her]245-helen withdrawal had hinted at other things besides disease and pain . [Some]1422-some leave [our]1423-our life with tears , others with an insane frigidity ; [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had taken the middle course , which only rarer natures can pursue . [She]510-mrs. wilcox had kept proportion . [She]510-mrs. wilcox had told a little of [her]510-mrs. wilcox grim secret to [[her]510-mrs. wilcox friends]4207-her friends , but not too much ; [she]510-mrs. wilcox had shut up [her]510-mrs. wilcox heart — almost , but not entirely . It is thus , if there is any rule , that [we]1423-our ought to die — neither as [victim]1425-victim nor as [fanatic]1426-fanatic , but as [the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that [he]1428-he is entering , and [the shore]1429-the shore that [he]1428-he must leave]1427-the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that he is entering , and the shore that he must leave . The last word — whatever it would be — had certainly not been said in [Hilton churchyard]1430-hilton churchyard . [She]510-mrs. wilcox had not died [there]3835-there . A funeral is not death , any more than baptism is birth or marriage union . All three are the clumsy devices , coming now too late , now too early , by which [Society]363-society would register the quick motions of [man]3767-man . In [Margaret]339-margaret 's eyes [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had escaped registration . [She]510-mrs. wilcox had gone out of life vividly , [her]510-mrs. wilcox own way , and no dust was so truly dust as the contents of that heavy coffin , lowered with ceremonial until it rested on the dust of the earth , no flowers so utterly wasted as the chrysanthemums that the frost must have withered before morning . [Margaret]339-margaret had once said [she]339-margaret " loved superstition . "[339-margaret] It was not true . [Few women]1433-few women had tried more earnestly to pierce the accretions in which body and soul are enwrapped . The death of [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox had helped [her]339-margaret in [her]339-margaret work . [She]339-margaret saw a little more clearly than hitherto what [a human being]1434-a human being is , and to what [he]1428-he may aspire . Truer relationships gleamed . Perhaps the last word would be hope — hope even on this side of the grave . Meanwhile , [she]339-margaret could take an interest in [the survivors]1435-the survivors . In spite of [her]339-margaret Christmas duties , in spite of [[her]339-margaret brother]3702-her brother , [the Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes continued to play a considerable part in [her]339-margaret thoughts . [She]339-margaret had seen so much of [them]3809-the wilcoxes in the final week . [They]3809-the wilcoxes were not " [her]339-margaret sort , "[3809-the wilcoxes] [they]3809-the wilcoxes were often suspicious and stupid , and deficient where [she]339-margaret excelled ; but collision with [them]3809-the wilcoxes stimulated [her]339-margaret , and [she]339-margaret felt an interest that verged into liking , even for [Charles]249-charles . [She]339-margaret desired to protect [them]3809-the wilcoxes , and often felt that [they]3809-the wilcoxes could protect [her]339-margaret , excelling where [she]339-margaret was deficient . Once past the rocks of emotion , [they]3809-the wilcoxes knew so well what to do , whom to send for ; [their]3809-the wilcoxes hands were on all the ropes , [they]3809-the wilcoxes had grit as well as grittiness , and [she]339-margaret valued grit enormously . [They]3809-the wilcoxes led a life that [she]339-margaret could not attain to — the outer life of " telegrams and anger , "[245-helen] which had detonated when [Helen]245-helen and [Paul]247-paul had touched in June , and had detonated again the other week . To [Margaret]339-margaret this life was to remain a real force . [She]339-margaret could not despise it , as [Helen]245-helen and [Tibby]250-tibby affected to do . It fostered such virtues as neatness , decision , and obedience , virtues of the second rank , no doubt , but [they]3809-the wilcoxes have formed [our]1438-our civilization . [They]3809-the wilcoxes form character , too ; [Margaret]339-margaret could not doubt it : [they]3809-the wilcoxes keep the soul from becoming sloppy . How dare [Schlegels]261-the schlegels despise [Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes , when it takes all sorts to make [a world]1439-a world ? " Do n't brood too much , "[339-margaret] [she]339-margaret wrote to [Helen]245-helen , " on the superiority of the unseen to the seen . It 's true , but to brood on it is mediaeval . " It is n't size that counts so much as the way things are arranged . "[245-helen] In another paragraph [she]245-helen referred to [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox sympathetically , but the news had not bitten into [her]245-helen . [She]245-helen had not realized the accessories of death , which are in a sense more memorable than death itself . The atmosphere of precautions and recriminations , and in the midst a human body growing more vivid because it was in pain ; the end of that body in [Hilton churchyard]29-hilton ; the survival of something that suggested hope , vivid in its turn against life 's workaday cheerfulness;—all these were lost to [Helen]245-helen , who only felt that [a pleasant lady]1450-a pleasant lady could now be pleasant no longer . "[339-margaret] [Helen]245-helen , after a decent pause , continued [her]245-helen account of [Stettin]44-stettin . How quickly a situation changes ! In June [she]245-helen had been in a crisis ; even in November [she]245-helen could blush and be unnatural ; now it was January , and the whole affair lay forgotten . Looking back on the past six months , [Margaret]339-margaret realized the chaotic nature of [our]1478-our daily life , and its difference from the orderly sequence that has been fabricated by [historians]1479-historians . Actual life is full of false clues and sign - posts that lead nowhere . With infinite effort [we]1478-our nerve [ourselves]1478-our for a crisis that never comes . The most successful career must show a waste of strength that might have removed mountains , and the most unsuccessful is not that of [the man who is taken unprepared , but of [him]1481-him who has prepared and is never taken]1480-the man who is taken unprepared , but of him who has prepared and is never taken . On a tragedy of that kind [our]1478-our national morality is duly silent . It assumes that preparation against danger is in itself a good , and that [men]597-men , like [nations]1483-nations , are the better for staggering through life fully armed . The tragedy of preparedness has scarcely been handled , save by [the Greeks]370-the greeks . Life is indeed dangerous , but not in the way morality would have [us]1478-our believe . It is indeed unmanageable , but the essence of it is not a battle . It is unmanageable because it is a romance , and its essence is romantic beauty . [Margaret]339-margaret hoped that for the future [she]339-margaret would be less cautious , not more cautious , than [she]339-margaret had been in the past . Over two years passed , and [the Schlegel household]1484-the schlegel household continued to lead [its]1484-the schlegel household life of cultured but not ignoble ease , still swimming gracefully on the grey tides of [London]2-london . Concerts and plays swept past [them]1484-the schlegel household , money had been spent and renewed , reputations won and lost , and [the city]962-the city herself , emblematic of [their]1484-the schlegel household lives , rose and fell in a continual flux , while [her]962-the city shallows washed more widely against [the hills of [Surrey]78-surrey]1486-the hills of surrey and over [the fields of [Hertfordshire]67-hertfordshire]1487-the fields of hertfordshire . [This famous building]1488-this famous building had arisen , that was doomed . Today [Whitehall]89-whitehall had been transformed : it would be the turn of [Regent Street]76-regent street tomorrow . And month by month [the roads]3737-the roads smelt more strongly of petrol , and were more difficult to cross , and [human beings]820-human beings heard [each other]834-each other speak with greater difficulty , breathed less of the air , and saw less of the sky . [Nature]344-nature withdrew : the leaves were falling by midsummer ; the sun shone through dirt with an admired obscurity . To speak against [London]2-london is no longer fashionable . The Earth as [an artistic cult]1492-an artistic cult has had its day , and the literature of the near future will probably ignore [the country]1115-the country and seek inspiration from [the town]4198-the town . [One]559-one can understand the reaction . Of [Pan]371-pan and [the elemental forces]1496-the elemental forces , [the public]1497-the public has heard a little too much — [they]1497-the public seem [Victorian]372-victorian , while [London]2-london is [Georgian]90-georgian — and those who care for [the earth]4343-the earth with sincerity may wait long ere the pendulum swings back to [her]1499-her again . Certainly [London]2-london fascinates . [One]559-one visualizes it as a tract of quivering grey , intelligent without purpose , and excitable without love ; as a spirit that has altered before it can be chronicled ; as a heart that certainly beats , but with no pulsation of humanity . It lies beyond everything : [Nature]344-nature , with all [her]344-nature cruelty , comes nearer to [us]1501-we than do [these crowds of men]1502-these crowds of men . [A friend]1212-a friend explains [himself]1212-a friend : [the earth]4343-the earth is explicable — from [her]344-nature [we]1501-we came , and [we]1501-we must return to [her]344-nature . But who can explain [Westminster Bridge Road]91-westminster bridge road or [Liverpool Street]16-liverpool street in the morning — [the city]962-the city inhaling — or [the same thoroughfares]1506-the same thoroughfares in the evening — [the city]962-the city exhaling [her]344-nature exhausted air ? [We]1501-we reach in desperation beyond the fog , beyond the very stars , the voids of [the universe]3903-the universe are ransacked to justify [the monster]1509-the monster , and stamped with a human face . [London]2-london is religion 's opportunity — not the decorous religion of [theologians]1510-theologians , but anthropomorphic , crude . Yes , the continuous flow would be tolerable if [a man of [our]1501-we own sort]1511-a man of our own sort — not [anyone pompous or tearful]1512-anyone pompous or tearful — were caring for [us]1501-we up in the sky . [The Londoner]373-the londoner seldom understands [[his]373-the londoner city]1513-his city until it sweeps [him]373-the londoner , too , away from [his]373-the londoner moorings , and [Margaret]339-margaret 's eyes were not opened until the lease of [Wickham Place]9-wickham place expired . [She]339-margaret had always known that it must expire , but the knowledge only became vivid about nine months before the event . Then [the house]558-the house was suddenly ringed with pathos . [It]558-the house had seen so much happiness . Why had it to be swept away ? In [the streets of [the city]962-the city]1515-the streets of the city [she]339-margaret noted for the first time the architecture of hurry , and heard the language of hurry on the mouths of [[its]962-the city inhabitants]1517-its inhabitants — clipped words , formless sentences , potted expressions of approval or disgust . Month by month things were stepping livelier , but to what goal ? [The population]1518-the population still rose , but what was the quality of [the men born]1519-the men born ? [The particular millionaire who owned [the freehold of [Wickham Place]9-wickham place]1521-the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect [Babylonian flats]1522-babylonian flats upon [it]1521-the freehold of wickham place]1520-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it — what right had [he]1520-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it to stir so large a portion of the quivering jelly ? "[3956-a lady] " — and [I]308-leonard was too tired to lift up [my]308-leonard head to look at it , and so cold too . [[Their]1607-they hansom]1609-their hansom caught [him]308-leonard up at the corner , passed with a waving of hands , and vanished with its accomplished load into the evening . [London]2-london was beginning to illuminate [herself]2-london against the night . Electric lights sizzled and jagged in [the main thoroughfares]1610-the main thoroughfares , gas - lamps in [the side streets]1611-the side streets glimmered a canary gold or green . The sky was a crimson battlefield of spring , but [London]2-london was not afraid . [Her]245-helen smoke mitigated the splendour , and the clouds down [Oxford Street]107-oxford street were a delicately painted ceiling , which adorned while it did not distract . [She]245-helen has never known the clear - cut armies of the purer air . [Leonard]308-leonard hurried through [her]245-helen tinted wonders , very much part of the picture . [His]308-leonard was a grey life , and to brighten it [he]308-leonard had ruled off a few corners for romance . [The Miss Schlegels]261-the schlegels — or , to speak more accurately , [his]308-leonard interview with [them]1612-them — were to fill such a corner , nor was it by any means the first time that [he]308-leonard had talked intimately to [strangers]3978-strangers . The habit was analogous to a debauch , an outlet , though the worst of outlets , for instincts that would not be denied . Terrifying [him]308-leonard , it would beat down [his]308-leonard suspicions and prudence until [he]308-leonard was confiding secrets to [people whom [he]308-leonard had scarcely seen]1614-people whom he had scarcely seen . It brought [him]308-leonard many fears and some pleasant memories . Perhaps the keenest happiness [he]308-leonard had ever known was during a railway journey to [Cambridge]368-cambridge , where [a decent - mannered undergraduate]1615-a decent - mannered undergraduate had spoken to [him]308-leonard . [They]1616-they had got into conversation , and gradually [Leonard]308-leonard flung reticence aside , told some of [his]308-leonard domestic troubles , and hinted at the rest . [The undergraduate]1617-the undergraduate , supposing [they]1616-they could start a friendship , asked [him]308-leonard to " coffee after [hall]550-hall , "[1617-the undergraduate] which [he]308-leonard accepted , but afterwards grew shy , and took care not to stir from [the commercial hotel where [he]308-leonard lodged]1618-the commercial hotel where he lodged . [He]308-leonard did not want Romance to collide with [the Porphyrion]393-the porphyrion , still less with [Jacky]314-jacky , and [people with fuller , happier lives]1619-people with fuller , happier lives are slow to understand this . To [the Schlegels]261-the schlegels , as to [the undergraduate]1617-the undergraduate , [he]308-leonard was [an interesting creature]1621-an interesting creature , of whom [they]1619-people with fuller , happier lives wanted to see more . But [they]1619-people with fuller , happier lives to [him]308-leonard were [denizens of Romance]1622-denizens of romance , who must keep to the corner [he]308-leonard had assigned [them]1619-people with fuller , happier lives , pictures that must not walk out of [their]1619-people with fuller , happier lives frames . [His]308-leonard behaviour over [Margaret]339-margaret 's visiting - card had been typical . [His]308-leonard had scarcely been a tragic marriage . Where there is no money and no inclination to violence tragedy can not be generated . [He]308-leonard could not leave [[his]308-leonard wife]4328-his wife , and [he]308-leonard did not want to hit [her]4328-his wife . Petulance and squalor were enough . Here " that card "[308-leonard] had come in . [Leonard]308-leonard , though furtive , was untidy , and left it lying about . [Jacky]314-jacky found it , and then began , " What 's that card , eh ? "[314-jacky] " Yes , do n't [you]308-leonard wish [you]308-leonard knew what that card was ? "[314-jacky] " [Len]308-leonard , who 's [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ? "[314-jacky] etc . Months passed , and the card , now as a joke , now as a grievance , was handed about , getting dirtier and dirtier . It followed [them]1619-people with fuller , happier lives when [they]1619-people with fuller , happier lives moved from [Cornelia Road]109-cornelia road to [Tulse Hill]110-tulse hill . It was submitted to [third parties]1624-third parties . A few inches of pasteboard , it became the battlefield on which [the souls of [Leonard]308-leonard and [[his]308-leonard wife]4328-his wife contended]1625-the souls of leonard and his wife contended . Why did [he]308-leonard not say , " [A lady]3956-a lady took [my]308-leonard umbrella , [another]4514-another gave [me]308-leonard this that [I]308-leonard might call for [my]308-leonard umbrella "[308-leonard] ? Because [Jacky]314-jacky would have disbelieved [him]308-leonard ? Partly , but chiefly because [he]308-leonard was sentimental . No affection gathered round the card , but it symbolized the life of culture , that [Jacky]314-jacky should never spoil . At night [he]308-leonard would say to [himself]308-leonard , " Well , at all events , [she]4328-his wife does n't know about that card . [Yah]4515-yah ! done [her]4328-his wife there ! "[308-leonard] [Poor Jacky]314-jacky ! [she]4328-his wife was not a bad sort , and had a great deal to bear . [She]4328-his wife drew [her]4328-his wife own conclusion — [she]4328-his wife was only capable of drawing one conclusion — and in the fulness of time [she]4328-his wife acted upon it . All the Friday [Leonard]308-leonard had refused to speak to [her]4328-his wife , and had spent the evening observing the stars . On the Saturday [he]308-leonard went up , as usual , to [town]4259-town , but [he]308-leonard came not back Saturday night nor Sunday morning , nor Sunday afternoon . The inconvenience grew intolerable , and though [she]4328-his wife was now of a retiring habit , and shy of [women]596-women , [she]4328-his wife went up to [Wickham Place]9-wickham place . [Leonard]308-leonard returned in [her]4328-his wife absence . The card , the fatal card , was gone from the pages of [Ruskin]315-ruskin , and [he]308-leonard guessed what had happened . " Well ? "[308-leonard] [he]308-leonard had exclaimed , greeting [her]4328-his wife with peals of laughter . " [I]308-leonard know where [you]4328-his wife 've been , but [you]4328-his wife do n't know where [I]308-leonard 've been . "[308-leonard] [Jacky]314-jacky sighed , said , " [Len]308-leonard , [I]314-jacky do think [you]308-leonard might explain , "[314-jacky] and resumed domesticity . Explanations were difficult at this stage , and [Leonard]308-leonard was too silly — or it is tempting to write , too sound [a chap]1629-a chap to attempt them . [His]308-leonard reticence was not entirely the shoddy article that [a business life]1630-a business life promotes , the reticence that pretends that nothing is something , and hides behind the Daily Telegraph . [The adventurer]1631-the adventurer , also , is reticent , and it is an adventure for [a clerk]1632-a clerk to walk for a few hours in darkness . [You]1633-you may laugh at [him]308-leonard , [you]1633-you who have slept nights on the veldt , with [your]1633-you rifle beside [you]1633-you and all the atmosphere of adventure past . And [you]1633-you also may laugh who think adventures silly . But do not be surprised if [Leonard]308-leonard is shy whenever [he]308-leonard meets [you]1633-you , and if [the Schlegels]261-the schlegels rather than [Jacky]314-jacky hear about the dawn . That [the Schlegels]261-the schlegels had not thought [him]308-leonard foolish became a permanent joy . [He]308-leonard was at [his]308-leonard best when [he]308-leonard thought of [them]1634-them . It buoyed [him]308-leonard as [he]308-leonard journeyed home beneath fading heavens . Somehow the barriers of wealth had fallen , and there had been — [he]308-leonard could not phrase it — a general assertion of the wonder of [the world]805-the world . " [My]1636-the mystic conviction , "[1636-the mystic] says [the mystic]1636-the mystic , " gains infinitely the moment [another soul]4516-another soul will believe in it , "[1636-the mystic] and [they]1637-they had agreed that there was something beyond life 's daily grey . [He]308-leonard took off [his]308-leonard top - hat and smoothed it thoughtfully . [He]308-leonard had hitherto supposed the unknown to be books , literature , clever conversation , culture . [One]559-one raised [oneself]559-one by study , and got upsides with [the world]805-the world . But in that quick interchange a new light dawned . Was that something " walking in the dark among [the surburban hills]4517-the surburban hills ? [He]308-leonard discovered that [he]308-leonard was going bareheaded down [Regent Street]76-regent street . [London]2-london came back with a rush . [Few]4518-few were about at this hour , but [all whom [he]308-leonard passed]4519-all whom he passed looked at [him]308-leonard with a hostility that was the more impressive because it was unconscious . [He]308-leonard put [his]308-leonard hat on . It was too big ; [his]308-leonard head disappeared like a pudding into a basin , the ears bending outwards at the touch of the curly brim . [He]308-leonard wore it a little backwards , and its effect was greatly to elongate the face and to bring out the distance between the eyes and the moustache . Thus equipped , [he]308-leonard escaped criticism . [No one]693-no one felt uneasy as [he]308-leonard titupped along [the pavements]4521-the pavements , the heart of [a man]3695-a man ticking fast in [his]308-leonard chest . [The sisters]833-the sisters went out to dinner full of [their]833-the sisters adventure , and when [they]833-the sisters were both full of the same subject , there were few dinner - parties that could stand up against [them]833-the sisters . This particular one , which was [all ladies]4524-all ladies , had more kick in it than most , but succumbed after a struggle . [Helen]245-helen at one part of the table , [Margaret]339-margaret at the other , would talk of [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast and of [no one else]4525-no one else , and somewhere about the entree [their]833-the sisters monologues collided , fell ruining , and became common property . Nor was this all . The dinner - party was really an informal discussion club ; there was a paper after it , read amid coffee - cups and laughter in [the drawing - room]4015-the drawing - room , but dealing more or less thoughtfully with some topic of general interest . After the paper came a debate , and in this debate [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast also figured , appearing now as a bright spot in civilization , now as a dark spot , according to the temperament of [the speaker]4527-the speaker . The subject of the paper had been , "[309-mr. bast] How ought [I]0-i to dispose of [my]0-i money ? " [the reader]663-the reader professing to be [a millionaire]4529-a millionaire on the point of death , inclined to bequeath [her]663-the reader fortune for the foundation of [local art galleries]4530-local art galleries , but open to conviction from other sources . The various parts had been assigned beforehand , and some of the speeches were amusing . [The hostess]4531-the hostess assumed the ungrateful role of "[1641-the millionaire 's eldest son] [[the millionaire]1640-the millionaire 's eldest son]1641-the millionaire 's eldest son , " and implored [[her]4531-the hostess expiring parent]4532-her expiring parent not to dislocate Society by allowing such vast sums to pass out of [the family]4082-the family . Money was the fruit of self - denial , and [the second generation]4534-the second generation had a right to profit by the self - denial of the first . What right had "[309-mr. bast] [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast " to profit ? [The National Gallery]4535-the national gallery was good enough for the likes of [him]309-mr. bast . After property had had its say — a saying that is necessarily ungracious — [the various philanthropists]4536-the various philanthropists stepped forward . Something must be done for "[309-mr. bast] [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast " : [his]309-mr. bast conditions must be improved without impairing [his]309-mr. bast independence ; [he]309-mr. bast must have [a free library]4537-a free library , or free [tennis - courts]4538-tennis - courts ; [his]309-mr. bast rent must be paid in such a way that [he]309-mr. bast did not know it was being paid ; it must be made worth [his]309-mr. bast while to join [the Territorials]4539-the territorials ; [he]309-mr. bast must be forcibly parted from [[his]309-mr. bast uninspiring wife]4540-his uninspiring wife , the money going to [her]4540-his uninspiring wife as compensation ; [he]309-mr. bast must be assigned [a Twin Star]4541-a twin star , [some member of the leisured classes who would watch over [him]309-mr. bast ceaselessly ( groans from [Helen]245-helen]4542-some member of the leisured classes who would watch over him ceaselessly ( groans from helen ) ; [he]309-mr. bast must be given food but no clothes , clothes but no food , a third - return ticket to [Venice]56-venice , without either food or clothes when [he]309-mr. bast arrived [there]3835-there . In short , [he]309-mr. bast might be given anything and everything so long as it was not the money itself . And here [Margaret]339-margaret interrupted . "[309-mr. bast] Order , order , [Miss Schlegel]245-helen ! " said [the reader of the paper]4544-the reader of the paper . " "[245-helen] [Your]245-helen head wo n't go round if only [you]245-helen 'll listen to [my]0-i argument , " said [Margaret]339-margaret . "[245-helen] Why not give [him]1644-him the money itself . [You]245-helen 're supposed to have about thirty thousand a year . " "[0-i] Have [I]0-i ? [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had a million . " "[0-i] Was n't a million [your]245-helen capital ? Dear [me]0-i ! " "[0-i] But that would be pauperizing [them]1646-poor men , " said [an earnest girl]4545-an earnest girl , who liked [the Schlegels]261-the schlegels , but thought [them]1648-these little driblets a little unspiritual at times . It is [these little driblets]1648-these little driblets , distributed among too many , that do the harm . Money 's educational . It 's far more educational than the things it buys . " There was a protest . "[0-i] In a sense , " added [Margaret]339-margaret , but the protest continued . Give [them]1646-poor men money . Do n't dole [them]1646-poor men out poetry - books and railway - tickets like babies . Give [them]1646-poor men the wherewithal to buy these things . When [your]245-helen Socialism comes it may be different , and [we]1650-we may think in terms of commodities instead of cash . Till it comes give [people]3797-people cash , for it is the warp of civilization , whatever the woof may be . The imagination ought to play upon money and realize it vividly , for it 's the — the second most important thing in [the world]805-the world . It is so sluffed over and hushed up , there is so little clear thinking — oh , political economy , of course , but so few of [us]1650-we think clearly about [our]1650-we own private incomes , and admit that independent thoughts are in nine cases out of ten the result of independent means . Money : give [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast money , and do n't bother about [his]309-mr. bast ideals . [He]309-mr. bast 'll pick up those for [himself]309-mr. bast . " [She]339-margaret leant back while [the more earnest members of the club]4546-the more earnest members of the club began to misconstrue [her]339-margaret . [The female mind]4547-the female mind , though cruelly practical in daily life , can not bear to hear ideals belittled in conversation , and [Miss Schlegel]245-helen was asked however [she]245-helen could say such dreadful things , and what it would profit [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast if [he]309-mr. bast gained [the whole world]4048-the whole world and lost [his]309-mr. bast own soul . " Then [they]1654-they said , "[0-i] No [they]1654-they did not believe it , " and [she]245-helen admitted that [an overworked clerk]4549-an overworked clerk may save [his]309-mr. bast soul in the superterrestrial sense , where the effort will be taken for the deed , but [she]245-helen denied that [he]309-mr. bast will ever explore the spiritual resources of [this world]4550-this world , will ever know the rarer joys of the body , or attain to clear and passionate intercourse with [[his]309-mr. bast fellows]4551-his fellows . [Others]3837-others had attacked the fabric of Society - Property , Interest , etc . ; [she]245-helen only fixed [her]245-helen eyes on [a few human beings]4553-a few human beings , to see how , under present conditions , [they]4553-a few human beings could be made happier . Doing good to humanity was useless : the many - coloured efforts thereto spreading over [the vast area]4554-the vast area like films and resulting in an universal grey . To do good to one , or , as in this case , to [a few]4555-a few , was the utmost [she]245-helen dare hope for . Between [the idealists]4556-the idealists , and [the political economists]4557-the political economists , [Margaret]339-margaret had a bad time . The serious parts of the discussion had been of higher merit than the playful — in a [men]597-men 's debate is the reverse more general ? — but the meeting broke up hilariously enough , and [a dozen happy ladies]4571-a dozen happy ladies dispersed to [[their]4571-a dozen happy ladies homes]659-their homes . [They]4574-they turned back towards [Oakley Street]113-oakley street . For the present , puppies and [[her]253-evie father]3860-her father were the only things [she]253-evie loved , but the net of matrimony was being prepared for [her]253-evie , and a few days later [she]253-evie was attracted to [a Mr. Percy Cahill]410-mr. cahill , [an uncle of [Mrs. Charles]354-charles]1836-an uncle of mrs. charles , and [he]410-mr. cahill was attracted to [her]253-evie . The Age of [Property]1837-property holds bitter moments even for [a proprietor]1838-a proprietor . When a move is imminent , furniture becomes ridiculous , and [Margaret]339-margaret now lay awake at nights wondering where , where [on earth]1839-on earth [they]1840-their and all [their]1840-their belongings would be deposited in September next . Chairs , tables , pictures , books , that had rumbled down to [them]1840-their through the generations , must rumble forward again like a slide of rubbish to which [she]339-margaret longed to give the final push , and send toppling into [the sea]3847-the sea . But there were all [[their]1840-their father]3823-their father 's books — [they]1840-their never read them , but they were [[their]1840-their father]3823-their father 's , and must be kept . There was the marble - topped chiffonier — [[their]1840-their mother]1315-their mother had set store by it , [they]1840-their could not remember why . Round every knob and cushion in [the house]558-the house sentiment gathered , a sentiment that was at times personal , but more often a faint piety to the dead , a prolongation of rites that might have ended at the grave . It was absurd , if [you]1846-you came to think of it ; [Helen]245-helen and [Tibby]250-tibby came to think of it : [Margaret]339-margaret was too busy with [the house - agents]1847-the house - agents . The feudal ownership of land did bring dignity , whereas the modern ownership of movables is reducing [us]1848-us again to [a nomadic horde]1849-a nomadic horde . [We]1848-us are reverting to the civilization of luggage , and [historians of the future]1850-historians of the future will note how [the middle classes]1851-the middle classes accreted possessions without taking root in [the earth]4343-the earth , and may find in this the secret of [their]1851-the middle classes imaginative poverty . [The Schlegels]261-the schlegels were certainly the poorer for the loss of [Wickham Place]9-wickham place . It had helped to balance [their]1840-their lives , and almost to counsel [them]1840-their . Nor is [[their]1840-their ground - landlord]1853-their ground - landlord spiritually the richer . [He]1853-their ground - landlord has built [flats]3685-flats on [[its]1853-their ground - landlord site]1855-its site , [[his]1853-their ground - landlord [motor - cars]703-motor - cars]1856-his motor - cars grow swifter , [his]1853-their ground - landlord exposures of [Socialism]325-socialism more trenchant . But [he]1853-their ground - landlord has spilt the precious distillation of the years , and no chemistry of [his]1853-their ground - landlord can give it back to society again . [Margaret]339-margaret grew depressed ; [she]339-margaret was anxious to settle on [a house]3712-a house before [they]1840-their left [town]4259-town to pay [their]1840-their annual visit to [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt . [She]339-margaret enjoyed this visit , and wanted to have [her]339-margaret mind at ease for it . [Swanage]10-swanage , though dull , was stable , and this year [she]339-margaret longed more than usual for [its]10-swanage fresh air and for [the magnificent downs that guard [it]10-swanage on the north]1860-the magnificent downs that guard it on the north . But [London]2-london thwarted [her]339-margaret ; in [its]2-london atmosphere [she]339-margaret could not concentrate . [London]2-london only stimulates , it can not sustain ; and [Margaret]339-margaret , hurrying over [its]2-london surface for [a house]3712-a house without knowing what sort of [a house]3712-a house [she]339-margaret wanted , was paying for many a thrilling sensation in the past . [She]339-margaret could not even break loose from culture , and [her]339-margaret time was wasted by concerts which it would be a sin to miss , and invitations which it would never do to refuse . At last [she]339-margaret grew desperate ; [she]339-margaret resolved that [she]339-margaret would go nowhere and be at [home]3928-home to [no one]693-no one until [she]339-margaret found [a house]3712-a house , and broke the resolution in half an hour . Once [she]339-margaret had humorously lamented that [she]339-margaret had never been to [[Simpson]411-simpson 's restaurant in [the Strand]135-the strand]1866-simpson 's restaurant in the strand . Now a note arrived from [Miss Wilcox]404-miss wilcox , asking [her]339-margaret to lunch [there]3835-there . [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill was coming , and [the three]1574-the three would have such a jolly chat , and perhaps end up at [the Hippodrome]1869-the hippodrome . [Miss Wilcox]404-miss wilcox had changed perceptibly since [her]404-miss wilcox engagement . It was from [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles . It announced an " important change "[3661-the father] in [his]3661-the father plans . Owing to [Evie]253-evie 's marriage , [he]3661-the father had decided to give up [[his]3661-the father house in [Ducie Street]124-ducie street]1919-his house in ducie street , and was willing to let [it]1919-his house in ducie street on a yearly tenancy . It was a businesslike letter , and stated frankly what [he]3661-the father would do for [them]1908-they and what [he]3661-the father would not do . Also the rent . If [they]1908-they approved , [Margaret]339-margaret was to come up at once — the words were underlined , as is necessary when dealing with [women]596-women — and to go over [the house]558-the house with [him]3661-the father . The letter perturbed , because [she]339-margaret was not sure what it meant . "[339-margaret] But [her]339-margaret brain only tingled a little and was silent , and for a time [she]339-margaret sat gazing at the mincing waves , and wondering whether the news would seem strange to [the others]589-the others . " [You]339-margaret need n't go though — "[1143-her hostess] began [[her]339-margaret hostess]1143-her hostess . " [I]1143-her hostess need n't , but had n't [I]1143-her hostess better ? "[250-tibby] said [Tibby]250-tibby , a question that sounds silly , but was really extremely subtle , as [[his]250-tibby aunt]1926-his aunt found to [her]1926-his aunt cost when [she]1926-his aunt tried to answer it . [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles had eschewed those decorative schemes that wince , and relent , and refrain , and achieve beauty by sacrificing comfort and pluck . [She]339-margaret must show surprise if [he]249-charles expected it . An immense joy came over [her]339-margaret . It was indescribable . It had nothing to do with humanity , and most resembled the all - pervading happiness of fine weather . "[0-i] " [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had written instead . Ought [I]0-i to have written ? "[0-i] " Not at all . "[0-i] " There 's just one question — "[2004-she] [She]2004-she shook [her]2004-she head . [He]0-i looked a little bewildered , and [they]2005-they parted . [They]2005-they parted without shaking hands : [she]2004-she had kept the interview , for [his]0-i sake , in tints of the quietest grey . Yet [she]2004-she thrilled with happiness ere [she]2004-she reached [[her]2004-she own house]2006-her own house . [Others]3837-others had loved [her]2004-she in the past , if one may apply to [their]3837-others brief desires so grave a word , but [those others]2008-those others had been " [ninnies"—young[2008-those others] men who had nothing to do]4823-ninnies"—young men who had nothing to do , [old men who could find [nobody]4450-nobody]2009-old men who could find nobody better . And [she]2004-she had often " loved , "[2004-she] too , but only so far as the facts of sex demanded : mere yearnings for [the masculine]2011-the masculine , to be dismissed for what [they]2011-the masculine were worth , with a smile . Never before had [her]2004-she personality been touched . [She]2004-she was not young or very rich , and it amazed [her]2004-she that [a man of any standing]2012-a man of any standing should take [her]2004-she seriously . As [she]2004-she sat trying to do accounts in [[her]2004-she empty house]2013-her empty house , amidst beautiful pictures and noble books , waves of emotion broke , as if a tide of passion was flowing through the night air . [She]2004-she shook [her]2004-she head , tried to concentrate [her]2004-she attention , and failed . In vain did [she]2004-she repeat : " But [I]2004-she 've been through this sort of thing before . "[2004-she] [She]2004-she had never been through it ; the big machinery , as opposed to the little , had been set in motion , and the idea that [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles loved , obsessed [her]2004-she before [she]2004-she came to love [him]249-charles in return . [She]2004-she would come to no decision yet . " Oh , [sir]3748-sir , this is so sudden"—that[2004-she] prudish phrase exactly expressed [her]2004-she when [her]2004-she time came . Premonitions are not preparation . [She]2004-she must examine more closely [her]2004-she own nature and [his]249-charles ; [she]2004-she must talk it over judicially with [Helen]245-helen . It had been a strange love - scene — the central radiance unacknowledged from first to last . [She]2004-she , in [his]249-charles place , would have said " Ich liebe dich , "[2004-she] but perhaps it was not [his]249-charles habit to open the heart . [He]249-charles might have done it if [she]2004-she had pressed [him]249-charles — as a matter of duty , perhaps ; [England]31-england expects [every man]2014-every man to open [his]2014-every man heart once ; but the effort would have jarred [him]249-charles , and never , if [she]2004-she could avoid it , should [he]249-charles lose those defences that [he]249-charles had chosen to raise against [the world]805-the world . [He]249-charles must never be bothered with emotional talk , or with a display of sympathy . [He]249-charles was [an elderly man]2016-an elderly man now , and it would be futile and impudent to correct [him]249-charles . [Mrs. Wilcox]510-mrs. wilcox strayed in and out , ever [a welcome ghost]2017-a welcome ghost ; surveying the scene , thought [Margaret]246-margaret , without one hint of bitterness . If one wanted to show [a foreigner [England]31-england]2018-a foreigner england , perhaps the wisest course would be to take [him]249-charles to [the final section of [the Purbeck Hills]145-the purbeck hills]2019-the final section of the purbeck hills , and stand [him]249-charles on [[their]145-the purbeck hills summit]2020-their summit , a few miles to [the east of [Corfe]146-corfe]2021-the east of corfe . Then system after system of [[our]2022-our island]2023-our island would roll together under [his]249-charles feet . Beneath [him]249-charles is [the valley of [the Frome]147-the frome]2024-the valley of the frome , and [all [the wild lands]2026-the wild lands that come tossing down from [Dorchester]148-dorchester]2025-all the wild lands that come tossing down from dorchester , black and gold , to mirror [their]2025-all the wild lands that come tossing down from dorchester gorse in [the expanses of [Poole]149-poole]2027-the expanses of poole . [The valley of [the Stour]150-the stour]2028-the valley of the stour is beyond , [unaccountable stream]2029-unaccountable stream , dirty at [Blandford]151-blandford , pure at [Wimborne]152-wimborne — [the Stour]150-the stour , sliding out of [fat fields]2030-fat fields , to marry [the Avon]153-the avon beneath [the tower of [Christchurch]154-christchurch]2031-the tower of christchurch . [The valley of]2032-the valley of [the Avon]153-the avon — invisible , but far to the north the trained eye may see [Clearbury Ring]155-clearbury ring that guards it , and the imagination may leap beyond that on to [Salisbury]156-salisbury Plain itself , and beyond [the Plain]157-the plain to [all the glorious downs of [Central England]158-central england]2033-all the glorious downs of central england . Nor is [Suburbia]159-suburbia absent . [Bournemouth]94-bournemouth 's [ignoble coast]160-ignoble coast cowers to the right , heralding the pine - trees that mean , for all [their]2034-their beauty , [red houses]2035-red houses , and [the Stock Exchange]2036-the stock exchange , and extend to the gates of [London]2-london [itself]2-london . So tremendous is [[the City]962-the city 's trail]2038-the city 's trail ! But [the cliffs of [Freshwater]161-freshwater]2039-the cliffs of freshwater [it]962-the city shall never touch , and [the island]2040-the island will guard [[the Island]162-the island 's purity]2041-the island 's purity till the end of time . Seen from the west , [the Wight]163-the wight is beautiful beyond all laws of beauty . It is as if [a fragment of [England]31-england]2042-a fragment of england floated forward to greet the foreigner — chalk of [our]2043-our chalk , turf of [[our]2043-our turf]2044-our turf , epitome of what will follow . And behind the fragment lies [Southampton]141-southampton , hostess to [the nations]2045-the nations , and [Portsmouth]164-portsmouth , a latent fire , and all around [it]164-portsmouth , with double and treble collision of tides , swirls [the sea]3847-the sea . How [many villages]2047-many villages appear in this view ! How many [castles]2048-castles ! How many [churches]2049-churches , vanished or triumphant ! How many [ships]2050-ships , [railways]1087-railways , and [roads]2052-roads ! What incredible variety of men working beneath that lucent sky to what final end ! The reason fails , like a wave on [the Swanage beach]2053-the swanage beach ; the imagination swells , spreads , and deepens , until it becomes geographic and encircles [England]31-england . So [Frieda Mosebach]326-frieda , now [Frau Architect Liesecke]166-frau architect liesecke , and [mother to [[her]326-frieda husband 's baby]2055-her husband 's baby]2054-mother to her husband 's baby , was brought up to [these heights]2056-these heights to be impressed , and , after a prolonged gaze , [she]326-frieda said that [the hills]2057-the hills were more swelling here than in [Pomerania]365-pomerania , which was true , but did not seem to [Mrs.]2058-mrs. Munt apposite . It was not an original remark , nor had [Frieda]326-frieda appropriated it passionately , for [she]326-frieda had a patriotic rather than a philosophic mind . Yet it betrayed that interest in the universal which [the average Teuton]2074-the average teuton possesses and [the average Englishman]4205-the average englishman does not . It was , however illogically , the good , the beautiful , the true , as opposed to the respectable , [the pretty]2076-the pretty , [the adequate]2077-the adequate .
