"[245-helen] [She]245-helen poured the sentence forth in one breath , but [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister understood it , because it touched on thoughts that were familiar between [them]2099-they . " That 's foolish . In the first place , [I]245-helen disagree about the outer life . Well , [we]2099-they 've often argued that . The real point is that there is the widest gulf between [my]245-helen love - making and [yours]4867-yours . [Yours]4867-yours — was romance ; [mine]245-helen will be prose . [I]245-helen 'm not running it down — a very good kind of prose , but well considered , well thought out . For instance , [I]245-helen know all [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles 's faults . [He]249-charles 's afraid of emotion . [He]249-charles cares too much about success , too little about the past . [His]249-charles sympathy lacks poetry , and so is n't sympathy really . [I]245-helen 'd even say"—she[245-helen] looked at the shining lagoons—"that , spiritually , [he]249-charles 's not as honest as [I]245-helen am . Does n't that satisfy [you]545-her sister ? "[245-helen] " No , it does n't , "[245-helen] said [Helen]245-helen . " It makes [me]245-helen feel worse and worse . [You]545-her sister must be mad . "[245-helen] [Margaret]246-margaret made a movement of irritation . " [I]246-margaret do n't intend [him]249-charles , or [any man]4868-any man or [any woman]4869-any woman , to be all [my]246-margaret life — good heavens , no ! There are heaps of things in [me]246-margaret that [he]249-charles does n't , and shall never , understand . "[246-margaret] Thus [she]246-margaret spoke before the wedding ceremony and the physical union , before the astonishing glass shade had fallen that interposes between [married couples]2100-married couples and [the world]805-the world . [She]246-margaret was to keep [her]246-margaret independence more than do [most women]1006-most women as yet . Marriage was to alter [her]246-margaret fortunes rather than [her]246-margaret character , and [she]246-margaret was not far wrong in boasting that [she]246-margaret understood [[her]246-margaret future husband]2103-her future husband . " So with [him]249-charles , "[246-margaret] [she]246-margaret continued . " If [Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes had n't worked and died in [England]31-england for thousands of years , [you]4870-you and [I]246-margaret could n't sit here without having [our]4871-our throats cut . " [One]559-one would lose something , "[245-helen] murmured [Helen]245-helen , apparently to [herself]245-helen . [England]31-england was alive , throbbing through [all [her]31-england estuaries]2108-all her estuaries , crying for joy through the mouths of all [her]31-england gulls , and the north wind , with contrary motion , blew stronger against [her]31-england rising seas . What did it mean ? For what end are [her]31-england fair complexities , [her]31-england changes of soil , [[her]31-england sinuous coast]2109-her sinuous coast ? Does [she]31-england belong to those who have moulded [her]31-england and made [her]31-england feared by [other lands]2110-other lands , or to [those who have added nothing to [her]31-england power]2111-those who have added nothing to her power , but have somehow seen [her]31-england , seen [the whole island]2112-the whole island at once , lying as [a jewel in a silver sea]2113-a jewel in a silver sea , sailing as [a ship of souls]2114-a ship of souls , with [all [the brave world]2116-the brave world 's fleet]2115-all the brave world 's fleet accompanying [her]31-england towards eternity ? [Margaret]246-margaret had often wondered at the disturbance that takes place in [[the world]805-the world 's waters]2118-the world 's waters , when [Love]434-love , who seems so tiny a pebble , slips in . Whom does [Love]434-love concern beyond [the beloved]2119-the beloved and [the lover]2120-the lover ? Yet [his]434-love impact deluges a hundred shores . No doubt the disturbance is really the spirit of [the generations]2121-the generations , welcoming [the new generation]2122-the new generation , and chafing against the ultimate Fate , who holds [all the seas]2123-all the seas in the palm of [her]2124-her hand . But [Love]434-love can not understand this . [He]434-love can not comprehend another 's infinity ; [he]434-love is conscious only of [his]434-love own — flying sunbeam , falling rose , pebble that asks for one quiet plunge below the fretting interplay of space and time . [He]434-love knows that [he]434-love will survive at the end of things , and be gathered by [Fate]397-fate as a jewel from the slime , and be handed with admiration round [the assembly of the gods]2125-the assembly of the gods . " [Men]597-men did produce this , "[2126-they] [they]2126-they will say , and , saying , [they]2126-they will give [men]597-men immortality . But meanwhile — what agitations meanwhile ! The foundations of Property and Propriety are laid bare , twin rocks ; [Family Pride]2128-family pride flounders to the surface , puffing and blowing , and refusing to be comforted ; [Theology]435-theology , vaguely ascetic , gets up a nasty ground swell . Then [the lawyers]2129-the lawyers are aroused — cold brood — and creep out of [their]2129-the lawyers holes . [They]2129-the lawyers do what [they]2129-the lawyers can ; [they]2129-the lawyers tidy up Property and Propriety , reassure [Theology]435-theology and [Family Pride]177-family pride . Half - guineas are poured on [the troubled waters]2130-the troubled waters , [the lawyers]2129-the lawyers creep back , and , if all has gone well , [Love]434-love joins [one man]2132-one man and [woman]4329-woman together in Matrimony . [Margaret]246-margaret had expected the disturbance , and was not irritated by it . For [a sensitive woman]2134-a sensitive woman [she]2134-a sensitive woman had steady nerves , and could bear with the incongruous and the grotesque ; and , besides , there was nothing excessive about [her]2134-a sensitive woman love - affair . " [A younger woman]4912-a younger woman might have resented [his]249-charles masterly ways , but [Margaret]246-margaret had too firm a grip of life to make a fuss . [She]246-margaret was , in [her]246-margaret own way , as masterly . If [he]249-charles was [a fortress]964-a fortress [she]246-margaret was [a mountain peak]4914-a mountain peak , whom all might tread , but whom the snows made nightly virginal . Disdaining the heroic outfit , excitable in [her]246-margaret methods , garrulous , episodical , shrill , [she]246-margaret misled [[her]246-margaret lover]4618-her lover much as [she]246-margaret had misled [[her]246-margaret aunt]613-her aunt . [He]249-charles mistook [her]246-margaret fertility for weakness . [He]249-charles supposed [her]246-margaret "[246-margaret] as clever as [they]2198-they make ['em]2199-'em , " but no more , not realizing that [she]246-margaret was penetrating to the depths of [his]249-charles soul , and approving of what [she]246-margaret found there . And if insight were sufficient , if the inner life were the whole of life , [their]4917-their happiness has been assured . [They]4917-their walked ahead briskly . [The parade]4918-the parade and [the road]957-the road after [it]4918-the parade were well lighted , but it was darker in [[Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley 's garden]4920-aunt juley 's garden . As [they]4917-their were going up by the side - paths , through some rhododendrons , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles , who was in front , said "[246-margaret] [Margaret]246-margaret " rather huskily , turned , dropped [his]249-charles cigar , and took [her]246-margaret in [his]249-charles arms . [She]246-margaret was startled , and nearly screamed , but recovered [herself]246-margaret at once , and kissed with genuine love the lips that were pressed against [her]246-margaret own . It was [their]4917-their first kiss , and when it was over [he]249-charles saw [her]246-margaret safely to the door and rang the bell for [her]246-margaret , but disappeared into the night before [the maid]1134-the maid answered it . On looking back , the incident displeased [her]246-margaret . It was so isolated . Nothing in [their]4917-their previous conversation had heralded it , and , worse still , no tenderness had ensued . If [a man]3695-a man can not lead up to passion [he]3695-a man can at all events lead down from it , and [she]246-margaret had hoped , after [her]246-margaret complaisance , for some interchange of gentle words . But [he]249-charles had hurried away as if ashamed , and for an instant [she]246-margaret was reminded of [Helen]245-helen and [Paul]247-paul . [Charles]249-charles had just been scolding [[his]249-charles Dolly]4923-his dolly . [She]246-margaret deserved the scolding , and had bent before it , but [her]246-margaret head , though bloody , was unsubdued , and [her]246-margaret chirrupings began to mingle with [his]249-charles retreating thunder . " "[246-margaret] [I]0-i call the way [you]0-i twist things round and make them hang together most unfair . [You]0-i could n't have been nastier if [you]0-i 'd caught [me]0-i flirting . Could [he]439-uncle percy , [diddums]2207-diddums ? " "[439-uncle percy] [We]2208-we 're in a bad hole , and must make the best of it . [I]0-i shall answer [the pater]2209-the pater 's letter civilly . [He]439-uncle percy 's evidently anxious to do the decent thing . But [I]0-i do not intend to forget these [Schlegels]261-the schlegels in a hurry . As long as [they]2210-their 're on [their]2210-their best behaviour — [Dolly]336-dolly , are [you]336-dolly listening ? — [we]2208-we 'll behave , too . But if [I]0-i find [them]2210-their giving [themselves]2210-their airs , or monopolizing [[my]0-i father]3721-my father , or at all ill - treating [him]3721-my father , or worrying [him]3721-my father with [their]2210-their artistic beastliness , [I]0-i intend to put [my]0-i foot down , yes , firmly . Taking [[my]0-i mother]4396-my mother 's place ! Heaven knows what [poor old Paul]247-paul will say when the news reaches [him]247-paul . " The interlude closes . It has taken place in [[Charles]249-charles 's garden]4925-charles 's garden at [Hilton]29-hilton . [He]249-charles and [Dolly]336-dolly are sitting in deck - chairs , and [their]2210-their motor is regarding [them]2210-their placidly from [[its]4926-its garage]4927-its garage across [the lawn]579-the lawn . A short - frocked edition of [Charles]249-charles also regards [them]2210-their placidly ; a perambulator edition is squeaking ; a third edition is expected shortly . Nature is turning out [Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes in [this peaceful abode]4929-this peaceful abode , so that [they]251-the wilcoxes may inherit [the earth]4343-the earth . [Margaret]246-margaret greeted [[her]246-margaret lord]4931-her lord with peculiar tenderness on the morrow . Mature as [he]4931-her lord was , [she]246-margaret might yet be able to help [him]4931-her lord to the building of the rainbow bridge that should connect the prose in [us]4932-us with the passion . Without it [we]4932-us are meaningless fragments , [half monks]4933-half monks , half beasts , unconnected arches that have never joined into [a man]3695-a man . With it love is born , and alights on the highest curve , glowing against the grey , sober against the fire . Happy [the man who sees from either aspect the glory of these outspread wings]4935-the man who sees from either aspect the glory of these outspread wings . [The roads of [his]4931-her lord soul]4936-the roads of his soul lie clear , and [he]4931-her lord and [[his]4931-her lord friends]4611-his friends shall find easy - going . It was hard - going in [the roads of [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles 's soul]4938-the roads of mr. wilcox 's soul . From boyhood [he]0-i had neglected [them]4938-the roads of mr. wilcox 's soul . "[247-paul] [I]0-i am not [a fellow who bothers about [my]0-i own inside]2213-a fellow who bothers about my own inside . " Outwardly [he]0-i was cheerful , reliable , and brave ; but within , all had reverted to chaos , ruled , so far as it was ruled at all , by an incomplete asceticism . Whether as [boy]4939-boy , [husband]1157-husband , or [widower]4941-widower , [he]0-i had always the sneaking belief that bodily passion is bad , a belief that is desirable only when held passionately . Religion had confirmed [him]0-i . The words that were read aloud on Sunday to [him]0-i and to [other respectable men]4942-other respectable men were the words that had once kindled the souls of [St. Catharine]441-st. catharine and [St. Francis]442-st. francis into a white - hot hatred of the carnal . [He]0-i could - not be as [the saints]4943-the saints and love [the Infinite]4944-the infinite with a seraphic ardour , but [he]0-i could be a little ashamed of loving [a wife]1332-a wife . "[0-i] Amabat , amare timebat . " And it was here that [Margaret]246-margaret hoped to help [him]0-i . It did not seem so difficult . [She]246-margaret need trouble [him]0-i with no gift of [her]246-margaret own . [She]246-margaret would only point out the salvation that was latent in [his]0-i own soul , and in the soul of [every man]2014-every man . Only connect ! That was the whole of [her]246-margaret sermon . Only connect the prose and the passion , and both will be exalted , and human love will be seen at its height . Live in fragments no longer . Only connect , and the beast and [the monk , robbed of the isolation that is life to either]4947-the monk , robbed of the isolation that is life to either , will die . Nor was the message difficult to give . It need not take the form of a good "[0-i] talking . " By quiet indications [the bridge]4586-the bridge would be built and span [their]4949-their lives with beauty . But [she]246-margaret failed . For there was one quality in [Henry]349-henry for which [she]246-margaret was never prepared , however much [she]246-margaret reminded [herself]246-margaret of it : [his]0-i obtuseness . [He]0-i simply did not notice things , and there was no more to be said . [He]0-i never noticed that [Helen]245-helen and [Frieda]326-frieda were hostile , or that [Tibby]250-tibby was not interested in currant plantations ; [he]0-i never noticed the lights and shades that exist in the grayest conversation , the finger - posts , the milestones , the collisions , the illimitable views . Once — on another occasion — [she]246-margaret scolded [him]0-i about it . [He]0-i was puzzled , but replied with a laugh : "[0-i] [My]0-i motto is Concentrate . [I]0-i 've no intention of frittering away [my]0-i strength on that sort of thing . " "[0-i] It is n't frittering away the strength , " [she]246-margaret protested . "[0-i] It 's enlarging the space in which [you]2214-you may be strong . " [He]0-i answered : "[0-i] [You]2214-you 're [a clever little woman]2215-a clever little woman , but [my]0-i motto 's Concentrate . " And this morning [he]0-i concentrated with a vengeance . [They]2216-we met in the rhododendrons of yesterday . In the daylight the bushes were inconsiderable and the path was bright in the morning sun . [She]246-margaret was with [Helen]245-helen , who had been ominously quiet since the affair was settled . "[0-i] Here [we]2216-we all are ! " [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles , intent on [his]249-charles business with [Mrs. Munt]258-mrs. munt , was going steadily on , but the last remark made [him]249-charles say : "[0-i] What ? What 's that ? ' [[My]0-i dear]623-my dear [Helen]245-helen — " "[245-helen] Is that [your]249-charles point ? [A man who had little money]2244-a man who had little money has less — that 's [mine]249-charles . "[693-no one] [You]245-helen 're not to blame . [No one]693-no one 's to blame . " "[693-no one] Is [no one]693-no one to blame for anything ? " "[2247-we] [We]2247-we have told [you]245-helen about [the fellow]2240-the fellow twice already , " said [Helen]245-helen . "[2247-we] [You]245-helen have even met [the fellow]2240-the fellow . [We]2247-we — [we]2247-we , [the upper classes]2255-the upper classes — thought [we]2247-we would help [him]2240-the fellow from the height of [our]2247-we superior knowledge — and here 's the result ! " [He]2240-the fellow raised [his]2240-the fellow finger . "[2254-an extravagant imbecile] Now , a word of advice . " "[2254-an extravagant imbecile] [I]0-i require no more advice . " "[4328-his wife] A word of advice . Do n't take up that sentimental attitude over [the poor]3941-the poor . See that [she]4328-his wife does n't , [Margaret]246-margaret . [The poor]3941-the poor are poor , and [one]559-one 's sorry for [them]3941-the poor , but there it is . As civilization moves forward , the shoe is bound to pinch in places , and it 's absurd to pretend that [anyone]3964-anyone is responsible personally . Neither [you]246-margaret , nor [I]0-i , nor [[my]0-i informant]2260-my informant , nor [the man who informed [him]2240-the fellow , nor [the directors of [the Porphyrion]393-the porphyrion]2262-the directors of the porphyrion]2261-the man who informed him , nor the directors of the porphyrion , are to blame for [this clerk]2223-this clerk 's loss of salary . It 's just the shoe pinching — [no one]693-no one can help it ; and it might easily have been worse . " [Helen]245-helen quivered with indignation . "[393-the porphyrion] By all means subscribe to charities — subscribe to [them]2265-them largely — but do n't get carried away by absurd schemes of Social Reform . [I]0-i see a good deal behind the scenes , and [you]246-margaret can take it from [me]0-i that there is no Social Question — except for [a few journalists who try to get a living out of the phrase]2266-a few journalists who try to get a living out of the phrase . There are just [rich and poor]2267-rich and poor , as there always have been and always will be . Point [me]0-i out a time when [men]597-men have been equal — " "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't say — " "[0-i] Point [me]0-i out a time when desire for equality has made [them]597-men happier . No , no . [You]246-margaret ca n't . There always have been rich and poor . [I]0-i 'm [no fatalist]2269-no fatalist . Heaven forbid ! But [our]2270-our civilization is moulded by great impersonal forces " ( [his]0-i voice grew complacent ; it always did when [he]0-i eliminated the personal ) , "[246-margaret] and there always will be rich and poor . [You]246-margaret ca n't deny it " ( and now it was a respectful voice)—"and[246-margaret] [you]246-margaret ca n't deny that , in spite of all , the tendency of civilization has on the whole been upward . At every turn of speech [one]559-one was confronted with reality and the absolute . Perhaps [Margaret]246-margaret grew too old for metaphysics , perhaps [Henry]349-henry was weaning [her]246-margaret from [them]4972-them , but [she]246-margaret felt that there was something a little unbalanced in the mind that so readily shreds the visible . "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i see , [dear]629-dear ; it 's about halfway between , " [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley had hazarded in earlier years . No ; truth , being alive , was not halfway between anything . It was only to be found by continuous excursions into [either realm]4975-either realm , and though proportion is the final secret , to espouse it at the outset is to insure sterility . [Helen]245-helen , agreeing here , disagreeing there , would have talked till midnight , but [Margaret]246-margaret , with [her]246-margaret packing to do , focussed the conversation on [Henry]349-henry . [Their]4976-their inner life was so safe that [they]4976-their could bargain over externals in a way that would have been incredible to [Aunt Juley]255-aunt juley , and impossible for [Tibby]250-tibby or [Charles]249-charles . There are moments when the inner life actually "[0-i] pays , " when years of self - scrutiny , conducted for no ulterior motive , are suddenly of practical use . Such moments are still rare in [the West]188-the west ; that they come at all promises a fairer future . There was just the ordinary surface scum of ledgers and polished counters and brass bars that began and stopped for no possible reason , of electric - light globes blossoming in triplets , of little rabbit hutches faced with glass or wire , of little rabbits . Perhaps [Hertfordshire]67-hertfordshire is scarcely intended for [motorists]4995-motorists . [He]448-mr. bryce chaffed [Margaret]246-margaret , too , and [Margaret]246-margaret , roused from a grave meditation , was pleased , and chaffed [him]448-mr. bryce back . "[2313-you] Kiss [them]2312-them now , and come away , " said [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles . By this time it was raining steadily . [The car]1354-the car came round with the hood up , and again [she]336-dolly lost all sense of space . " "[2314-we] [We]2314-we are . " "[2314-we] Well , [I]0-i never ! In years ago it seemed so far away . [She]336-dolly was about to open it , when [Henry]349-henry said : "[2314-we] That 's no good ; it 's locked . Who 's got the key ? " As [he]349-henry had [himself]349-henry forgotten to call for the key at [the farm]586-the farm , [no one]693-no one replied . [He]349-henry also wanted to know who had left the front gate open , since a cow had strayed in from [the road]957-the road , and was spoiling the croquet lawn . Then [he]349-henry said rather crossly : "[246-margaret] [Margaret]246-margaret , [you]246-margaret wait in the dry . [I]0-i 'll go down for the key . It is n't a hundred yards . " May n't [I]246-margaret come too ? "[246-margaret] " No ; [I]246-margaret shall be back before [I]246-margaret 'm gone . "[246-margaret] Then [the car]1354-the car turned away , and it was as if a curtain had risen . For the second time that day [she]246-margaret saw the appearance of [the earth]4343-the earth . There were the greengage - trees that [Helen]245-helen had once described , there [the tennis lawn]2317-the tennis lawn , there the hedge that would be glorious with dog - roses in June , but the vision now was of black and palest green . Down by the dell - hole more vivid colours were awakening , and Lent Lilies stood sentinel on its margin , or advanced in battalions over the grass . Tulips were a tray of jewels . [She]246-margaret could not see the wych - elm tree , but a branch of the celebrated vine , studded with velvet knobs , had covered [the porch]1371-the porch . [She]246-margaret was struck by the fertility of the soil ; [she]246-margaret had seldom been in [a garden]2319-a garden where the flowers looked so well , and even the weeds [she]246-margaret was idly plucking out of [the porch]1371-the porch were intensely green . Why had [poor Mr. Bryce]448-mr. bryce fled from all this beauty ? For [she]246-margaret had already decided that [the place]2298-the place was beautiful . " [Naughty cow]5024-naughty cow ! Go away ! "[246-margaret] cried [Margaret]246-margaret to the cow , but without indignation . Harder came the rain , pouring out of a windless sky , and spattering up from the notice - boards of [the house - agents]1847-the house - agents , which lay in a row on [the lawn where [Charles]249-charles had hurled them]2323-the lawn where charles had hurled them . [She]246-margaret must have interviewed [Charles]249-charles in [another world]2324-another world — where [one]559-one did have interviews . How [Helen]245-helen would revel in such a notion ! [Charles]249-charles dead , [all people]2326-all people dead , nothing alive but [houses]884-houses and [gardens]2328-gardens . The obvious dead , the intangible alive , and — no connection at all between [them]2329-them ! [Margaret]246-margaret smiled . Would that [her]246-margaret own fancies were as clear - cut ! Would that [she]246-margaret could deal as high - handedly with [the world]805-the world ! Smiling and sighing , [she]246-margaret laid [her]246-margaret hand upon the door . It opened . [The house]558-the house was not locked up at all . [She]246-margaret hesitated . Ought [she]246-margaret to wait for [Henry]349-henry ? [He]349-henry felt strongly about [property]1837-property , and might prefer to show [her]246-margaret over [himself]349-henry . On the other hand , [he]349-henry had told [her]246-margaret to keep in the dry , and [the porch]1371-the porch was beginning to drip . So [she]246-margaret went in , and the drought from inside slammed the door behind . Desolation greeted [her]246-margaret . Dirty finger - prints were on the hall - windows , flue and rubbish on [its]558-the house unwashed boards . The civilization of luggage had been [here]575-here for a month , and then decamped . [Dining - room]552-dining - room and [drawing room]2336-drawing room — right and left — were guessed only by [their]2337-their wall - papers . They were just rooms where [one]559-one could shelter from the rain . Across the ceiling of each ran a great beam . [The dining - room]3782-the dining - room and [hall]550-hall revealed [theirs]2337-their openly , but [the drawing - room]4015-the drawing - room 's was match - boarded — because the facts of life must be concealed from [ladies]941-ladies ? [Drawing - room]553-drawing - room , [dining - room]552-dining - room , and [hall]550-hall — how petty the names sounded ! [Here]575-here were simply [three rooms where [children]4472-children could play and [friends]592-friends shelter from the rain]2347-three rooms where children could play and friends shelter from the rain . Yes , and they were beautiful . Then [she]246-margaret opened one of the doors opposite — there were two — and exchanged wall - papers for whitewash . It was [the servants]4228-the servants ' part , though [she]246-margaret scarcely realized that : just [rooms]2351-rooms again , where [friends]592-friends might shelter . [The garden]562-the garden at the back was full of flowering cherries and plums . Farther on were hints of [the meadow]580-the meadow and [a black cliff of pines]2355-a black cliff of pines . Yes , [the meadow]580-the meadow was beautiful . Penned in by the desolate weather , [she]246-margaret recaptured the sense of space which [the motor]771-the motor had tried to rob from [her]246-margaret . [She]246-margaret remembered again that ten square miles are not ten times as wonderful as one square mile , that a thousand square miles are not practically the same as [heaven]827-heaven . The phantom of bigness , which [London]2-london encourages , was laid for ever when [she]246-margaret paced from [the hall]907-the hall at [Howards End]339-margaret to [[its]907-the hall kitchen]2360-its kitchen and heard the rains run this way and that where the watershed of the roof divided [them]2361-them . Now [Helen]245-helen came to [her]246-margaret mind , scrutinizing half [Wessex]19-wessex from [the ridge of [the Purbeck Downs]196-the purbeck downs]2362-the ridge of the purbeck downs , and saying : " [You]246-margaret will have to lose something . "[245-helen] [She]245-helen was not so sure . For instance , [she]245-helen would double [[her]245-helen kingdom]2363-her kingdom by opening the door that concealed the stairs . Now [she]245-helen thought of the map of [Africa]64-africa ; of [empires]2364-empires ; of [[her]245-helen father]3860-her father ; of [the two supreme nations]2366-the two supreme nations , streams of whose life warmed [her]245-helen blood , but , mingling , had cooled [her]245-helen brain . [She]245-helen paced back into [the hall]907-the hall , and as [she]245-helen did so [the house]558-the house reverberated . " Is that [you]5025-you , [Henry]349-henry ? "[245-helen] But it was the heart of [the house]558-the house beating , faintly at first , then loudly , martially . It dominated the rain . It is the starved imagination , not the well - nourished , that is afraid . [Margaret]246-margaret flung open the door to the stairs . A noise as of drums seemed to deafen [her]246-margaret . [Her]2389-she evening was pleasant . The sense of flux which had haunted [her]2389-she all the year disappeared for a time . "[349-henry] No , it was n't ; and if [he]349-henry did not quite understand it , [the artistic crew]2409-the artistic crew would still less : it was English , and the wych - elm that [she]2410-she saw from the window was an English tree . [Margaret]452-margaret thought of [them]2416-them now , and was to think of [them]2416-them through many a windy night and [London]2-london day , but to compare either to [man]3767-man , to [woman]4329-woman , always dwarfed the vision . [Margaret]246-margaret found that [she]246-margaret was expected to figure at this function , and to figure largely ; it would be such an opportunity , said [Henry]349-henry , for [her]246-margaret to get to know [his]349-henry set . [Henry]349-henry [she]246-margaret loved , but [his]349-henry set promised to be another matter . [He]349-henry had not the knack of surrounding [himself]349-henry with [nice people]2427-nice people — indeed , for [a man of ability and virtue]2428-a man of ability and virtue [his]349-henry choice had been singularly unfortunate ; [he]349-henry had no guiding principle beyond a certain preference for mediocrity ; [he]349-henry was content to settle one of the greatest things in life haphazard , and so , while [his]349-henry investments went right , [[his]349-henry friends]4611-his friends generally went wrong . [She]246-margaret would be told , " Oh , [So - and - so 's a good sort]5087-so - and - so 's a good sort — [a thundering good sort]5088-a thundering good sort , "[246-margaret] and find , on meeting [him]349-henry , that [he]349-henry was [a brute]2430-a brute or [a bore]2431-a bore . [The " thundering good sort "]5089-the " thundering good sort "[5089-the " thundering good sort "] might at any moment become " a fellow for whom [I]5089-the " thundering good sort " never did have much use , and have less now , "[5089-the " thundering good sort "] and be shaken off cheerily into oblivion . [Margaret]246-margaret had done the same as [a schoolgirl]2432-a schoolgirl . Now [she]246-margaret never forgot anyone for whom [she]246-margaret had once cared ; [she]246-margaret connected , though the connection might be bitter , and [she]246-margaret hoped that some day [Henry]349-henry would do the same . [Evie]253-evie was not to be married from [Ducie Street]124-ducie street . [She]253-evie had a fancy for [something rural]2433-something rural , and , besides , [no one]693-no one would be in [London]2-london then , so [she]253-evie left [her]253-evie boxes for a few weeks at [Oniton Grange]127-oniton grange , and [her]253-evie banns were duly published in [the parish church]2435-the parish church , and for a couple of days [the little town]2436-the little town , dreaming between [the ruddy hills]2437-the ruddy hills , was roused by the clang of [our]2438-our civilization , and drew up by the roadside to let the motors pass . [Oniton]246-margaret had been a discovery of [Mr. Wilcox's]457-mr. wilcox's — a discovery of which [he]457-mr. wilcox's was not altogether proud . [It]2439-it was up towards [the Welsh border]2440-the welsh border , and so difficult of access that [he]457-mr. wilcox's had concluded it must be something special . [A ruined castle]2441-a ruined castle stood in [the grounds]2442-the grounds . But having got [there]3835-there , what was one to do ? The shooting was bad , the fishing indifferent , and [women - folk]2444-women - folk reported the scenery as nothing much . [The place]2298-the place turned out to be in [the wrong part of [Shropshire]126-shropshire]2446-the wrong part of shropshire , damn it , and though [he]457-mr. wilcox's never damned [[his]457-mr. wilcox's own property]2447-his own property aloud , [he]457-mr. wilcox's was only waiting to get it off [his]457-mr. wilcox's hands , and then to let fly . [Evie]253-evie 's marriage was its last appearance in public . As soon as [a tenant]2448-a tenant was found , [it]2298-the place became [a house for which [he]457-mr. wilcox's never had had much use , and had less now , and , like [Howards End]339-margaret]2449-a house for which he never had had much use , and had less now , and , like howards end , faded into [Limbo]198-limbo . But on [Margaret Oniton]246-margaret was destined to make a lasting impression . [She]246-margaret regarded [it]2298-the place as [[her]246-margaret future home]2450-her future home , and was anxious to start straight with [the clergy]2451-the clergy , etc . , and , if possible , to see something of the local life . [It]2298-the place was [a market - town]2452-a market - town — as tiny a one as [England]31-england possesses — and had for ages served [that lonely valley]2453-that lonely valley , and guarded [our]2454-our marches against [the Kelt]472-the kelt . In spite of the occasion , in spite of the numbing hilarity that greeted [her]246-margaret as soon as [she]246-margaret got into [the reserved saloon at [Paddington]14-paddington]2455-the reserved saloon at paddington , [her]246-margaret senses were awake and watching , and though [Oniton]246-margaret was to prove one of [her]246-margaret innumerable false starts , [she]246-margaret never forgot it , nor the things that happened there . [Her]246-margaret wedding would either be ramshackly or bourgeois — [she]246-margaret hoped the latter . Such an affair as the present , staged with a deftness that was almost beautiful , lay beyond [her]246-margaret powers and those of [[her]246-margaret friends]4207-her friends . [He]249-charles had [two children]5141-two children to look after , and more coming , and day by day [they]5141-two children seemed less likely to grow up [rich men]5142-rich men . "[249-charles] It is all very well , " [he]249-charles reflected , "[2209-the pater] [the pater]2209-the pater saying that [he]2209-the pater will be just to all , but one ca n't be just indefinitely . Money is n't elastic . What 's to happen if [Evie]253-evie has [a family]802-a family ? And , come to that , so may [the pater]2209-the pater . There 'll not be enough to go round , for there 's none coming in , either through [Dolly]336-dolly or [Percy]439-uncle percy . It 's damnable ! " [He]249-charles looked enviously at [the Grange]2523-the grange , whose windows poured light and laughter . First and last , this wedding would cost a pretty penny . [Two ladies]5144-two ladies were strolling up and down [the garden terrace]5145-the garden terrace , and as the syllables "[2209-the pater] Imperialism " were wafted to [his]249-charles ears , [he]249-charles guessed that [one of [them]5144-two ladies]5146-one of them was [[his]249-charles aunt]1926-his aunt . "[2209-the pater] Every one for [himself]2209-the pater , " [he]249-charles repeated — a maxim which had cheered [him]249-charles in the past , but which rang grimly enough among [the ruins of [Oniton]246-margaret]5149-the ruins of oniton . [He]249-charles lacked [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father 's ability in business , and so had an ever higher regard for money ; unless [he]249-charles could inherit plenty , [he]249-charles feared to leave [[his]249-charles children]3840-his children poor . As [he]249-charles sat thinking , [one of [the ladies]916-the ladies]5152-one of the ladies left [the terrace]5154-the terrace and walked into [the meadow]580-the meadow ; [he]249-charles recognized [her]5152-one of the ladies as [Margaret]246-margaret by the white bandage that gleamed on [her]5152-one of the ladies arm , and put out [his]249-charles cigar , lest the gleam should betray [him]249-charles . [She]5152-one of the ladies climbed up [the mound]5156-the mound in zigzags , and at times stooped down , as if [she]5152-one of the ladies was stroking the turf . It sounds absolutely incredible , but for a moment [Charles]249-charles thought that [she]5152-one of the ladies was in love with [him]249-charles , and had come out to tempt [him]249-charles . [Charles]249-charles believed in temptresses , who are indeed [the strong man]5157-the strong man 's necessary complement , and having no sense of humour , [he]249-charles could not purge [himself]249-charles of the thought by a smile . [[Margaret]246-margaret , who was engaged to [[his]249-charles father]3799-his father , and [[his]249-charles sister]4364-his sister 's wedding - guest]5158-margaret , who was engaged to his father , and his sister 's wedding - guest , kept on [her]246-margaret way without noticing [him]249-charles , and [he]249-charles admitted that [he]249-charles had wronged [her]5152-one of the ladies on this point . But what was [she]5152-one of the ladies doing ? Why was [she]5152-one of the ladies stumbling about amongst the rubble and catching [her]5152-one of the ladies dress in brambles and burrs ? As [she]5152-one of the ladies edged round [the keep]5161-the keep , [she]5152-one of the ladies must have got to leeward and smelt [his]249-charles cigar - smoke , for [she]5152-one of the ladies exclaimed , "[2209-the pater] Hullo ! Who 's that ? " [Charles]249-charles made no answer . "[471-saxon] [Saxon]471-saxon or [Kelt]472-the kelt ? " [she]5152-one of the ladies continued , laughing in the darkness . "[471-saxon] But it does n't matter . Whichever [you]2556-you are , [you]2556-you will have to listen to [me]0-i . [I]0-i love [this place]4726-this place . [I]0-i love [Shropshire]126-shropshire . [I]0-i hate [London]2-london . [I]0-i am glad that this will be [[my]0-i home]2558-my home . Ah , [dear"—she]5162-dear"—she was now moving back towards the house—"what[471-saxon] a comfort to have arrived ! " "[2206-that woman] [That woman]2206-that woman means mischief , " thought [Charles]249-charles , and compressed [his]249-charles lips . In a few minutes [he]249-charles followed [her]5152-one of the ladies indoors , as the ground was getting damp . Mists were rising from [the river]4199-the river , and presently it became invisible , though it whispered more loudly . There had been a heavy downpour in [the Welsh hills]5164-the welsh hills . Next morning a fine mist covered [the peninsula]2521-the peninsula . The weather promised well , and the outline of [the castle mound]5137-the castle mound grew clearer each moment that [Margaret]246-margaret watched it . Presently [she]246-margaret saw [the keep]5161-the keep , and the sun painted the rubble gold , and charged the white sky with blue . The shadow of [the house]558-the house gathered itself together and fell over [the garden]562-the garden . A cat looked up at [her]246-margaret window and mewed . Lastly [the river]4199-the river appeared , still holding the mists between [its]4199-the river banks and [its]4199-the river overhanging alders , and only visible as far as [a hill]5171-a hill , which cut off [its]4199-the river upper reaches . [Margaret]246-margaret was fascinated by Oniton . [She]246-margaret had said that [she]246-margaret loved it , but it was rather its romantic tension that held [her]246-margaret . [The rounded Druids of whom [she]246-margaret had caught glimpses in [her]246-margaret drive]5172-the rounded druids of whom she had caught glimpses in her drive , the rivers hurrying down from them to [England]31-england , the carelessly modelled masses of [the lower hills]5173-the lower hills , thrilled [her]246-margaret with poetry . [The house]558-the house was insignificant , but the prospect from [it]558-the house would be an eternal joy , and [she]246-margaret thought of all [the friends [she]246-margaret would have to stop in [it]558-the house]5175-the friends she would have to stop in it , and of the conversion of [Henry]349-henry [himself]349-henry to a rural life . Society , too , promised favourably . [The rector of [the parish]5177-the parish]5176-the rector of the parish had dined with [them]5178-them last night , and [she]246-margaret found that [he]5176-the rector of the parish was [a friend of [[her]246-margaret father]3860-her father 's]5179-a friend of her father 's , and so knew what to find in [her]246-margaret . [She]246-margaret liked [him]5176-the rector of the parish . [He]5176-the rector of the parish would introduce [her]246-margaret to [the town]4198-the town . While , on [her]246-margaret other side , [Sir James Bidder]455-sir james bidder sat , repeating that [she]246-margaret only had to give the word , and [he]455-sir james bidder would whip up [the county families]5182-the county families for twenty miles round . Whether [Sir James]455-sir james bidder , who was [Garden Seeds]473-garden seeds , had promised what [he]455-sir james bidder could perform , [she]246-margaret doubted , but so long as [Henry]349-henry mistook [them]5182-the county families for [the county families]5182-the county families when [they]5182-the county families did call , [she]246-margaret was content . [Charles]249-charles and [Albert Fussell]337-albert fussell now crossed [the lawn]579-the lawn . [They]5185-they were going for a morning dip , and [a servant]5186-a servant followed [them]5185-they with [their]5185-they bathing - dresses . [She]246-margaret had meant to take a stroll [herself]246-margaret before breakfast , but saw that the day was still sacred to [men]597-men , and amused [herself]246-margaret by watching [their]597-men contretemps . In the first place the key of [the bathing - shed]5188-the bathing - shed could not be found . [Charles]249-charles stood by the riverside with folded hands , tragical , while [the servant]2474-the servant shouted , and was misunderstood by [another servant in [the garden]562-the garden]5190-another servant in the garden . Then came a difficulty about a spring - board , and soon [three people]5192-three people were running backwards and forwards over [the meadow]580-the meadow , with orders and counter orders and recriminations and apologies . If [Margaret]246-margaret wanted to jump from [a motor - car]4811-a motor - car , [she]246-margaret jumped ; if [Tibby]250-tibby thought paddling would benefit [his]250-tibby ankles , [he]250-tibby paddled ; if [a clerk]1632-a clerk desired adventure , [he]250-tibby took a walk in the dark . But [these athletes]5196-these athletes seemed paralysed . [They]5196-these athletes could not bathe without [their]5196-these athletes appliances , though the morning sun was calling and the last mists were rising from [the dimpling stream]5197-the dimpling stream . Had [they]5196-these athletes found the life of the body after all ? [She]246-margaret thought of the bathing arrangements as they should be in [her]246-margaret day — no worrying of [servants]3779-servants , no appliances , beyond good sense . [Her]246-margaret reflections were disturbed by [the quiet child]2493-the quiet child , who had come out to speak to the cat , but was now watching [her]246-margaret watch [the men]1459-the men . [She]246-margaret called , "[2206-that woman] Good - morning , [dear]629-dear , " a little sharply . [Her]246-margaret voice spread consternation . " "[0-i] — On the bed — tissue - paper — " Gathering that the wedding - dress was on view , and that a visit would be seemly , [she]246-margaret went to [[Evie]253-evie 's room]5205-evie 's room . All was hilarity [here]575-here . " Then [Margaret]246-margaret went down to breakfast . [Henry]349-henry was already installed ; [he]349-henry ate slowly and spoke little , and was , in [Margaret]246-margaret 's eyes , [the only member of [[their]2563-we party]3891-their party who dodged emotion successfully]5209-the only member of their party who dodged emotion successfully . Yet [he]349-henry dwelt intact , only issuing orders occasionally — orders that promoted the comfort of [[his]349-henry guests]2464-his guests . " It was n't genuine tact , but it was tact , of a sort — the sort that is as useful as the genuine , and saves even more situations at Board meetings . " "[629-dear] [I]0-i was afraid something had gone wrong . " "[0-i] No ; [I]0-i have nothing to say , but [you]0-i may talk . " Glancing at [his]349-henry watch , [he]349-henry talked of the nasty curve at the lych - gate . [She]246-margaret heard [him]349-henry with interest . [Her]246-margaret surface could always respond to [his]349-henry without contempt , though all [her]246-margaret deeper being might be yearning to help [him]349-henry . [She]246-margaret had abandoned any plan of action . Love is the best , and the more [she]246-margaret let [herself]246-margaret love [him]349-henry , the more chance was there that [he]349-henry would set [his]349-henry soul in order . Such a moment as this , when [they]5217-they sat under fair weather by the walks of [[their]5217-they future home]5218-their future home , was so sweet to [her]246-margaret that its sweetness would surely pierce to [him]349-henry . Each lift of [his]349-henry eyes , each parting of the thatched lip from [the clean - shaven]5219-the clean - shaven , must prelude the tenderness that kills [the Monk]5220-the monk and [the Beast]5221-the beast at a single blow . Disappointed a hundred times , [she]246-margaret still hoped . [She]246-margaret loved [him]349-henry with too clear a vision to fear [his]349-henry cloudiness . [Margaret]246-margaret knew what had happened [there]3835-there , for it happened at [Wickham Place]9-wickham place . [Henry]349-henry gave [him]5238-the butler the keys , and handed [Margaret]246-margaret down [the cellar - stairs]5239-the cellar - stairs . Two doors were unlocked . " [she]246-margaret cried , and [the two men]1385-the two men were suddenly drawn into brotherhood , and exchanged smiles . [She]246-margaret felt as if [she]246-margaret had again jumped out of [the car]1354-the car while it was moving . [Certainly Oniton]246-margaret would take some digesting . Everything went like one o'clock . [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill materialized out of space , and was waiting for [[his]410-mr. cahill bride]1359-his bride at the [church]5032-church door . [No one]693-no one dropped the ring or mispronounced the responses , or trod on [[Evie]253-evie 's train]5253-evie 's train , or cried . [Margaret]246-margaret was convinced that [they]5254-the clergymen had not been married at all , and that [the Norman church]5256-the norman church had been intent all the time on other business . There were more documents to sign at [the house]558-the house , and the breakfast to eat , and then [a few more people]5258-a few more people dropped in for the garden party . There had been a great many refusals , and after all it was not a very big affair — not as big as [Margaret]246-margaret 's would be . [She]246-margaret noted the dishes and the strips of red carpet , that outwardly [she]246-margaret might give [Henry]349-henry what was proper . But inwardly [she]246-margaret hoped for something better than this blend of Sunday church and fox - hunting . If only [someone]3777-someone had been upset ! But this wedding had gone off so particularly well—"quite[2580-we] like a Durbar " in the opinion of [Lady Edser]460-lady edser , and [she]246-margaret thoroughly agreed with [her]246-margaret . Everything had gone off so well . And [she]246-margaret [herself]246-margaret — hovering as usual between [the two]1141-the two , now accepting [men]597-men as [they]597-men are , now yearning with [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister for Truth . [His]2649-he was a slap - dash method , but [the world]805-the world has been built slap - dash , and the beauty of mountain and [river]2657-river and sunset may be but the varnish with which [the unskilled artificer]2658-the unskilled artificer hides [his]2658-the unskilled artificer joins . [Oniton]246-margaret , like [herself]245-helen , was imperfect . [Its]246-margaret apple - trees were stunted , [[its]246-margaret castle]2517-its castle ruinous . It , too , had suffered in the border warfare between [the Anglo Saxon]2660-the anglo saxon and [the Kelt]472-the kelt , between things as they are and as they ought to be . Once more [the west]5138-the west was retreating , once again the orderly stars were dotting the eastern sky . There is certainly no rest for [us]2662-us on [the earth]4343-the earth . But there is happiness , and as [Margaret]246-margaret descended the mound on [[her]246-margaret lover]4618-her lover 's arm , [she]246-margaret felt that [she]246-margaret was having [her]246-margaret share . "[246-margaret] said [Margaret]246-margaret innocently . " Has [she]246-margaret ever seen [you]4053-madam before ? "[246-margaret] " Seen [Hen]483-hen before ! "[314-jacky] said [Jacky]314-jacky . [You]246-margaret wait — Still [we]5330-we love ['em]483-hen . "[314-jacky] " Are [you]246-margaret now satisfied ? "[349-henry] [Henry]349-henry asked . " "[5128-the colonel] When , please ? " "[5128-the colonel] Ten years ago . " [She]246-margaret left [him]5128-the colonel without a word . For it was not [her]246-margaret tragedy : it was [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox 's . [Helen]245-helen began to wonder why [she]245-helen had spent a matter of eight pounds in making [some people]882-some people ill and [others]3837-others angry . Now that the wave of excitement was ebbing , and had left [her]245-helen , [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast , and [Mrs. Bast]384-mrs. bast stranded for the night in [a Shropshire hotel]5344-a shropshire hotel , [she]245-helen asked [herself]245-helen what forces had made the wave flow . At all events , no harm was done . "[5128-the colonel] [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles is so illogical , " [she]245-helen explained to [Leonard]308-leonard , who had put [[his]308-leonard wife]4328-his wife to bed , and was sitting with [her]4328-his wife in [the empty coffee - room]5348-the empty coffee - room . " "[0-i] [I]0-i can never thank [you]2680-you sufficiently , [Miss Schlegel]245-helen , " was all that [Leonard]308-leonard felt equal to . "[245-helen] [I]0-i believe in personal responsibility . Do n't [you]2680-you ? And in personal everything . [I]0-i hate — [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought n't to say that — but [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes are on the wrong tack surely . Perhaps the little thing that says ' [I]0-i ' is missing out of the middle of [their]251-the wilcoxes heads , and then it 's a waste of time to blame [them]251-the wilcoxes . ' Had [you]2680-you heard that ? " "[2680-you] [I]0-i get no time for reading . " "[2680-you] Had [you]2680-you thought it , then ? That there are two kinds of people — [our]2681-us kind , who live straight from the middle of [their]251-the wilcoxes heads , and the other kind who ca n't , because [their]251-the wilcoxes heads have no middle ? " "[2685-egoists] Oh , no , that 's wrong , " replied [Helen]245-helen . "[2685-egoists] [No superman]2686-no superman ever said ' [I]0-i want , ' because ' [I]0-i want ' must lead to the question , ' Who am [I]0-i ? ' and so to Pity and to Justice . [He]0-i only says ' want . ' ' Want Europe , ' if [he]0-i 's [Napoleon]276-napoleon ; ' want [wives]2687-wives , ' if [he]0-i 's [Bluebeard]486-bluebeard ; ' want [Botticelli]487-botticelli , ' if [he]0-i 's [Pierpont Morgan]484-pierpont morgan . " "[249-charles] Quite so , quite so , " [he]308-leonard agreed . [Helen]245-helen asked [herself]245-helen why [she]245-helen had snubbed [him]308-leonard . If so , it was disgusting of [her]245-helen . But [he]308-leonard was thinking the snub quite natural . Everything [she]245-helen did was natural , and incapable of causing offence . While [the Miss Schlegels]261-the schlegels were together [he]308-leonard had felt [them]5350-them scarcely human — a sort of admonitory whirligig . But [a Miss Schlegel]245-helen alone was different . [She]245-helen was in [Helen]245-helen 's case unmarried , in [Margaret]246-margaret 's about to be married , in neither case an echo of [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister . [Helen]245-helen had become "[2690-his] [his]2690-his " [Miss Schlegel , who scolded [him]308-leonard and corresponded with [him]308-leonard , and had swept down yesterday with grateful vehemence]245-helen . [Margaret]246-margaret , though not unkind , was severe and remote . [He]308-leonard would not presume to help [her]246-margaret , for instance . [He]308-leonard had never liked [her]246-margaret , and began to think that [his]308-leonard original impression was true , and that [[her]245-helen sister]545-her sister did not like [her]245-helen either . [Helen]245-helen was certainly lonely . [She]245-helen , who gave away so much , was receiving too little . [Leonard]308-leonard was pleased to think that [he]308-leonard could spare [her]245-helen vexation by holding [his]308-leonard tongue and concealing what [he]308-leonard knew about [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles . [Jacky]314-jacky had announced [her]245-helen discovery when [he]314-jacky fetched [her]245-helen from [the lawn]579-the lawn . By now [he]314-jacky had no illusions about [[his]314-jacky wife]4328-his wife , and this was only one new stain on the face of a love that had never been pure . "[0-i] Do n't [you]2712-you worry , " [he]0-i pleaded . "[2712-you] [I]0-i ca n't bear that . [We]2715-we shall be all right if [I]0-i get work . [I]0-i can imagine that with regular work [we]2715-we should settle down again . It stops one thinking . " "[0-i] Settle down to what ? " "[0-i] Oh , just settle down . " "[0-i] And that 's to be life ! " said [Helen]245-helen , with a catch in [her]245-helen throat . "[0-i] How can [you]0-i , with all the beautiful things to see and do — with music — with walking at night — " "[0-i] Walking is well enough when [a man]3695-a man 's in work , " [he]0-i answered . "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i did talk a lot of nonsense once , but there 's nothing like [a bailiff in [the house]558-the house]2717-a bailiff in the house to drive it out of [you]2712-you . [My]0-i books are back again , thanks to [you]2712-you , but they 'll never be the same to [me]0-i again , and [I]0-i sha n't ever again think night in [the woods]2719-the woods is wonderful . " "[0-i] Why not ? " asked [Helen]245-helen , throwing up the window . "[0-i] Because [I]0-i see [one]559-one must have money . " "[0-i] Well , [you]0-i 're wrong . " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was wrong , but — [the clergyman]2721-the clergyman — [he]2721-the clergyman has money of [his]2721-the clergyman own , or else [he]2721-the clergyman 's paid ; [the poet]929-the poet or [the musician]2723-the musician — just the same ; [the tramp]2724-the tramp — [he]2724-the tramp 's no different . [The tramp]2724-the tramp goes to [the workhouse]2726-the workhouse in the end , and is paid for with [other people]3813-other people 's money . [Miss Schlegel]245-helen , the real thing 's money and all the rest is a dream . " "[245-helen] [You]0-i 're still wrong . [You]0-i 've forgotten [Death]491-death . " [Leonard]308-leonard could not understand . "[0-i] If [we]2728-we lived for ever what [you]0-i say would be true . But [we]2728-we have to die , [we]2728-we have to leave life presently . Injustice and greed would be the real thing if [we]2728-we lived for ever . As it is , [we]2728-we must hold to other things , because Death is coming . [I]0-i love [Death]491-death — not morbidly , but because [He]2724-the tramp explains . [He]2724-the tramp shows [me]0-i the emptiness of Money . [Death]491-death and [Money]492-money are the eternal foes . Not [Death]491-death and Life . Never mind what lies behind [Death]491-death , [Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast , but be sure that [the poet]929-the poet and [the musician]2723-the musician and [the tramp]2724-the tramp will be happier in it than the man who has never learnt to say , ' [I]0-i am [I.]0-i ' " "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder . " "[0-i] [We]2728-we are all in a mist — [I]0-i know but [I]0-i can help [you]2732-you this far — [men like [the Wilcoxes]251-the wilcoxes]576-men like the wilcoxes are deeper in the mist than any . [Sane , sound Englishmen]2734-sane , sound englishmen ! building up empires , levelling [all the world]2735-all the world into what [they]2734-sane , sound englishmen call common sense . But mention [Death]491-death to [them]2734-sane , sound englishmen and [they]2734-sane , sound englishmen 're offended , because [Death]491-death 's really [Imperial]493-imperial , and [He]491-death cries out against [them]2734-sane , sound englishmen for ever . " "[491-death] [I]0-i am as afraid of [Death]491-death as [any one]4035-any one . " "[491-death] But not of the idea of [Death]491-death . " "[491-death] But what is the difference ? " "[491-death] Infinite difference , " said [Helen]245-helen , more gravely than before . [Leonard]308-leonard looked at [her]245-helen wondering , and had the sense of great things sweeping out of the shrouded night . But [he]308-leonard could not receive them , because [his]308-leonard heart was still full of little things . As the lost umbrella had spoilt the concert at [Queen 's Hall]47-queen 's hall , so the lost situation was obscuring the diviner harmonies now . [Death]491-death , Life and Materialism were fine words , but would [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles take [him]308-leonard on as [a clerk]1632-a clerk ? Talk as [one]559-one would , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles was king of [this world]4550-this world , [the superman]5372-the superman , with [his]249-charles own morality , whose head remained in the clouds . "[491-death] [I]0-i must be stupid , " [he]249-charles said apologetically . While to [Helen]245-helen the paradox became clearer and clearer . "[491-death] [Death]491-death destroys [a man]3695-a man : the idea of [Death]491-death saves [him]3695-a man . " Behind the coffins and the skeletons that stay the vulgar mind lies something so immense that all that is great in [us]5373-us responds to it . [Men of [the world]805-the world]5374-men of the world may recoil from [the charnel - house that [they]5374-men of the world will one day enter]5376-the charnel - house that they will one day enter , but [Love]434-love knows better . [Death]491-death is [[his]3695-a man foe]5377-his foe , but [[his]3695-a man peer]5378-his peer , and in [their]5379-their age - long struggle the thews of Love have been strengthened , and [his]3695-a man vision cleared , until there is [no one who can stand against [him]3695-a man]5380-no one who can stand against him . "[491-death] So never give in , " continued [the girl]3912-the girl , and restated again and again the vague yet convincing plea that [the Invisible]494-the invisible lodges against [the Visible]495-the visible . [Her]3912-the girl excitement grew as [she]3912-the girl tried to cut the rope that fastened [Leonard]308-leonard to [the earth]4343-the earth . [Woven]496-woven of bitter experience , it resisted [her]3912-the girl . Presently [the waitress]5383-the waitress entered and gave [her]3912-the girl a letter from [Margaret]246-margaret . Another note , addressed to [Leonard]308-leonard , was inside . [They]5379-their read them , listening to the murmurings of [the river]4199-the river . For many hours [Margaret]246-margaret did nothing ; then [she]246-margaret controlled [herself]246-margaret , and wrote some letters . [She]246-margaret was too bruised to speak to [Henry]349-henry ; [she]246-margaret could pity [him]349-henry , and even determine to marry [him]349-henry , but as yet all lay too deep in [her]246-margaret heart for speech . On the surface the sense of [his]349-henry degradation was too strong . [She]246-margaret could not command voice or look , and the gentle words that [she]246-margaret forced out through [her]246-margaret pen seemed to proceed from [some other person]5385-some other person . "[2738-my dearest boy] [[My]0-i dearest boy]2738-my dearest boy , " [she]246-margaret began , "[2738-my dearest boy] this is not to part [us]2739-us . It is everything or nothing , and [I]0-i mean it to be nothing . It happened long before [we]2739-us ever met , and even if it had happened since , [I]0-i should be writing the same , [I]0-i hope . [I]0-i do understand . " But [she]246-margaret crossed out "[0-i] [I]0-i do understand " ; it struck a false note . [Henry]349-henry could not bear to be understood . [She]246-margaret also crossed out , "[0-i] It is everything or nothing . " [Henry]349-henry would resent so strong a grasp of the situation . [She]246-margaret must not comment ; comment is unfeminine . "[0-i] [I]0-i think that 'll about do , " [she]246-margaret thought . Then the sense of [his]349-henry degradation choked [her]246-margaret . Was [he]349-henry worth all this bother ? To have yielded to [a woman of that sort]5386-a woman of that sort was everything , yes , it was , and [she]246-margaret could not be [[his]349-henry wife]4328-his wife . [She]246-margaret tried to translate [his]349-henry temptation into [her]246-margaret own language , and [her]246-margaret brain reeled . [Men]597-men must be different , even to want to yield to such a temptation . [Her]246-margaret belief in comradeship was stifled , and [she]246-margaret saw life as from that glass saloon on [the Great Western]210-the great western , which sheltered male and female alike from the fresh air . Are the sexes really races , each with its own code of morality , and [their]597-men mutual love a mere device of Nature to keep things going ? Strip human intercourse of the proprieties , and is it reduced to this ? [Her]246-margaret judgment told [her]246-margaret no . [She]246-margaret knew that out of [Nature]344-nature 's device [we]5389-we have built a magic that will win [us]5389-we immortality . Far more mysterious than the call of sex to sex is the tenderness that [we]5389-we throw into that call ; far wider is the gulf between [us]5389-we and [the farmyard]1825-the farmyard than between [the farm - yard]5391-the farm - yard and the garbage that nourishes it . [We]5389-we are evolving , in ways that Science can not measure , to ends that [Theology]435-theology dares not contemplate . "[0-i] [Men]597-men did produce one jewel , " [the gods]4638-the gods will say , and , saying , will give [us]5389-we immortality . [Margaret]246-margaret knew all this , but for the moment [she]246-margaret could not feel it , and transformed the marriage of [Evie]253-evie and [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill into a carnival of [fools]5393-fools , and [her]246-margaret own marriage — too miserable to think of that , [she]246-margaret tore up the letter , and then wrote another : [Dear Mr. Bast]309-mr. bast , [I]597-men have spoken to [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles about [you]309-mr. bast , as [I]597-men promised , and am sorry to say that [he]249-charles has no vacancy for [you]309-mr. bast . [They]5413-they had behaved as if nothing had happened , and [her]246-margaret deepest instincts told [her]246-margaret that this was wrong . For [his]349-henry own sake , some explanation was due . When [[men]597-men like [us]5418-us]5417-men like us , it is for [our]5418-us better qualities , and however tender [their]597-men liking , [we]5418-us dare not be unworthy of it , or [they]597-men will quietly let [us]5418-us go . But unworthiness stimulates [woman]4329-woman . It brings out [her]4329-woman deeper nature , for good or for evil . Here was the core of the question . [Henry]349-henry must be forgiven , and made better by love ; nothing else mattered . As is [Man]3767-man to [the Universe]3903-the universe , so was the mind of [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles to the minds of [some men]2790-some men — a concentrated light upon a tiny spot , a little Ten Minutes moving self - contained through its appointed years . [Margaret]246-margaret had heard a certain rumour , but was all right . [She]246-margaret had forgiven [him]0-i , [God]281-god bless [her]246-margaret , and [he]0-i felt [the manlier]2793-the manlier for it . [Charles]249-charles and [Evie]253-evie had not heard it , and never must hear . No more must [Paul]247-paul . Over [[his]247-paul children]3840-his children [he]247-paul felt great tenderness , which [he]247-paul did not try to track to a cause : [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox was too far back in [his]247-paul life . [He]247-paul did not connect [her]248-mrs. wilcox with the sudden aching love that [he]247-paul felt for [Evie]253-evie . [Poor little Evie]253-evie ! [he]247-paul trusted that [Cahill]410-mr. cahill would make [her]253-evie [a decent husband]2795-a decent husband . And [Margaret]246-margaret ? How did [she]246-margaret stand ? [She]246-margaret had several minor worries . Clearly [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister had heard something . [She]246-margaret dreaded meeting [her]545-her sister in [town]4259-town . And [she]246-margaret was anxious about [Leonard]308-leonard , for whom [they]2798-they certainly were responsible . Nor ought [Mrs. Bast]384-mrs. bast to starve . But the main situation had not altered . [She]246-margaret still loved [Henry]349-henry . [His]349-henry actions , not [his]349-henry disposition , had disappointed [her]246-margaret , and [she]246-margaret could bear that . And [she]246-margaret loved [[her]246-margaret future [home]3928-home]2450-her future home . Standing up in [the car]1354-the car , just where [she]246-margaret had leapt from [it]1354-the car two days before , [she]246-margaret gazed back with deep emotion upon [Oniton]246-margaret . Besides [the Grange]2523-the grange and [the Castle keep]2803-the castle keep , [she]246-margaret could now pick out [the church]4293-the church and the black - and - white gables of [the George]390-the george . There was [the bridge]4586-the bridge , and [the river]4199-the river nibbling [[its]4199-the river green peninsula]2807-its green peninsula . [She]246-margaret could even see [the bathing - shed]5188-the bathing - shed , but while [she]246-margaret was looking for [Charles]249-charles 's new springboard , [the forehead of [the hill]2536-the hill]2809-the forehead of the hill rose up and hid the whole scene . [She]246-margaret never saw it again . Day and night [the river]4199-the river flows down into [England]31-england , day after day the sun retreats into [the Welsh mountains]2812-the welsh mountains , and [the tower]2813-the tower chimes , " See [the Conquering Hero]5460-the conquering hero . "[3809-the wilcoxes] But [the Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes have no part in [the place]2298-the place , nor in [any place]2816-any place . It is not [their]3809-the wilcoxes names that recur in [the parish register]2817-the parish register . It is not [[their]3809-the wilcoxes ghosts]2818-their ghosts that sigh among the alders at evening . [They]3809-the wilcoxes have swept into [the valley]2819-the valley and swept out of [it]2819-the valley , leaving a little dust and a little money behind . [Tibby]250-tibby was now approaching [his]250-tibby last year at [Oxford]88-oxford . [He]250-tibby had moved out of college , and was contemplating [the Universe]212-the universe , or such portions of it as concerned [him]250-tibby , from [[his]250-tibby comfortable lodgings in [Long Wall]213-long wall]2820-his comfortable lodgings in long wall . [He]250-tibby was not concerned with much . When [a young man]3805-a young man is untroubled by passions and sincerely indifferent to public opinion , [his]3805-a young man outlook is necessarily limited . [Tibby]250-tibby neither wished to strengthen the position of [the rich]935-the rich nor to improve that of [the poor]3941-the poor , and so was well content to watch the elms nodding behind [the mildly embattled parapets of [Magdalen]214-magdalen]2824-the mildly embattled parapets of magdalen . There are worse lives . Though selfish , [he]250-tibby was never cruel ; though affected in manner , [he]250-tibby never posed . Like [Margaret]246-margaret , [he]250-tibby disdained the heroic equipment , and it was only after many visits that [men]597-men discovered [Schlegel]246-margaret to possess a character and a brain . [He]250-tibby had done well in Mods , much to the surprise of [those who attended lectures and took proper exercise]2826-those who attended lectures and took proper exercise , and was now glancing disdainfully at [Chinese]501-chinese in case [he]250-tibby should some day consent to qualify as [a Student Interpreter]2827-a student interpreter . To [him]250-tibby thus employed [Helen]245-helen entered . A telegram had preceded [her]245-helen . [He]250-tibby noticed , in a distant way , that [[his]250-tibby sister]4364-his sister had altered . As a rule [he]250-tibby found [her]4364-his sister too pronounced , and had never come across this look of appeal , pathetic yet dignified — the look of [a sailor who has lost everything at [sea]2164-sea]2829-a sailor who has lost everything at sea . " [I]4364-his sister have come from [Oniton]246-margaret , "[4364-his sister] [she]4364-his sister began . " There has been a great deal of trouble there . "[4364-his sister] " Who 's for lunch ? "[250-tibby] said [Tibby]250-tibby , picking up the claret , which was warming in the hearth . [Helen]245-helen sat down submissively at the table . " Why such an early start ? "[4364-his sister] " [I]2831-the landlady do n't know what 's to be done , [Tibby]250-tibby . " Not there , "[245-helen] said [Helen]245-helen , and burst into tears . " And ruined [two people]5465-two people 's lives . And goes about saying that personal actions count for nothing , and there always will be rich and poor . "[0-i] [I]0-i come now to the business that took [us]2837-our to [Oniton]246-margaret . [We]2837-our went all three . [He]250-tibby had never been interested in [human beings]820-human beings , for which one must blame [him]250-tibby , but [he]250-tibby had had rather too much of them at [Wickham Place]9-wickham place . Similar questions had vexed [him]250-tibby from infancy , and at [Oxford]88-oxford [he]250-tibby had learned to say that the importance of [human beings]820-human beings has been vastly overrated by [specialists]2851-specialists . The epigram , with its faint whiff of the eighties , meant nothing . But [he]250-tibby might have let it off now if [[his]250-tibby sister]4364-his sister had not been ceaselessly beautiful . " [You]245-helen see , [Helen]245-helen — have a cigarette — [I]250-tibby do n't see what [I]250-tibby 'm to do . "[250-tibby] " Then there 's nothing to be done . "[250-tibby] " Good God alive ! "[250-tibby] said [Tibby]250-tibby , and went crimson . " Now , what is the good of [driblets]5478-driblets ? To go through life having done one thing — to have raised [one person]5479-one person from [the abyss]933-the abyss : not these puny gifts of shillings and blankets — making the grey more grey . No doubt [people]3797-people will think [me]250-tibby extraordinary . "[250-tibby] " [I]250-tibby do n't care a damn what [people]3797-people think ! " [I]2853-you have far too much , and [we]5483-we settled at [Chelsea]123-chelsea last spring that three hundred a year is necessary to set [a man]3695-a man on [his]3695-a man feet . "[250-tibby] [He]250-tibby walked with [her]2855-i to [the station]3708-the station , passing through [those streets whose serried beauty]2857-those streets whose serried beauty never bewildered [him]250-tibby and never fatigued . [The lovely creature]2858-the lovely creature raised domes and spires into the cloudless blue , and only the ganglion of vulgarity round [Carfax]506-carfax showed how evanescent was the phantom , how faint its claim to represent [England]31-england . [Helen]245-helen , rehearsing [her]245-helen commission , noticed nothing : the Basts were in [her]245-helen brain , and [she]245-helen retold the crisis in a meditative way , which might have made [other men]975-other men curious . [She]245-helen was seeing whether it would hold . [He]250-tibby asked [her]245-helen once why [she]245-helen had taken [the Basts]394-the basts right into the heart of [Evie]253-evie 's wedding . [She]245-helen stopped like a frightened animal and said , " Does that seem to [you]250-tibby so odd ? "[245-helen] [Her]245-helen eyes , the hand laid on the mouth , quite haunted [him]250-tibby , until they were absorbed into the figure of [St. Mary the Virgin]507-st. mary the virgin , before whom [he]250-tibby paused for a moment on the walk [home]3928-home . It is convenient to follow [him]250-tibby in the discharge of [his]250-tibby duties . [Margaret]246-margaret summoned [him]250-tibby the next day . [She]246-margaret was terrified at [Helen]245-helen 's flight , and [he]250-tibby had to say that [she]246-margaret had called in at [Oxford]88-oxford . Then [she]246-margaret said : " Did [she]246-margaret seem worried at any rumour about [Henry]349-henry ? "[246-margaret] [He]250-tibby answered , " Yes . "[246-margaret] " [I]246-margaret knew it was that ! "[246-margaret] [she]246-margaret exclaimed . " [I]246-margaret 'll write to [her]246-margaret . "[246-margaret] [Tibby]250-tibby was relieved . [He]250-tibby then sent the cheque to the address that [Helen]245-helen gave [him]250-tibby , and stated that later on [he]250-tibby was instructed to forward five thousand pounds . An answer came back , very civil and quiet in tone — such an answer as [Tibby]250-tibby [himself]250-tibby would have given . The cheque was returned , the legacy refused , [the writer]2861-the writer being in no need of money . [Tibby]250-tibby forwarded this to [Helen]245-helen , adding in the fulness of [his]250-tibby heart that [Leonard Bast]308-leonard seemed somewhat [a monumental person after all]2862-a monumental person after all . [Helen]245-helen 's reply was frantic . [He]250-tibby was to take no notice . [He]250-tibby was to go down at once and say that [she]245-helen commanded acceptance . [He]250-tibby went . A scurf of books and china ornaments awaited [them]2863-them . [The Basts]394-the basts had just been evicted for not paying [their]2863-them rent , and had wandered [no one]693-no one knew whither . [Helen]245-helen had begun bungling with [her]245-helen money by this time , and had even sold out [her]245-helen shares in [the Nottingham and Derby Railway]681-the nottingham and derby railway . For some weeks [she]245-helen did nothing . Then [she]245-helen reinvested , and , owing to the good advice of [[her]245-helen stockbrokers]2866-her stockbrokers , became rather richer than [she]245-helen had been before . [Houses]884-houses have [their]884-houses own ways of dying , falling as variously as the generations of [men]597-men , some with a tragic roar , some quietly , but to an after - life in [the city of ghosts]2869-the city of ghosts , while from [others]3837-others — and thus was the death of [Wickham Place]9-wickham place — the spirit slips before the body perishes . [It]9-wickham place had decayed in the spring , disintegrating [the girls]686-the girls more than [they]686-the girls knew , and causing either to accost [unfamiliar regions]2872-unfamiliar regions . By [September]139-september [it]9-wickham place was a corpse , void of emotion , and scarcely hallowed by the memories of thirty years of happiness . Through [its]9-wickham place round - topped doorway passed furniture , and pictures , and books , until [the last room]2873-the last room was gutted and [the last van]2874-the last van had rumbled away . It stood for a week or two longer , open - eyed , as if astonished at [its]9-wickham place own emptiness . Then it fell . [Navvies]2875-navvies came , and spilt it back into the grey . With [their]2875-navvies muscles and [their]2875-navvies beery good temper , [they]2875-navvies were not [the worst of undertakers for [a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end]2877-a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end]2876-the worst of undertakers for a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end . The furniture , with a few exceptions , went down into [Hertfordshire]67-hertfordshire , [Mr. Wilcox]249-charles having most kindly offered [Howards End]339-margaret as [a warehouse]2878-a warehouse . [Mr. Bryce]448-mr. bryce had died abroad — an unsatisfactory affair — and as there seemed little guarantee that the rent would be paid regularly , [he]448-mr. bryce cancelled the agreement , and resumed possession [himself]448-mr. bryce . Until [he]448-mr. bryce relet [the house]558-the house , [the Schlegels]261-the schlegels were welcome to stack [their]2880-their furniture in [the garage]1318-the garage and [lower rooms]2882-lower rooms . [Margaret]246-margaret demurred , but [Tibby]250-tibby accepted the offer gladly ; it saved [him]250-tibby from coming to any decision about the future . The plate and the more valuable pictures found [a safer home in [London]2-london]2883-a safer home in london , but the bulk of the things went country - ways , and were entrusted to the guardianship of [Miss Avery]451-miss avery . Shortly before the move , [[our]2884-our hero]2885-our hero and [heroine]2886-heroine were married . [They]2887-they have weathered the storm , and may reasonably expect peace . [To have no illusions]2888-to have no illusions and yet to love — what stronger surety can [a woman]1002-a woman find ? [She]246-margaret had seen [[her]246-margaret husband]4099-her husband 's past as well as [his]4099-her husband heart . [She]246-margaret knew [her]246-margaret own heart with a thoroughness that [commonplace people]2891-commonplace people believe impossible . The heart of [Mrs. Wilcox]248-mrs. wilcox was alone hidden , and perhaps it is superstitious to speculate on the feelings of the dead . [They]2887-they were married quietly — really quietly , for as the day approached [she]246-margaret refused to go through another Oniton . [[Her]246-margaret brother]3702-her brother gave [her]246-margaret away , [[her]246-margaret aunt]613-her aunt , who was out of health , presided over a few colourless refreshments . [The Wilcoxes]3809-the wilcoxes were represented by [Charles]249-charles , who witnessed the marriage settlement , and by [Mr. Cahill]410-mr. cahill . [Paul]247-paul did send a cablegram . In a few minutes , and without the aid of music , [the clergyman]2721-the clergyman made [them]2887-they [man]3767-man and [wife]4688-wife , and soon the glass shade had fallen that cuts off [married couples from [the world]805-the world]2898-married couples from the world . [She]246-margaret , [a monogamist]2900-a monogamist , regretted the cessation of some of life 's innocent odours ; [he]3767-man , whose instincts were polygamous , felt morally braced by the change , and less liable to the temptations that had assailed [him]3767-man in the past . [They]2887-they spent [their]2887-they honeymoon near [Innsbruck]218-innsbruck . [Henry]349-henry knew of [a reliable hotel]2901-a reliable hotel [there]3835-there , and [Margaret]246-margaret hoped for a meeting with [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister . In this [she]246-margaret was disappointed . Evidently [she]245-helen disliked meeting [Henry]349-henry . Two months are surely enough to accustom [an outsider]2905-an outsider to a situation which [a wife]1332-a wife has accepted in two days , and [Margaret]246-margaret had again to regret [[her]246-margaret sister]545-her sister 's lack of self - control . In a long letter [she]246-margaret pointed out the need of charity in sexual matters : so little is known about [them]2908-them ; it is hard enough for [those who are personally touched to judge]2909-those who are personally touched to judge ; then how futile must be the verdict of Society . " [I]245-helen do n't say there is no standard , for that would destroy morality ; only that there can be no standard until [our]5487-our impulses are classified and better understood . "[245-helen] [Helen]245-helen thanked [her]246-margaret for [her]246-margaret kind letter — rather a curious reply . [Helen]245-helen left [him]249-charles time to grow skin over [his]249-charles wound . There were still moments when it pained [him]249-charles . [His]249-charles affection for [[his]249-charles present wife]2913-his present wife grew steadily .
